Reviews.Title: “Very central location”
Reviews.Author: Heather D
Reviews.Content: Best thing is the location! perfectly suited to all of barcelona's main attractions....within 5 - 15mins (mostly on metro) we were at la sagrada familia, camp nou, olympic village area, ramblas, passeig de garcia, gothic quarter, santa maria del mar, market, barceloneta..... we stayed for 2 nights as a couple, we didn't spend a huge amount of time in the hotel, opted to have breakfast out each morning just because this was what we preferred to do! hotel was very clean, staff were very friendly and helpful, there was a free business centre for printing off event tickets and boarding passes etc, they gave very accurate info about distances and best ways to get form a to b:) all rooms seem to have a balcony but didnt really use it was it was very noisy outside! all in all a great hotel for the price you pay and the location is worth a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Cestrian56
Reviews.Content: Given the relatively low price for our top floor room this was excellent value for money. The room was very spacious with a large and comfortable bed, an enormous bath and a lovely terrace although being next to a busy road suffered from traffic noise. The air con was quiet and effective. The lower price reflects the less touristy location but there is no problem getting the metro or bus 59 (which goes direct from the port to the hotel) and the area contains plenty of good restaurants such as the historic Velodromo Bar or Mariscco seafood both of which I would recommend. The Eixample area also contains many of the modernista (art nouveau) buildings including Gaudi's wonderful La Pedrera (get there early to avoid the queues) The breakfast cost €10 if you book it when registering and is reasonable if a bit crowded at times. Overall I would recommend the hotel as long as your priority is comfort and value rather than character.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: justine11670
Reviews.Content: lovely helpful staff and a great breakfast at a reasonable price - a boutique - ish feel , well appointed rooms with huge beds and lovely bathroom. The bar is small and friendly and not intimidating to sit and wait alone in - and the reception staff are very obliging, Clean, freshly done up and classy - recommended

Reviews.Title: “Helpful kitchen staff, nice Top Room on 10th floor”
Reviews.Author: rileyboo28
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel U232 after reading the good reviews on TA and we were not disappointed. The front desk staff were helpful in providing us directions, making our dinner reservation at La Pepita restaurant and booking our taxi to go to the airport (they speak good English). We booked the U232 room but when we smelled the room that had a hint of cigarette smoke (we requested a non-smoking room) we explained the situation to the front desk staff and they surprisingly upgraded us to the Top Room on the 10th floor...we were in for a treat! The room was clean, spacious and it had a balcony over looking the beautiful city of Barcelona. The furnishings seemed new, comfy bed and pillows. Bathroom was clean and I liked the rain shower. Daily breakfast was good although I did not notice a change in food selection (we stayed for 3 nights). I say that the kitchen staff were helpful because one morning when I was having breakfast, I accidentally cut my finger while slicing bread and it was fairly deep. The male staff quickly walked me inside their kitchen and called his lady colleague who helped me apply pressure on the cut as a lot of blood were coming out (apologies for being graphic). They immediately got the first aid kit and was applying pressure on my cut to stop the bleeding. They applied bandage and made sure I was ok. We did not understand each other as she was speaking in Spanish and I was speaking in English but that did not stop her from treating my wound. I was constantly thanking her (and the staff) because they were good samaritans in my eyes. I wish I got her name :(. Location wise, the hotel is walking distance to a train station but not a lot of restaurants nearby. My sister and I felt safe walking at night from the train station to the hotel. the lift comfortably fits two people inside with their own suitcase. I would definitely go back to this hotel if I were to visit Barcelona again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: redimpLincoln
Reviews.Content: Really pleased with our choice of hotel in Barcelona. Although not central, the metro is very close and we could get to all major attractions in the city centre within 20 minutes at the most and many things were within walking distance. We had an inner room which took a bit of getting used too with limited natural light but the bonus was that it was very quiet and had two bathrooms!! Staff were lovely, drinks and snacks very reasonably priced and breakfast was excellent.Free WiFi worked well .

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel for visiting Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Huskies92
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Hilton Diagonal Mar Barcelona before on business multiple times, the Hilton is a gorgeous hotel. U232 is no Hilton, but Hilton is pretty far from the city center and for on our recent family vacation trip to Spain, we stayed at U232 for our Barcelona stop. The location for U232 is very good, away from the craziness of Ramblas, but still within walking distance (15-20 minutes). Lots of good restaurant choices within 5 minute walk, and there is a grocery store nearby that you can stock up on water. The breakfast at U232 is fairly good too and if you buy the breakfast at check-in, they knock the price from 14 euro to 10. The room is tiny (which I expected for European hotels) and the shower didn’t work properly through our stay (that I didn’t expect). We had two bathrooms for our room (both were tiny), one has a shower/tub combo, the other has a shower, none of the shower had enough water pressure to work properly and I ended up having to hand hold the shower head to wash away the shampoo and soap. Would I stay at U232 again? If I am by myself on business, I will definite go back to the Hilton, if I am traveling with the family, that will a maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona Trip”
Reviews.Author: iosonoelena
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel. Great service Great rooms Good Location - walking distance (10/15minutes) from all sights. 2 minutes walk to metro station. IN very elegant and secure area of town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent U232”
Reviews.Author: Rob M
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 4 night stay for our wedding anniversary at the excellent U232. Wonderful decor, very clean, superb service from all the staff, great choice of breakfast and relaxing background music. We had a U232 room which had the biggest bed. Only 200Mts from the metro and the same to the bus stop. I would certainly not hesitate to stay there again. To all the staff at the hotel.....Thank you very much for helping to make our trip a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable and good value”
Reviews.Author: always-l
Reviews.Content: The hotel isnt in the heart of the main touristy areas, but in a nice quiet part of Barcelona - within walking distance of everything - an easy 5-10 minute walk to the main road where the "hop-on" tours stops and a short distance from bus # 59. The decor is contemporary with dark colors, cocktail bar in the front entrance. Easy jazz music playing softly throughout. Super fast free internet with a printer. Rooms were very modern. The place was immaculately clean. The staff were very pleasant, extremely friendly and obliging, helpful with directions, recommendations and other needs. Multilingual so I did not have to embarrass myself trying to speak Spanish. Restaurants, shops, cafes and supermarkets all nearby. From the service, to the room to the location, I could not fault the U232. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - gorgeous interiors, convenient location and excellent value for money,”
Reviews.Author: alex g
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at the U232 Hotel during a short city break, and thouroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel was situated in a convenient location for exploring the city and was only a 20 minute walk to la ramblas and other attractions. The hotel was decorated to a very high standard, and excellent value for money. We decided the standard of the hotel and value for money were worth the mere 20 minutes stroll in the sunshine instead of somewhere of a much lower standard and more expensive in the city centre. The hotel staff were friendly, approchable and happy to help and the decor of the hotel itself was of a very high standard. Our room was beautiful and hard to leave. We would definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and welcoming”
Reviews.Author: littlemissn99
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a girl's weekend - two tripple rooms - and were very pleasantly surprised. As we had gotten a really good deal online, we honestly didn't expect much, and we couldn't have been more wrong! The hotel is decorated really well, and is modern/contemporary. All the rooms were spotlessly clean, and everything looked like new. We were at the back of the hotel, and so didn't have a view at all from our window, and the room required the light on at all times, but this was not a problem at all, and in fact made it easier to sleep, as there was no noise from the street. The hotel is about 10 minutes via metro from the centre of Barcelona, but there was adequate transport routes virtually on the doorstep. We used the metro with no problems at all. Barcelona was absolutely stunning, and we will definitely be back - and would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Barcelona location; terrific, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gary W
Reviews.Content: Hotel U-232 has an unusual name, but it has wonderful people who are extremely helpful (with directions/tips/recommendations/ and general hotel needs). Location is great! Sort of in the center of a city, but nestled on the edge of very nice walkable neighborhoods. Very nice breakfast restaurant (breads/pastries/coffees) just across the street...extremely clean and well managed (Try the super-fresh orange juice!). Easy walks to good restaurants as well as inexpensive fast food if you wish. About a six -seven block walk to a very good flamenco show, and generally easy to get to the metro. Nice and easy level 5-10 minujte walk to main thoroughfare where the "hop-on" tours begin and end. Rooms were very modern, a bit small, but that's Europe! Highly recommended, safe and easily accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Could not fault the hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Fooksie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel room spec - very friendly welcome from staff who are not only helpful but knowledgable about the area and amenities.We stayed for 3 nights in a U232 room with an enormous super king size bed and private terrace. Quiet outlook at the rear of the hotel away from the main road. Breakfast was plentiful and varied catering for most needs. Unable to fault anything about the hotel and the service we received and highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “I had 2 bathrooms!!”
Reviews.Author: Poodlealley
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Friendly staff. Speedy laundry service. I had 2 great bathrooms. No idea why. Probably it was the 2 bed thing. Close to metro. Great breakfast. Loved Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “City Break”
Reviews.Author: RBC123 Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Comfy beds. Easy access to both metro and buses. Staff at reception very pleasant and helpful. Restaurants, shops, cafes and supermarkets nearby. More Positives Good nights sleep free internet access with a printer for the residents gym on 10th floor with the added bonus of an open air leisure area beside it. Negatives A little out from La Rambla and beach. However a number 59 bus provided quick and easy access.

Reviews.Title: “A Barcelona Gem!”
Reviews.Author: LaiC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the U232 Hotel from the 12th to the 15th of March 2012. We found the hotel through Trip Advisor, and after reading some great reviews and seeing its very reasonable rates, we decided to book it. We got the train from the airport to Barcelona Sants (which was only 20 mins), and then took a quick metro trip to the "Hospital Clinic" station. The U232 was only a quick stroll up the road, so it really couldn't have been easier to get to. The street it is on is really lovely. On entering the lobby, we both immediately started grinning! It was fabulous! The decor is very contemporary, with dark brown, black and cream colours, and soft jazzy music playing. The whole hotel is immaculately clean. The reception staff were very pleasant, and while the situation didn't arise in our trip, they did seem very approachable if you needed them. Our room was really lovely, and in keeping with the decor from the lobby. The bed was large very comfortable, and a large desk, above which was an LED tv! Unfortunately, the only English speaking channel was BBC World News, but to be honest, with all of Barcelona to explore, this really didn't matter! The bathroom was a great size - again, all black and brown marble - and the shower pressure was brilliant. The bathroom also had a proper hairdryer (unlike the usual tiny air blower in hotels) which I was delighted with! However, the room did not have its own iron and ironing board, but I presume you could get these from reception when needed. Probably the best part of our room was the balcony though! We completely were not expecting it to have one, but when I took a peek in the door of one or two other rooms as they were being cleaned, it seems that all rooms have balconies? Is this possible...? Anyway, it was a fine size balcony overlooking the street we had arrived on! As the weather was beautiful for our days there, we made good use of relaxing out there when we got the chance. The hotel also has the most beautiful terrace on the roof, complete with sun loungers, and some larger ones almost like beds (!) with soft jazzy music constantly playing in the background - extreme relaxation!! As for getting around Barcelona from this hotel, the metro station allows you access within minutes to anywhere in the city you would like to go. We got a T-10 metro ticket each as soon as we arrived, which allowed us 10 trips on any train or metro, including the train to and from the airport - it really is the best value transport ticket, and is available from all the automatic ticket machines. If at night you want to stay local, there are plenty of bars, restaurants, cafes, and tapas bars on the street the hotel is on which are really good! We found some great places to sit out with a glass of wine which were very reasonable! We didn't get breakfast in the hotel, but instead went to a cafe down the road every morning for croissants and pastries! Overall, I could not fault the U232. From the service, to the room to the location! Everything was top notch, and to be honest, I would have expected to have to pay a lot more for such an experience. Highly recommend this hotel - comfortable, classy, and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: happytraveller093
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights over New Year for the first of our honeymoons! The hotel was perfect with great service and great rooms. The location of the hotel is great for getting around the city and seeing all the areas. We definitley recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsNarron09
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 908 (top room). Beautiful room with king bed and very spacious bathroom. Has double sinks and very large shower/tub with rainfall shower head. Large double windows in the shower open onto the terrace. Terrace is a good size and has a nice view. However, because the terrace overlooks the street, traffic noise ( car horns in particular seem to be very popular in Barcelona) can be heard at all hours of the day and night from the room. Rooms are supposed to be soundproof, but outside noise and any movement made by your fellow hotel guests are very noticeable, especially doors closing in the hall. Front desk staff were very friendly, as were all employees. Ordered room service one night. It came fairly quickly and the food was good. Couldn't find a drink or ice machine anywhere so it is advisable to stock up on water and soda. Mini fridge in room does not keep things very cold though. Door handle on bathroom door came off several times. Hotel is outside of the touristy areas so dinner options are somewhat limited. Hotel is very close to metro stop though. Metro system in the city is wonderful and after a ride or two, is very easy to understand and navigate. Would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: jayrano
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our trip to Barcelona for our 1st anniversary. Small but stylish room with a balcony and the hotel was only a block or so from the metro. And everything we did was within 4 metro stops so while not located in the city center the hotel is definitely in a great spot. The neighborhood was wonderful -- there were cafes, bars and excellent restaurants all within walking distance. The staff was nice and generally helpful but they did forget to give us our wake-up call on the day we left. That was the only negative of the hotel. I would definitely stay there and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in a very useful location”
Reviews.Author: Peter R
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel as a young couple in March 2012, with high expectations following a number of positive reviews. We were not disappointed. The hotel was modern, clean and the reception staff were helpful when we had any questions. The real selling point of this hotel for us was the location. The hotel is away from the main tourist areas; so avoids the associated problems of excess noise and the dreaded pickpockets. The "Hospital Clinic" metro stop is only a few minutes walk from the front door, which gives access to the L5 line. This line runs through the centre of Barcelona and makes travel around the various areas of the city exceptionally easy. There are a number of restaurants within a short walk of the hotel - which we found to be significantly cheaper than the central areas, without a noticeable drop in standard. Transport to the hotel: To get to the hotel from the airport, the best bet is to walk to the airport train station. Tickets can be purchased from the machines before the barriers. I would recommend the "T10" ticket - which cost us €9.25 and allowed 10 journeys using; train, bus, tram and metro underground trains. If you get the train from the airport, which runs every 30 minutes, you can get off at Sants Estacio then change to the L5 line towards Vall d'Hebron and it is just two stops to Hospital Clinic.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel,great location,very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: helena g
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from the lovely U232 hotel in Barcelona after a four day break in this beautiful city.Ideally situated for the major sights and a peaceful haven away from the hustle and bustle of the city.Whilst there we suffered an unfortunate experience while out one evening and the hotel staff, particularly Manuel pesich,went out of their way to help us.Their kindness and understanding is something we will never forget.We would recommend this hotel to anyone and hope to return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and comfortable with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve from Bristol
Reviews.Content: Barcelona is a beautiful city with hundreds of hotels so choosing one for our first visit, a Christmas present from our children, was no easy task. Luckily they booked U232, a small friendly ‘boutique’ hotel situated just a few yards from the excellent Metro. The entrance is cool and stylish, the staff really helpful and friendly. Our room on the 8th floor was a reasonable size with well equipped bathroom, large comfortable bed, huge flat screen TV and a balcony. In the summer some rooms have furniture on the balcony and whilst there is little to see it offers a refreshing resting place. The bar man was great and mixed some wicked cocktails, prices not bad for a good hotel in a major city. Room service Club sandwich was awesome. Breakfast spread was also generous and tasty. Location was excellent with easy access to the metro so all areas of the city. Transport costs in Barcelona are really cheap (we paid less than 1 Euro each to travel from the airport to the hotel. Compared to London that is amazing value). We also went to Camp Neu for a lesson on how football should be played (Barcelona won), the hotel was a 25 minute walk away. We will return to Barca and we will stay at U232 and when we travel we will look out for NN hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: dparkins111
Reviews.Content: On a 4 day visit to Barcelona delighted to have chosen this hotel. Great room (superior), excellent breakfast, very modern and clean, friendly front of house staff and an ideal location near the Metro but close enough to the main sites of Barcelona without the noise and crowds. Pleasant district with ample snack bars and restaurants. Would definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: WestVanDebbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nicely finished. The entrance to the hotel has lovely wood and glass doors. We found the reception to be very friendly and helpful. The lobby bar is small but open plan. Our room was a top room #908, we had a very large balcony with couch and 2 wicker and cushioned chairs plus a large table and chairs. The room did have a kettle and a supply of tea and coffee. There was a mini bar, hair dryer and wall mounted t.v. The bathroom is as big as the bedroom with a marble tub which could fit 3 people. The tub was great for lying in completely submerged, very oversized. The tub also had a rain shower, plus 2 other shower heads, one in each corner. We were there in late February, the weather was sunny but with a slight chill to the air. If the door was open we could hear the traffic, ambulances driving by but with the door closed it was extremely quiet. The metro was about 1 1/2 blocks away and is very easy to use. I purchased a single ticket with a 2 Euro coin (easier than bills) The metro was clean and each line colour coded, loved it! We enjoyed eating at Gusto down the street, more than a pizza place - fresh pasta and antipasto was amazing. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. If you are travelling in the summer - there are other hotels in this "group" that offer pools.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: seanyg
Reviews.Content: Excellent, stylish hotel, staffed by very friendly and helpful professionals. The rooms are modern and well appointed, with a good sized bathroom. Lots of cafes and restaurants within 5 minutes walking distance of the hotel, and the main city attractions are accessible within 20 minutes walk or via the metro system just a few minutes walk from the hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, beautiful rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Loveagoodbreak
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for a surprise trip for his 30th birthday. The rooms were a really good size, they were stylishly decorated with excellent showers and really comfortably beds. It felt like the place had only recently been refurbished but I don't think it had. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful, recommending some excellent places to eat and visit. The only slight negative would be that this is about a half hour walk from a lot of the central touristy places but to be honest that was a bonus for us as it was nice and quiet in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: irini_pl
Reviews.Content: i have just return from a 4 days trip to Barcelona and i was looking forward to write this review. I booked this hotel based on the reviews i have read and because it wasn't in the center of the city near to touristic areas and to be honest the hotel was the best choice of this trip. It is in a quiet area, near the metro station, a few good restaurants and bars are in the area where you can find only spanish people and not tourists. The staff can make you any resrvation for a restaurant or help you accordingly. The first impression when i arrived it was a cosy entrance and friendly staff (well done Manuel) the room was OK for single use (comfortable bed and pillows - clean - mini bar - big flat TV) and it was really quiet even it was near the elevator. The bathroom was clean and it had everything you may needed (the only thing missing in order to make it perfect was a pair of slippers), the shower was big and in marble. The breakfast was excellent, fresh fruits, a lot of choices and traditional mediterranean breakfast. The staff was also very helpful and kind. In the hotel there is free wi-fi connection so you can be online most of the time. if you decided to book a room there, note that you can negociate for the price. I made the reservation on November and when i contacted them by email, they gave me -10% on the internet rate + -10% for early booking. Certainly i return back in U232 for a 2nd visit!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with easy access to transport”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel , very close to metro or only 10-15 mins walk away to main tourist areas. Rooms were of good quality and very clean. Service was excellent with friendly helpful staff. In business area but did have a few good restaurants nearby with lots of cafes for breakfast. Pleasant bar in hotel for early evening beer. Didn't eat in hotel so can't comment on food. Rooms were quiet so had good nights sleep. Definitely recommend especially when rates were so good.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, quiet and perfect”
Reviews.Author: TimeTravelWife
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the peace and quiet of this hotel. Free internet/computer in their small business center. Requested and received very quiet room facing back. No view, but, more importantly, no noise. Attractive, very clean, smart looking. Hotel stored our luggage for a day before we officially checked-in. Located a bit too far from Las Ramblas to make the walk all of the time, but metro is a block away; most often it required a connection to our destination. About 1.5 blocks to food market, smaller version of La Boqueria. Definitely recommend if you don't mind being a tad away from the hustle and bustle of Las Ramblas. For us, that was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “U232 - \Quirky and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: BenTheophanous
Reviews.Content: Cool little boutique hotel that gives you bang for your buck. Staff are really friencly and there is a nice roof terrace on the 10th floor to sunbath on (went in Jan...not a good idea). Rooms are standard but clean and comfortable too. Went with business so it seemed nice and central. Would recommend more for business traveller, as it doesnt really have an abundance of facilities or spas etc you would want to spend too much time in (there is a small gym). Great little find however!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value with quality”
Reviews.Author: nerdykit
Reviews.Content: Good value for a hotel that is located within the city centre. Rooms are soundproof, stylish, modern and well-equipped. Front desk staff are attentive and helpful. Breakfast is expensive but a cheap alternative can be found a block from the front door where students grab a quick bite before heading across the street to the Technical School. The neighbourhood is not particularly interesting but has what you need in terms of food and stores. The subway line is only a block away for easy travel to more touristic areas. If you want a good, economic stay within Barcelona the U232 provides it. If you are new to Tapas, be sure to try out Maitea which is just a short walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel near Sagrada Familia”
Reviews.Author: AriaProf
Reviews.Content: The U232 Hotel in Barcelona was a delight for two tired travelers from the cruise ship. The room ambiance was appealing, the bathroom was large and bright with an excellent shower. On both sides of a room divider was a TV where you could watch two different shows at once without disturbing each other. The breakfast restaurant had fantastic food, warm or cold. The subway was only a block away and in only a couple stops we were at the Sagrada Familia basilica. The staff at U232 was very helpful. They recommended a restaurant two blocks away which served us a fantastic meal with the fresh catch of the day. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Classy , Cosy, Elegant, U232!”
Reviews.Author: mstoychev
Reviews.Content: I just spent another few days in BCN and stayed (for the 3rd time) in U232. The hotel is amazing! Very cosy and elegant. Very nice lobby bar and friendly staff. One of the hotels I want to go back and back again. Just feeling on the right place there. Room 711 features a great balcony/terrace with city views. The location of the hotel is one of the best about it - situated just 5 minutes from Via Diagonal and 15 minutes walk from pl. Catalunya or 5 minutes by taxi. Just take a look on the hotel website and You'll get an idea!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: angusroberts
Reviews.Content: I loved the 232. A very stylish, boutique hotel without the stylish boutique hotel prices! We paid around £70 bed and breakfast per night. The hotel is in the Eixample area of the city, a bit quieter than the hussle and bussle of the tourist area but still only 20 minutes walk from the Ramblas or 2 minutes on the metro which is only 2 minutes walk from the hotel (Hospital Clinic station). The hotel provides great breakfast (cooked and continental), a great gym and a superb roof terrace. There's a bar on the ground floor serving drinks and snacks. There's a good selection of local bars and restaurants in the surrounding area. The staff are friendly, the decor is wonderful. I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: jbarch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the U232 hotel in Barcelona for 1 full week. They had an extremely helpful and friendly staff and the entire hotel is super clean. The fee was very reasonable and the location was close to a few attractions and the subway. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “A bit out of town but great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TripInIt4U
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and the only criticism we can think off is that the location means that to do anything in town you need to take metro (only 2 minutes walk away) or taxi. Before leaving we read up on the immediate area and it sounded lively and full of bars. It has some life but as much we expected (this for many could be a positive aspect). On to the hotel itself. Modern design, bit dark but stylish. Our room was excellent, huge bed, plenty of space and a good bathroom, nicely designed with view from bathroom to bedroom. Breakfasts were great and all the staff helpful and willing. Would recommend U232 with only the warning about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday”
Reviews.Author: TripTaker050
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for a long weekend just before Christmas and booked U232 based on the very reasonable price offered. After booking we discovered the price on their site was then lower and we emailed them and asked was it possible to avail of this rate - there was no issue at all we just modified our booking online and saved ourselves over 100€ We arrived late to Barcelona and first impressions were good. We had booked a U232 room and to be honest it was similar to most standard hotel rooms if maybe a little on the small side. The decoration was lovely tho and there was a very calm/relaxed athmosphere. The bed was super comfy and the balcony was lovely and big, even if the view wasn't the best (other peoples homes) The staff were always very helpful and welcoming The location was perfect once you don't mind taking the underground or having a 20min walk to get to any of the main attractions. The area also felt very safe. The only thing I can fault this hotel for is the room service food - It was horrible.........Other than that all was perfect. Personally I would probably try stay a little nearer the centre next time just for ease of getting to and from esp at night for going out. But I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: vykye
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at! My son and I stayed there over the Xmas period and I must say that the hotel is exactly as the pictures shown on various websites. The staff were very accommodating, advised on how to get to some of the attractions and also gave us maps. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The hotel is spotless, very clean and very well taken care of. I was very impresssed by the room: very clean, spacious, very comfortable double bed, soft pillows and storage areas. The bathroom was very beautiful, toiletries were provided and the water pressure of the shower very powerful. The towels were very soft and changed daily and the bathroom was left spotless. The hotel is located in Eixample, a nice neighbourhood away from the busy tourist areas. There are a lot of cafes around the area where you can have breakfast if you do not want to eat at the hotel. The nearest metro is "Hospital Clinic" and it will take you about 25 minutes to walk to Las Ramblas - very interesting things to see on the way e.g market, shops etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again should I go back to Bracelona.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: Cityvibe
Reviews.Content: I would stay here again. It is in a great location for a great price and very clean. The staff is friendly and helpful. There is free wifi. The bar is nice, and on the second floor there is a cute lounge area as well. Yes, the furniture is somewhat cheap, but modern decor at an affordable price is going to mean cheap Ikea-style furniture. The only real downsides were that the shower and sink were very slow to drain and the shower head was so strange it was hard to actually get the water on your body instead of hitting the front wall of the shower. Otherwise, this was a great hotel. There is a nice closet and ample drawer space, and also a desk and side chair. It's not a big room, but if you're in Barcelona staying in your room then you should go home anyway! If you stay here, you MUST go to Maitea for tapas! It's only two blocks away and AWESOME!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best I've even been!”
Reviews.Author: hugoolbpp
Reviews.Content: When I was searching for a place to stay during my trip to Barcelona, I realized the reviews of U232 in Trip Advisor were quite good, even though its rates were considerably cheaper than similar ones. I thought there was something wrong, but took my chance and made the reservation. There is nothing wrong! The hotel is fantastic! Cleanliness is impeccable, you could perform a surgery inside the room. The room and bathroom are spacious and silent. Beds are large and pillows - there are plenty of them in the room - are really comfortable. The staff is nice and helpful. Breakfast is superb - but a bit expensive. Some reviews I read mentioned it is not very well located. I really can't understand. "Hospital Clinic" station is 2 minutes away from the hotel, and the metro can take you anywhere in 15 minutes or less. In the case you need to leave or arrive late (metro closes at midnight), there are night bus stops everywhere. We had to come back from Camp Nou Stadium - which is very close - at 1 am, and it was no problem at all. Moreover, the hotel is at Eixample, one of the best neighborhoods in town, crowded with restaurants and bars. I'm pretty sure U232 is certainly one of the best hotels I've ever been.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: BobGema
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona for a weekend and chose the U232 as it was not too expensive but still in a nice area. The hotel is 5 minutes walk fom the metro (Hospital Clinic) and you can be in the heart of Barcelona in less than 10 minutes. The room was clean and stylish, it was a good size with a huge and suprisingly comfortable double bed. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel as it was an extra €14 each per day. There are a couple of cafes towards the metro stop and we got good breakfasts for less that for both of us. The only other negative thing was that the bathroom towels were really hard, not just a bit short of fabric softener but like nearly doormat level. Still, the staff were pleasant and we left quite happy. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern hotel close to Metro and numerous restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Warhorse09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an excellent value, very clean and modern. Excellent free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. Breakfast was not great and is probably the only area where the hotel didn't meet or exceed expectations. There are numerous shops and restaurants surrounding the hotel which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Elena P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in U232 Hotel over 3 nights during Christmas period. The experience was unforgettable! What a beautiful place to stay! From the moment we have enter the hotel to the minute we left everything was 100% positive. The hotel is molecularly clean, the interior design at the highest standard, the food is excellent, members of the hotel staff are extremely polite and friendly! What else you can expect from your holiday stay! We would recommend this hotel to everyone! Thank you so much to for making our visit to Barcelona such a wonderful and relaxing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mtmbuzz
Reviews.Content: Nice location in a stylish hotel. If you can get a room at a good rate don't miss you chance to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Beautiful Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: UKbanker33
Reviews.Content: The U232 combines both and element of "chic" (without going overboard) with traditional Spanish practicality. I had booked a balcony room and loved it. Perfectly relaxing after a long day of business or touring. I stayed her several days, and actually managed to use the balcony for reading and soaking in the afternoon sun in early February (!) on a couple of days. The neighbourhood is just outside of the tourist areas (L'Eixemple or Bari Gotic). Depending on you preference, either a bit of a walk (10-15 minutes) or solid local ambiance with few tourists and lots of amenities (supermarkets, cafes and restaurants) with nary a tourist nearby. The subway/metro is three minutes walk, and the Hotel is on the "airport" side of the city, so 20 minutes if you don't meet too much traffic. Great place to stay and I will do it again if they have a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “5 Stars for the price of 3”
Reviews.Author: Eddie086
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin. Having stayed in Barcelona on 4 previous occasions, this was by far the best hotel we have encountered. It ticks all the boxes. Location - at first it seems a little far away from the action, but the more you walk around the more excellent places you will find. El Corte Ingles is less than 200 metres away on Avenue Diagonal. L'illa, another huge shopping centre is a 5 minute taxi ride. The rooms in U232 are perfect - no complaints whatsoever. The staff are so helpful it was really a pleasure to deal with them. English no problem. Their recommodations for restaurants were spot on - we were never disappointed. We never actually ate in the hotel as there are excellent coffee shops/breakfast venues close by. The bar was really nice and cosy with the ever friendly Bianca serving with a smile. WE would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and will return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Liked this place”
Reviews.Author: s1d972
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel - friendly staff, nice bar area however if you are not too mobile it's a reasonable walk into key areas (probably around 15/20 minutes. If you are happy with the location I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good indeed”
Reviews.Author: JeppeSJ
Reviews.Content: Great hotel at a great price compared to others in the area. I stayed at Europark, their sister hotel, which I might prefer as I like the location better. But I can't say any bad things about this hotel. all was great, great rooms, great staff, everything worked out for me perfect.

Reviews.Title: “U232 made my Barcelona holiday A+”
Reviews.Author: JAPLondon
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for 3 nights with my family for a birthday treat in Barcelona. We had 3 U232 rooms on the 7th floor. Paid the same rate for all rooms (@ £70 per night). 2 of the rooms identical, the other slightly larger with a balcony. Very comfortable, mini bar/fridge, huge King beds with wonderful pillows. Impressive bathrooms, complete with a U232 box full of toiletry goodies (eg, combs, razors, tissues, shoe mitt, bath sponge, etc). Poor air con, although it was December the rooms still got hot and the air con was not strong enough to cool the rooms down. Great bar/lounge area. Business centre with 2 computers. Free wifi in the lounge/bar. Supposed to work in the rooms but it did not. Found the reception staff to be very helpful, with advice on nearby restaurants. Manuel was especially helpful. Bought the breakfast on the first day, but not worth the money. Loads of cafes in the area. Hotel is out of the busy centre, but this suited our needs fine. Lovely surroundings with plenty of cafes/supermarkets/restaurants. And ideally situated for the red and blue open top busses which we used to get around the city. Cool terrace on the top floor. Small gym with fridge and complimentary water. If I ever return to Barcelona then I'd return to this hotel. Great value and super service. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “lovely quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: chineRedditch
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel for 2 nights if you want a room away from the road then ask to be on the back of the hotel very very quiet ,very helpful and speedy at reception, a 5 min walk from the metro station and a 15 min walk from the aerobus which costs about 5euros each to and from the airport or 25 to 30 euros in a taxi, we didnt eat at the hotel for breakfast turn right outside the hotel and 2 doors away is pans (a bit like subway) they sell bagettes for 3.50 euros and you can sit outside in the sun, we didnt walk to las ramblas but i should think its quite a distance on foot ,well situated for the metro to fc barcelona ,would definatly stay again

Reviews.Title: “Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: jacquelineatl
Reviews.Content: We had to change hotels in Barcelona since we extended our stay. I wanted to find a reasonably priced hotel that was still close to the tourist sights. I was not very familiar with L'Eixample area, but looked at a map and it was 2 metro stops away from where we spent a lot of our time. Once you exit the metro, the hotel is only a block away. The hotel was very warm, room decorated in dark brown, black and gold. The bed was a queen with very nice pillows, had great lighting and free unlimited interent. There was a minibar with a fridge that we could use, much better lighting and useable desk. (We had stayed at the Denit Hotel previously. Next time I go to Barcelona, I will stay here, better pricing and amenities). We had booked a 2 night minimum package, but on the first night, I fell and broke my ankle and to leave Barcelona immediately. The hotel was very gracious and didn't charge us any penalites. They had a wheelchair available for me to use and did all they could to help me out. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, quiet location”
Reviews.Author: christi05
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good option if your going to Barcelona. The hotel is very clean and the staff is very helpful. The rooms are really comfortable, but each room has a different layout, mine had two bathrooms and no balcony, but my brother’s room had a small balcony and a small bathroom. The breakfast is good, but it doesn´t have many options if you don´t like the typical Spanish breakfast. When I stayed there I saw some Americans that brought their own cereal because the hotel didn´t has any. The location is not very central and is far from the beach, but it wasn’t an issue because Barcelona has a great subway plant, and they have a subway station near the hotel. Overall it was a great stay and I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: escapeorlando
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the u232 hotel. It is very clean and modern. It is very close to the metro which makes it very easy to get around. The area is quieter and residential but there are lots of good restaurants around. The metro is so fast and comes so often, it makes it quick to go anywhere. Rooms were a nice size for Europe. Our only complaint was that we had bad Internet signal in the room. We seemed to only get great signal in the bathroom. We didn't try the 14 euro breakfast but there was no need since there were 5 cafes on the one and a half block walk to the metro so no worries there! Staff was very nice and helpful. They even let us check in a bit early since we had taken an overnight flight into Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice jazzy feel, relaxing place”
Reviews.Author: evolucien
Reviews.Content: Pros: classy feel, nice lounge, clean, staff are knowledgeable with a few employees a bit standoffish but hey, that is the Catalonia way. Also, the location was good in my opinion with lots of bars and restaurants within walking distance. Rent a moto for the best way to see Barcelona. Wifi and jazz music everywhere :) Cons: for $150 US a night, rooms kind of small and not sound proofed well, so bring ear plugs to sleep. Luckily, it is a mellow hotel, not much noise. No irons for clothes. WTF!?!? I stayed in several hotels in Spain and this is the only one without an iron.

Reviews.Title: “Covenient gem in Good Barcelona Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: RetiredTravelersOhio
Reviews.Content: This motel was small by US standards but packed with coveniences and amenities that more than made up for it. The rooms were very clean and modern and, as with all Euopean hotels, were small by US standards but quite confortable. It was an excellent base of operations to see the city. It was a three minute walk to the Metro where a T10 ticket would last a person three days to see the sights. The neighborhood was clean and safe and the people were friendly. Food was never a problem as some excellent restaurants ,Tapas bars and corner cafes were within a 3-4 block walk. Every evening our group retreated to the roof patio to enjoy a bottle of wine over causal conversation and a nice view of the neighborhood before heading out to discover the next place to eat. The staff was very friendly and very helpful and responded to all our questions and needs in rapid fashion. All in all, the U232 was an excellent value that we would book again on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with comfort & helpful staff in quiet but convenient location”
Reviews.Author: pickytripers
Reviews.Content: When searching hotels for a two night weekend stay (ex cruise) we did not feel the prices in the city center (Rambles area) represented value in any form when averaged at £200 per night (double). This location -only a short walk to the Metro station - with a choice of at least three breakfast eateries on the way with endless selections to eat for a few euros - getting into the centre in 15 minutes meant we saved a small fortune. Our room was a good size with large bathroom and all cons necessary. A very comfortable bed and all very clean & I am quiet particular in this area! Any questions at the desk were politely & informatively answered with a smile and maps to help on our first visit to the city. All in all apart from the breakfast cost which we declined as not value which was a good decision as explained above - we feel this hotel deserves the acclaims given by fellow travelers reporting on this site.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: tanqeraygin
Reviews.Content: we had a u232 room with small balcony.room was clean and comfortable.bath was exceptional for europe. quiet convenient location. metro 1 short block away.hoho bus stop about 5 short blocks away.excellent restraurants walking distance. nice bar. full breakfast expensive ,however room service for coffee and juice and pastries was convenient,fast and inexpensive. on the first corner near hotel coffee and pastry about 2 euros, great sandwiches about 2 euros. we were there three nights awaiting a transatlantic cruise. true 4 star hotel in every way at a reasonable price. (295 euros total for 3 nights). desk and bar personnel were all friendly and very helpful. we will return.

Reviews.Title: “'Top Room'”
Reviews.Author: MooandJu
Reviews.Content: Pretty good location, just slightly out of the centre. Which, actually is quite handy as a lot of Barcelonas tourist locations are spread out to all parts of the city and this hotel has a metro stop pretty near by. I've stayed here on more than a few occasions now and have always taken the 'top rooms' (as they are referred to by the hotel). They have beautiful terraces and the most amazing enormous 'roman style' marble baths. (absolutely perfect for romance etc...). Apart from these rooms, the hotel is typical of Barcelona. Breakfast is NOT included, despite the exorbitant price and the service is adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: apc9
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay on a lovely trip to Barcelona. Rate didn't include breakfast and we didn't really speak to the staff so can't comment on this but everything else was excellent. Gusto's by the metro is a great place for a pizza, eat in or out.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Time, Great Hotel, Friendly Staff....”
Reviews.Author: Dan-and-Angie-1015
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a week and a half stay in Barcelona and stayed at the U232 Hotel. The staff was very friendly, spoke English and very helpful. We had the Roof top room (Room Type: Top Room) for our first 3 nights and a basic room (Room Type: U232 Room) for the second stent of our stay. The Roof top room was very spacious with a large furnished Balcony and excellent view of the City. The U232 Room was a decent size, with a full King size bed, however there isn't a balcony with these rooms and the view looking out (obviously) wasn't as nice as what we had from the Top Room. Location was great, short cab ride to Las Ramblas and other sites. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but we expected better...”
Reviews.Author: katieflorence
Reviews.Content: We booked this after getting a deal and seeing that it was so highly rated. Very stylish, ok location (not in the centre, but near a metro station), friendly staff on front desk. We were disappointed with our first room as only an internal window but they moved us to a nicer room with street view on 2nd night. Our only real issue was the lack of tea/coffee making facilities. After staying in a 4* Novotel in Seville earlier in the year which had them I had hoped this would be standard in 4* hotels in Spain but apparently not. This wouldn't be such a problem if the room service was open 24hrs, but it was only open til 10.30. This meant that when we returned to the hotel around 11 one night after getting caught in a downpour we were unable to warm up with a hot drink. But overall an ok option.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian A
Reviews.Content: Stylish hotel for budget-minded travelers. Quality of materials were great, and hotel staff was friendly. Location is just a block away from Hospital metro station which allows very fast, easy access to all major points in Barcelona. A few great grocery stores located within a few blocks as well makes for a nice option for meals. The rooftop terrace was a great way to unwind after a day of touring the city. While we learned the terrace closed in October at 21:00, the staff allowed us an extra 30 minutes to enjoy a quick meal we brought up. Look for deals on rates, and if you need a nice, comfortable place with a working AC / heater with the subtle "extras", this is the place. We will be booking here upon our next trip to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Good location; helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: 11_traveller_sp
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with our recent stay. The staff were helpful and courteous (someone had obviously been smoking in our non-smoking room and they quickly arranged for another; we later saw that they were airing out the first room) and the location was safe, centrally located, and near good restaurants. Our room was very quiet, clean, and tastefully decorated with a decent bed/mattress and a terrific bathroom. Very good value. There are plenty of cafes nearby, so that you can skip the 14 Euro buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: MingBG
Reviews.Content: The hotel is designed in a mod decor (a la Armani Casa) that cleverly makes it look classier than it really is. The u232 is nonetheless a comfortable stylish hotel, with spacious rooms and adequate facilities. It is unfortunate however that a hot water jug with basic tea/coffee facilities, nor a box of tissue, are standard in 3/4 star Barcelona hotels. The hotel is located in the Eixample area, a quiet neighborhood in a better part of Barcelona. If you're looking to be in the center of the action however, this location might not suit you. We relied on taxis which are readily available for most of our transportation any way and found the location convenient, and safe. Special mention to front desk staff Andreas, who went out of his way to arrange a rental car for us at short notice. The hotel has a special arrangement with Over car rental, which provides a convenient pick up and drop off service as well, although their rates are a little higher than other car rental agencies. We paid €180 per room per night. FYI Maitea tapas bar, a cosy neighbourhood joint is a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “great place, great location”
Reviews.Author: UkBlackie
Reviews.Content: stayed for three nights last week and could not fault the hotel at all. Went for my wifes birthday and booked through an agent online and got a very good rate for a standard room with breakfast. We found it easy to find using an earlier review on the train from the airport and then the metro ( about 40-45 mins ) checked in and found the room to be very good, clean and about average size but the bonus was a balcony over looking the front of the hotel. It is on a busy road but with the door shut was quiet enough not to get to disturbed at night .Breakfast was very good with lots to chose from and from 7 till 11 and every thing was spotless. The location of the hotel was probably one of the best bits because it is surrounded by bars and resturants in all directions and all very reasonably priced. We have been to Barcelona a couple of times before and the last time stayed in the Monte Carlo and this was by far a more comfortable hotel in a better location ( if you don't mind doing a little bit of walking) and using the metro was easy all in all very good

Reviews.Title: “Some good things, some not so good”
Reviews.Author: Leendaz
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at the U232 in early September to kick off a 3-week holiday celebrating our retirements this year. I chose this hotel because I fell in love with the Top Room photos shown on the website - the beautiful balcony with comfy furniture where I could see us lounging after a hard day of sightseeing! This was a splurge for us but we thought we'd kick off this very special vacation with a treat. The room itself (910) is super - spacious and modern, comfortable beds and lovely linens, a good sized table, tons of closet space, mini-bar and safe, excellent air conditioning and lighting. There was no noise from outside and we had good, sound sleeps. But my heart sank when I saw the balcony - no comfy furniture, no shade - only a small table and 2 hard chairs and 2 uncomfortable lounge chairs that were difficult to get in and out of. I was so disappointed. Months of looking forward to this vacation and this particular hotel - only to find this. And to add insult to injury, from our hot, stark balcony, we could see the balconies below us - with their lovely upholstered wicker furniture, side tables and shade!!! I went to the front desk to inquire about this and was told that only room 910 had twin beds. Great. No offer to move the furniture to our balcony from another suite. They did offer to move us to another room the next day but it had a double bed - I was so tired after travelling all night that I just gave up. But I agree with other posters that the hotel should provide the same furnishings for all their "Top Rooms" or indicate on the website that there is a difference. The other minus was the room service. Service was prompt but the so-called "club sandwich" was beyond a joke - not even close to a club sandwich and completely inedible. One wonders why a decent sandwich cannot be had when the breakfast buffet (although expensive) was quite tasty. When we called the front desk to complain about the sandwiches, we were told curtly by a woman with somewhat of an attitude that "it is not possible" (to get a club sandwich!). There was no argument about removing them from our bill. This item should be removed from the menu entirely. The other staff members were great - in particular one young man whose English was excellent and who checked us in and out, stored our luggage while we waited for our room to be made up, provided maps and directions and called us taxis as required. The other pluses include free Wifi, a nice little bar in the foyer and the business center with 2 computers and a printer. We were able to print out our boarding passes which meant we avoided a huge long line-up at the airport. The breakfast buffet (14 euros) was convenient and varied - several hot dishes - grilled tomatoes, bacon, scrambled eggs, patatas bravas, cold cereals, fresh fruit, juices, yoghurts, pastries, a variety of breads, cold meats and cheeses. Location is good - we walked to Las Ramblas and back one day and on another, jumped on the subway to get to the Sagrada Familia Basilica and then to Barceloneta - very easy to get around. All in all, a lovely hotel. Would recommend it but if you book a top room, make sure you're getting what you want.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: Dukajovic
Reviews.Content: Hotel is at good position for shoping, not far from from a Plasa Catluna, very good service, adn nice rooms. Overal value is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Located a bit outside the city centre but still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: snootchiebootchies
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel U232 for 3 nights during the first week of September. We chose this hotel because the rates were reasonable and we had arrived by train from Madrid and this hotel is located one easy and short metro ride from the Barcelona Sants Railway Station. As most reviewers have mentioned, the hotel is a little bit outside the heart of the city and it's a bit of a pain to switch trains plus a hike through some really long corridors at the Diagonal Metro Station to get to La Rambla. But we found the benefits of staying at this hotel far outweighed the cons. For us, we thought the biggest benefit (besides the proximity to the Sants train station) was the dining options in the area. Our best meals in Barcelona were all at restaurants within walking distance from this hotel, and prices around here were very reasonable compared to the tourist-driven restaurants in the city centre. We particularly loved Maitea Taberna and their wide variety of delicious tapas. Maitea Taberna is located about 2.5 blocks away from the hotel on Carrer de Casanova. The staff at the restaurant was very friendly and patient as we were trying to figure out the whole process. We loved the food there so much that we went back a second time. Another terrific restaurant was Gusto, located 1.5 blocks away and right across the street from the metro station. I would come back to this hotel just to eat at those establishments again! Other things we loved about the hotel: - Very quiet, spacious and comfortable rooms for reasonable rates. We stayed on the second floor and had a balcony. Albeit the balcony was right smack dab in the middle of a coutyard in the middle of a network of apartments. But it was nice to step outside on a warm night with a drink and look inside the well-lit apartments all around us! - Free wi-fi plus there are two desktops and one printer for public use. Very handy as we didn't bring our laptop with us. - Room was equipped with a safe and fridge, which I think should be essentials in every hotel room. - Besides the restaurants I mentioned above, there were also plenty of places where you can grab breakfast, or a quick bite. - There are a couple of Suma supermarkets and they are both within 2 or 3 blocks from the hotel. Great place to buy snacks and drinks to stock the fridge. - Even though you need to switch metro trains to get to La Rambla, there are some places that are easily accessible from this hotel, such as Sagrada Familia and the Sants Railway Station. - Well staffed. Everytime we dealt with the front desk (checking in, checking out, storing luugage, questions), somebody was alway available to help us.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel away from the tourist areas but still very accessible to the sites of the city. U232 was perfect for us. The Metro was very close and we were within walking distance to wonderful neighborhoods. The rooms were small but very well appointed and comfortable. The staff was terrific and went out of their way to help us enjoy the stay. Each afternoon we really enjoyed getting a bottle of wine and heading up to the rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected...”
Reviews.Author: Thess
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading the reviews here on TripAdvisor. A Top Floor room, since the terrace looked cosy and perfect for lazy afternoons after sightseeing. Now, our room itself (909), is very spacious and inviting. The bed is comfortable and both of us could easily fit our laptops on the table. Ample closet space and nice lighting options. BUT the terrace!!! A stark naked space with a wobbly table, two quite uncomfortable loungechairs and absolutely NO shade at all! I read a review of the same room-type a couple of minutes ago (posted Sept 4th) with the same complaints I have. The management has actually answered and assured the reviewer that they will post photos of the 10th floor terraces too, to avoid confusion, on their website. It is October 2nd today, and there are still no photos of those terraces... Why not buy a couple of cushioned lounge chairs and an umbrella and make the space cozy and inviting instead? Also, we came back after a whole day of sightseeing today, between 9:30 and 16:45. When we came up to our room, housekeeping had not been in it at all. We went down to the frontdesk and asked why, and got the answer that they have so late check-outs on Sundays, that they start cleaning the rooms after 4 PM... Seriously??? So, I have one of the most expensive rooms they offer, but with a very bad terrace, and I have to wait until evening to get my bed made, towels replaced and dirty cava glasses taken out? We said we wanted it done right away, since we wanted to be able to rest and relax before our evening activities. They said they would send someone immediately and we went out for a drink in the meantime. Back an hour later, housekeeping is still in our room... We will definitely stay somewhere else next time in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, easy accesible by car”
Reviews.Author: markito0000
Reviews.Content: good place to stay, spacious and quiet rooms. There is parking garage below the hotel where you receive discount. Easy to get to when travelling by car. The area is quiet (for Barcelona) with metro close by. Close to hotel is also a nice bar for a delicous breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dianaf12
Reviews.Content: U232 is classy, clean, and centrally located. It is very stylish, yet completely affordable. The room I was in might have been TOO comfortable. The beds were amazing and every day I woke up to the sun shining in through the door to our balcony, which overlooked the beautiful tree-lined street. The staff is very nice and friendly, and the little bar is a nice touch. My friend and I would grab a drink and olives at the hotel before heading out at night. There are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby, and you can walk to some of the main attractions in Barcelona. Additionally, the metro is about a two minute walk from the hotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good prices, good service”
Reviews.Author: rbiemans
Reviews.Content: The U232 hotel is all 'dark-chic'. Brown wood, black tiles, soft lights. A mix between design and classic. Most photo's at TripAdvisor give the right impression. The location is good: right in the middle of the city, with easy access to Avinguda Diagonal and Carrer D'Arago and the Hospital Clinic subway station is close by. Underneith the hotel is a public parking that comes at a steep price. The hotel offers a discount on the parking fee. The Sagrada Familia is about 15 minutes by car and 30 minutes on foot. In fact, almost all of the hot spots in Barcelona can be reached that fast. A car is OK, but you have to mind traffic conditions and parking space: public transportation is the better option. The hotel itself is fine. Service at reception and roomservice is good, fast and pleasant. The lounge and bar are nice, although constantly in a dim light. There's no restaurant in the hotel, but roomservice offers a small menu. Mini-bar is average, but expensive. Rooms have good and free internet, a mid-sized flatscreen TV with few English channels, a safe and properly functioning airco. My room was a 1-person option, with batch/shower, semi-separate toilet and a short 2-person bed. It also included a small desk and couch. Not much of a view, but window could be opened. Most interesting was the window between bathroom and bedroom, with blinds, but just a glass pane as divider. I suspect that my room is offered as a 1-person business room with less use as the other rooms: some lights didn't work, glass shower divider was broken, there was some water damage, and the bathroom was clean enough, but seemed unused for some time. I wasn't particularly fond of the shower as it looked better than it functioned: not much water pressure and temperature changes that are uncomfortable. Breakfast was good and included everything one expects. At 14 Euro p.p.p.d one can imagine going to either of the two sandwich shop/deli in the same block as an alternative. Or go just around the corner to the 'Dia Market'. Restaurants are nearby: there's a small Italian pizza place across the street, some restaurants with Catelan food, some snack bars and a few other places you can go to. The ambiance of the hotel is good enough to come back. With a good price, it's a better option than some 4-star hotels with more reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: grammy117
Reviews.Content: We booked the U232 Hotel, based on reviews from Trip Advisor. We weren't disappointed. The desk staff spoke English and it was easy to check in. I did email them with a request for confimation, about a week out, but didn't receive a reply. This turned out to not be a problem. Because I had a tooth crown pop off as we were taxiing out to the runway in Philly (be careful chewing gum for your ears), I needed a dentist when we reached Barcelona. (Stress!) The desk clerk made an appt. for me immediately (within 20 min. of our arrival) and we grabbed a taxi to the Vital Dental Clinic. I had a 45 min. wait, but the dentist re-glued it for me, and that made my vacation ok again. Our room overlooked a school and the traffic noise was minimal. There's a little pastry shop on the corner to the left out of the hotel, and the Metro is just another block. . . really convenient. The 2 elevators are small, so we took turns going up to our floor (we each had a large suitcase and a carry-on, but there wasn't enough room for both of us and our luggage on one trip) We didn't see this as a problem. We would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: R R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at U232 for 4 days and thoroughly enjoyed the room. Very clean, bathroom was HUGE, nice shower. Very quiet for sleeping. 2 blocks from the Metro and is on a line that connects with pretty much everything you want to see. Staff were very helpful and professional. We booked a room with a balcony and truly enjoyed our stay. Cab rides to almost anywhere in town are inexpensive. Loved the location - close to small restaurants and close to attractions but far enough away that we felt safe at night and didn't have to put up with street/city noise.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel !!”
Reviews.Author: OpaPadova
Reviews.Content: I have become a regular visitor to this hotel thanks to its exceptional value for money. The hotel has a modern look to it but with all the warmth of the latin people. The rooms are excellent and there is also plenty of options to hold small/medium sized meetings with clients. Internet is free of charge ! Only negative side is the breakfast, a bit expensive for what you get. Should be improved and certainly increase the variety to offer. Would recommend both for business and leisure, better for couples or small families.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish hotel with a great location at the right price”
Reviews.Author: WiNG_Vacances
Reviews.Content: I won't lie, I was sold on the U232 by its pictures alone on TripAdvisor. Sure, I read the overwhelmingly positive comments, but something about the stripes, squares, and dark wood furnishings just said "this is it." Arriving at the U232 in person with my wife, it was all true. The hotel was elegant, with an impressive entrance and tastefully decorated lobby. The reception staff weren't overtly friendly, but they were polite and efficient. They all spoke English and Spanish (and Catalan) very well, and gave us the option of several different rooms, which was great. The elevator, hallways, and general layout are all exquisitely designed with a repeating square motif of right angles and strong contrast. Our room was no exception; inside was a small but stylish area with modern furniture, nice moody lighting, and a balcony overlooking the quiet, spacious plaza behind the hotel. It took us a minute to figure out how to use any of the lights (you must put your key card in the slot by the door), but this turned out to be fairly common throughout Spain. The bathroom was very nice, with a spacious shower (not necessarily common in Spain), extra cubbies for your toiletries, etc. As others have mentioned, this hotel is seemingly designed with couples in mind. The lighting style and placement are all quite romantic, and the bathroom has a window allowing anyone in the main room to watch whoever's showering. While this window can be closed easily, it's worth noting that I would recommend this hotel slightly less for families or, haha, business acquaintances. We didn't eat at the hotel due to the price and the large number of good breakfast options within 2 blocks. Speaking of which, the hotel's location is wonderful. While not in the old city, it is 2 blocks from a major Metro station and only a 15 minute walk from many other interesting parts of Barcelona. The street on which U232 is situated is clean, fairly quiet, and eminently safe, though Barcelona is a very safe city in general. A 5 year old walking down the road with a million Euros in cash at 3AM would have no problems in this wonderful town. If you're still reading this review instead of booking your room at U232, you're doing it wrong!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rumburac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in the middle of the march this year and we were very pleased with this accommodation. The room looked exactly like in the pictures on their website, the stuff were very kind and helpful. We could reach the center easily on foot or by subway, the hotel was located just across the subway station. We enjoyed our stay here very much and we would choose again if we were to go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Barcelona's Eixample”
Reviews.Author: reyledda
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried about the distance of this hotel from the main tourist areas, but this turned out to be a blessing as we really enjoyed the neighborhood and the hotel itself was top-notch. Our room was on the 2nd floor and faced the back so we didn't have a view - but we did get an extra big balcony. Curiously, there was no patio furniture, so there was no way to really enjoy it other than lean out. This is a very design-y hotel with really nice furniture by Zanotta, Artemide, etc. There's a bar downstairs and a breakfast restaurant (though we opted for neighborhood cafe's instead). If you are taking the metro from the airport, the light blue line actually takes you to the nearest stop (Hospital Clinic). This same line takes you directly to the Sagrada Familia. All other sites are 2-3 transfers away. Friendly staff and great amenities as well (love the heated towel rack and box of personal grooming kit you get upon check-in.)

Reviews.Title: “Great choice in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Whereinthworldgirl
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel for the value. Rooms were over sized for European standards. We had a room on the top floor with a great terrace including table and chairs. Small fitness room but offered if it's on your list of musts. Not sure why you'd place 15 or 20 euro for breakfast when there are great little coffe shops within a block or two.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Place!!”
Reviews.Author: mogo12
Reviews.Content: Clean, modern, comfortable. Good location...easy to get on metro and just a couple stops to all tourist areas. Nice staff. Free internet. Great price and value!! Would definitely recommend to all and would stay again myself for sure. Loved it!! This was the first 3 days of a girls trip through Spain with friends, and this was our favorite hotel of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “No pool , despite photos that try to fool you”
Reviews.Author: a11424
Reviews.Content: this was a nice enough hotel, but the owner really went to extremes to make it seem that like their competitors, there is a pool -- pool chairs, cabana beds, umbrellas that no longer exist. This was a huge disappointment and for a hotel that is priced with hotels that have rooftop pools with bars, this is a terrible miss. The woman at teh front desk has a bit of an attitude. If I never spoke to the front desk clerk, looked out my window at a concrete wall or went to the roof to see the non existant pool area, I would have been happy. This is a classic Hotel: FAIL

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike W
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the U232 on a trip to Barcelona at beginning of September. We chose it in part because of the comments on TA, that and it seemed to offer good value for money. I have to say that we were not disappointed. The rooms (we had a double and a twin) both reflected what’s on the web site and were kept clean and comfortable. The public spaces are clean and quite and have a good atmosphere and it’s nice to have a quite drink in the bar after a long day walking the city. All the staff are friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. The hotel is close to the metro but we didn’t use it. Because there were 4 of us we bought a 2 day ticket and used the open-top tourist bus to get around the city. With the discount you get from buying the ticket through the hotel it worked out a cheaper and more direct way of getting to the places we wanted to visit. The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the tourist centre of Plaza Catalunya and then a futher 20-30 minute stroll down La Rambla to the sea front. My advice on eating out is to avoid La Rambla. It’s generally overpriced and not that good. We tried the paella and it wasn’t even close to the real thing! Go into the old town or try the restaurant closer to the hotel. If you like Italian try the Un Posto al Sole a couple of blocks down from the hotel, great pizza good price and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “VERY FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: Chin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at end of August for a friend and my birthday found the staff very helpful and friendly. Location is good close to the metro and if feeling energetic you can walk to La Rambla takes about 40 mins. We found a fantastic place to eat on Catalunya called Happy Grill service was fantastic and prices very reasonable breakfast euro 5.90 and lunch three courses for euro 9.99, check it out. We had a basic room without window, but did not bother us. We had two bathrooms and found it adequate. The rooms are just as on the website. Only thing for us was that there was only one tv station not in Spanish and that was BBC News.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Pippped
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an impromptu 3 day weekend at the beginning of Spetember based on reveiws read on TA. Not disappointed, rooms spacious, clean and modern, quiet and the hotel iself is in a good location - short walk to metros, shops and restaurants. This hotel is probably not perfect for those visiting Barcelona for a wild party weekend but for a bit of local tourism and shopping - it fitted my requirements perfecty! They seemed to be full of people getting of or about to board the many cruise liners that frequent Barcelona, doing a night or two at each end. only negative was the disappointing room service menu - but does one really come to Barcelona to eat in?

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but beware.........”
Reviews.Author: NancyC08
Reviews.Content: We booked a "Top" room at the U232 (as part of a trip celebrating our wedding anniversary) based on the photos displayed on the hotel website. We expected our room to have a shaded terrace with cushioned chaise lounges as displayed in the advertising for this type of room. While we were given a room on the upper floor, our terrace was open to the elements and was furnished with two canvas deck chairs and did not even offer an umbrella for shade. The temperature was in the 85 - 90 degree range and the terrace was so hot we could not use it at all. We asked to be relocated but were told it was not possible.
