The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, the location was quiet yet accessible to all tourist sites and the metro, and the breakfast was very nice. However we were very disappointed that our TOP room was not what was advertised and not what we expected despite paying the higher rate.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rumore0
Reviews.Content: I like the style of the interior and the breakfast, given in a windowed room on the first floor. The location is good, for example to go to the University of Barcelona or to the shopping steret (Diagonal) in general, and maybe less good for the center (e.g., Barceloneta). But the metro stop is very close, which helps a lot.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: rskblueyes
Reviews.Content: The hotel and it's staff made my stay in Barcelona wonderful. Due to Hurricane Irene, I had to get to Barcelona a day early to avoid cancelled flights. I was able to add on to my reservation. The hotel was able give me the room, without moving to another room. Both Andre and Anna were so helpful. The room was a nice size, that had 2 full size bathrooms both marble with excellent toiletries. My friend and I both loved the roof deck, which had an assortment of lounges and chairs. They piped in music which made it even more relaxing. The front desk staff spoke English and were helpful with maps and directions. I did not eat at the hotel, but there were numerous resurants and places for breakfast. The L-5 metro was a 5min walk. I definitely would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Chic Little Gem in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: suave2kool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the second half of a 10 day trip to Lisbon-Barcelona last Autumn. The weather was great and so was U232! Although our particular room was a bit small, with no view to speak of, the beds were very comfortable, the air conditioning was good and the bathroom very clean and modern. The front desk staff were lively, comical and very helpful, and the female bartender made hefty drinks.The location is great, a block from the Metro, in a nice neighborhood, and you could be in the Ramblas in 20 minutes walking. We walked to la Sagrada Familia, etc. and there are nice restaurants in the area of the hotel, there was one 'inoteca that is a wine store in the front and a large restaurant in the back with very tasty food. Ask them at the front desk about it. If you're there for several days, don't miss the chance to go to the picturesque nearby seaside town of Sitges, only an inexpensive 30 minute train ride from the Central Railway Station. When in the Ramblas, don't miss the Plaza Garibaldi, a very beautiful palm lined courtyard and fountain which is great for taking photos.

Reviews.Title: “Great professional staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dhedges09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and really enjoyed it. The hotel is beautiful inside and the rooms are clean. The staff was great. I had problems with the water temperature in the shower and the front desk immediately sent someone to check on it. The front desk also gave us a fabulous recommendation for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: SherryE12
Reviews.Content: Early check-in was no problem. Room was nice, clean, well appointed. This hotel is only 1 1/2 long blocks from Metro Hospital Clinic, in a nice neighbourhood. There are lots of dining options nearby, because it's near a hospital. These aren't fine dining options mind you, but there's lots of choice if you want to eat in the neighbourhood. Fairly large El Corte Ingles about 3 blocks away. This is a quiet location, and slightly off the beaten track. A change of metro lines was necessary to almost all the major sights, which can be a bit of a hassle. Free computers/wifi worked well. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: cirodin1
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I have just returned from u232 after a week's stay. It is a really nice, clean and modern hotel. Rooms are of an excellent size and are of a high standard. The hotel is ideally located for the metro, and is a 20 minute walk away from La Ramblas. It is worth buying a T10 card which allows you 10 trips on the metro and can be shared. The roof terrace is a gorgeous space to read, sunbathe and have drinks with some jazz in the background. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will be back”
Reviews.Author: german2
Reviews.Content: I have been there twice now for a business trip after trying out different hotels. Yes, its close to my work location, so I can walk there. But even for a private trip I can recommend this hotel,. I like it a lot, its modern, the staff is very helfpful, the rooms are nicely furnished, it is quiet (if yo do not take a room facing the street). The bar is ok, but who wants to stay inside when in Barcelona? :) I can truely recommend it for amy kind of tracels to BCN.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Mikhail0859
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in August for 3 days during our trip around Spain. I was traveling with my wife, sister and nephew. First of all the location of this hotel is good and the reception was so helpful to explain everything we needed and we do not have any complains about it.

Reviews.Title: “Stygian gloom that hides its light under a bushel”
Reviews.Author: gazinho
Reviews.Content: Bland, modern, business type hotel away from the tourist hordes. Coming from the harsh bright sunlight into the gloomy reception takes some adjusting. Similarly the black bedroom, black bathroom... Quiet comfortable room - poor WiFi reception. Perfunctory reception redeemed by one outstanding person. Poor housekeeping. After a recce discovered a gym and rooftop terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, we'll stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Barts S
Reviews.Content: We visited Barcelona in August 2011 and stayed for two nights at U232. The hotel is great. Two blocks from Av. Diagonal and 10-12 minutes walk from Rambla, and the Aerobus stop. It is also one block from Metro station. We picked a package deal that included free breakfast and a welcoming drinks for two of us. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful with everything. Speak English very well. The design is fantastic and we loved to hear Ella Fitzgerald in the background music. Rooms are clean, every day fresh towels. There was no problem with switching the room since, the first we were given had something wrong with AC. Within 10 minutes we got another room. Breakfasts was excellent and had a very wide selection of local products. If you don't want to dine in hotel - no problem - just within few steps from hotel there are cafeterias and bars - also very good and reasonable priced. The only thing that could be better is the welcoming drink - we can't get the cocktail only a bear/coke/ or cava. Other than that excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommendable!”
Reviews.Author: Mangogirl888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and really loved it. Check-in went smoothly and personnel is very friendly and helpful. The hotel and rooms look like new; it's very clean and tidy. In the room there are all kinds of bathroom amenities offered. Metro stop Hospital Clinic is only like 100metres away and there are nice places nearby for breakfast or midnight snack (probably also for lunch and dinner, but we were not at/near the hotel during the day).

Reviews.Title: “Tale of 2 stays and 1 rude frond desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Halifaxvoyager
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights before our cruise and 1 after. We had 4 rooms for our party or 16 nights. We enjoyed the décor and cleanliness of the hotel and felt it was a great location - metro stop close by. Additionally, the rooms with 3 beds worked very well for our family of 5. Now I go onto my complaint. Our stay before our visit was uneventful, but our stay after our cruise was very disappointing. Although the staff will make no attempt to check you in early. I realize this may be impossible at times, but our party felt that they did not even try. When from our cruise we were unable to check in, so we went out for the day. When we returned, the staff had given away 2 of our rooms, which we had wanted to be adjoining as we were travelling with our 3 children. As well, we wanted the room with 3 beds, which we had booked well in advance of our visit. We found out the room was occupied by getting to the room to find another lady guest within it. I have to say the staff working at that time tried their best to find us another room, but it took an hour to resolve and included another visit to an occupied room. In the end, we were given 2 rooms beside each other (but not joining) we (5 of the 9 of us) were provided a breakfast, which was nice, but not really compensation for the lost time and inconvenience. The next morning, the staff member working the front desk was very unfriendly and unhelpful (and he frowned at me the entire time). He was put out to provide another room key, which was a function of not having adjoining rooms in the first place and my son locked us out of the room. There was no need for him to bark at me about returning “all the keys” when I only ever received 1 for each room. Upon checking out, I then asked this staff member about “lost and found” as my son had misplaced his red Boston Red Sox baseball cap on our first stay and I was hoping someone had found it. He replied that he would have to look for it the next day. I conveyed that I was leaving for Canada, but he was still unwilling to be helpful. This staff member may be one of the worst hotel employees I have ever experienced. He was unhelpful, rude, and not a good representative for the hotel or the city. Once again, my visit to your hotel prior to our cruise was delightful, but unfortunately our experience after our cruise spoiled our stay at u232 hotel. While the rest of the staff was professional, it only takes one unprofessional and rude employee to reflect poorly on a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I like it”
Reviews.Author: TOM_ANDORRA
Reviews.Content: I like the hotel, but you have to ask for a room with a window on the outside, otherwise you will be disapointed. But if you choose the hotel only for sleeping in a very clean and very nice room, you don't need for a window, chhose this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “We Recommend This Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: trvltm
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! When we were deciding where to stay, we thought U232 might be a bit too far away from everything we wanted to see (we are very active sight seers!!!). Don't let this be a factor because the hotel is in a perfect location! It's in a quiet area, but with very easy access to all parts of town due to close proximity to the subway (very safe). My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights after ending a 12 day cruise. Our first visit to Barcelona. Friends had stayed here and they highly recommended it. We are so happy we listened to them! Our room (#908) was large, very modern, clean and just lovely. Great air conditioning system. The large bathroom was done in beautiful black marble, and had a huge tub next to windows that opened onto a very large private balcony (of course, you could also access the balcony from the sliding glass window in the bedroom!). The staff was outstanding! Very helpful in explaining how to get to places and tips on what to do and best times to do it. And they helped us get the 3:00 a.m. taxi ride to the airport! Good computers/printers downstairs that guests may use for free. We will be going back to Barcelona, and will again stay at Hotel U232.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: myomayaman
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend Hotel U232, and are very happy with our choice, which was based largely upon Tripadvisor reviews. We are spending our final nite of a 6-nite stay at U232 in Barcelona. The neighborhood is excellent. The metro stop - Hospital Clinic - 2 blocks away, is ideal, you can get anywhere from here so incredibly easily. We have the "Top Room" which is large with a king-size bed and a big terrace on an upper floor. We needed the terrace for smoking because it's a nonsmoking hotel. We don't rely much on hotel staff, but they were always impeccably friendly and helpful, and the housekeeping was very good. We try to always get a breakfast included deal, but because of the limited number of the terrace rooms which we booked 6 months ago, it simply wasn't on offer. We saw on booking.com that they were willing to sweeten the deal with free breakfast for their standard rooms. So we cannot comment at all whether their 14 euro breakfast was one way or another. We just don't do 14 euro breakfasts, and never even saw the breakfast room. But the huge terrace overlooking the city more than made up for loss of breakfast. There is a coffee pot with instant coffee and teas available. So we ended up doing a bruch out on our explorations. We have to highly recommend two Italian restaurants, each two blocks in opposite directions on Calle Urguell. We ate our evening meals at these places five out of six nites after getting back from our day's activities, they were that good and economical. There are a lot of other places to munch merely steps away, and grocers as well, which might not be so obvious in other reviews. Also we had already done all the great gastronomic stuff the previous 10 days in Madrid and Bilbao. You cannot go wrong dining at Gusto Ristorante Trattoria/Pizzeria, two blocks east on Urguell across from the metro elevator. Equally recommended is Buongiorno Trattoria and Pizzeria two blocks in the opposite direction going toward Diagonal. The Salzburg bar and restaurant where you come up out of the metro is handy for a drink, but we definitely cannot recommend their food at all. This was our first visit to Barcelona and we think Hotel U232 was probably the perfect location for first-time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: TexasCatBird
Reviews.Content: Booked U232 Hotel as part of an Expedia air/hotel package not knowing what the hotel would be like. Had read the reviews which sounded good. Without reservation I can now highly recommend the U232. We had 3 rooms on the 2nd floor. Each room had a different layout but each one was finely appointed, exceptionally clean, with great storage for your bags, free wi fi, and one of the best bathrooms of all the hotels we stayed in over 14 days. The front staff were always extra friendly and helpful in recommending restaurants or places to visit. Bedding was comfortable as well. The hotel is located in an upscale neighborhood and within a very short walk of the nearest metro station. Rooms were quiet even from the hospital nearby never disturbing us with loud ambulance sirens or street noise. From our balcony we could view the nice college campus across the street. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: RATSOMATIC
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights prior to a cruise. Hotel a few metro stops from the centre but still near enough to walk to all the main sights. We had a triple room which overlooked the internal yard so there was no view but it was quiet. We also had two bathrooms which was an unexpected surprise, even though the room was not large. The decor is contemporary. Also, the roof terrace was a pleasant place to sit in the early evening with comfy loungers and sun beds. The area nearby felt safe at night, with many local restaurants and there were several cafes for breakfast which would be a cheaper option than the hotel breakfast. All in all absolutely fine for a few days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Huglum
Reviews.Content: Very late in getting this review completed as stayed here for a weekend Mid Sept 2010. Arrived at the Hotel very late after a flight delay but was made to feel very welcome and was very pleased with the service at check-in. The room was very well furnished and although compact was extremely comfortable. The room had a good size balcony which provided for a pleasant level of coolness into the room. Although the Hotel is small and slightly out from what is considered the main centre of Barcelona it is actually a pleasant and reasonably quick walk along to the Passeig de Gràcia. The hotel bar was slick and comfortable as was the breakfast area with a good breakfast selection. There are plenty of Deli and coffee bars nearby as an alternative to having breakfast at the Hotel. I tried to re-book this Hotel for Easter Weekend 2011 but it was full and I guess a popular choice. It is a little gem amongst the hundreds of hotels dotted across Barcelona and I will be looking to stay here on my next trip to Barcelona albeit if not full……. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel,would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: shellymacN_ireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the U232 for a trip with my friend ,arrived early and got allocated our room straight away.room was lovely with everything you would need,all toiletries and proper hair dryer.we booked for b&b and the breakfast was great .everything you want to set you up for a day of sight seeing.staff were very friendly and spoke good english, and hotel had a nice relaxed and safe atmosphere to it.would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: cpgecko
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at U232. The front desk staff, especially Laia, were great. The room was wonderfully designed, comfortable, and spacious. We were only a block and a half from a metro stop. The only slight concern is that it's not located in the city center, but with the metro so close, it's easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Bunkle
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying in the U232 hotel. It was modern and cean. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were a good size and nicely decorated with black beams on the ceiling and a well equipped black marble bathroom (once you work out how to use the shower controls - one for water and one for temperature, not hot and cold like I first thought - but that could just be me being useless). I have stayed in Barcelona many times in the past and normally stayed down near the port or the Ramblas however this hotel was slightly out of the 'tourist' centre which I really enjoyed. There are some really nice bars and restaurants near by (my favourite was Maitea Taberna, it is a must if you are staying in this hotel, only 2 minutes walk and great food. Read the reviews on this site). Although I did walk to the Ramblas from the hotel one day I would probably recomend the metro if you want to get about without blisters. There is a stop only one minutes walk from the hotel (called Hospital Clinic) which will give you quick access to the whole city. Travel Tip: I would definitely recommend getting a T-10 ticket for the metro, it saves you a lot of money and makes travel so easy. As the name would suggest you get ten trips on bus or metro and can be used by more than one person (just leave it on the top of the barrier for your friend to use behind you). Every time you use the ticket it tells you on the display how many trips you still have left...

Reviews.Title: “Good value!”
Reviews.Author: alment
Reviews.Content: Spent one week at the U232 in late June. Room was in the back (courtyard) and very quiet. The room seemed clean but kind of hard to really tell with the dark and black tiles. AC worked great. Bed was very firm and not the most comfortable from my perspective. The hotel in 1 1/2 blocks away from a metro stop but since it's on the blue line, a switch is usually required to the red line and can be somewhat of a bummer after a long day of walking. This being said, the hotel is a great value compared to many others.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and adequate accomodation”
Reviews.Author: DenLor60
Reviews.Content: Hotel was good, clean, and had breakfast included in our package. We enjoyed it and the food was good, staff helpful and centrally located. Would book again and enjoyed the stay. Den

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: melmcadams
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The u232 room is fabulous. Free wifi and a large room in a great location. It is quiet and removed from the noise but in a great location to easily utilize the metro to get anywhere you want to go. Went from this hotel to Hotel Arts down at the beach. No comparison. Hotel Arts is 5 star but don't stay there unless you are wanting to spend time on the beach or at the multitude of clubs nearby. Tons of street noise and hard to navigate the city from this metro stop. Much preferred U232!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: tap0629
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice. I was pleasantly surprised since we had a good rate. Had a problem with AC, but they took care of it quickly. Front desk staff very helpful with questions, sight seeing suggestions, etc. When you reserve twin/double, they mean just that - 2 twin beds pushed together. So they have their own bedding, etc. Interesting for a couple. 1 1/2 block from Hospital/Clinic Metro station - very easy to access

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donkeyfly
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights and must say was pleasantly surprised. Large rooms, nice and clean. Nice bathroom with shower and bath and also english speaking staff so checking in and out is easy. For the price, you get a great stay in a convenient place. One train from Sagrada Familia and 2 from beach. 25 minutes walk from La Rambla. Had a great stay and would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value stay”
Reviews.Author: CHTRAV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at U232 for four nights. It was our first time in Barcelona and we enjoyed our stay at U232. Here are some pros and cons: Pros: - Very good value - Close to the metro (approx 5 mins walk) - Travel times via metro to the centre are approx. 15 - 20 minutes depending on where you go. Metros go every 2.5 minutes or so. - Good sized rooms (we stayed on the 6th floor overlooking the court yard in a U232 room) - Clean, modern and very quiet. - Very helpful staff - Free WIFI - Late checkout (noon) - Close to Maitea Taberna (good value and quality tapas) - Supermarket and ATM around the corner. Cons: - No iron & iron board. There are laundry facilities available but at high prices. Approx 8 Euros for washing and ironing a single shirt. We ended up buying a travel iron at Carrefour. - No clock in the room. No big deal when you are on holidays but somewhat surprising. - Relatively expensive breakfast. Better value breakfast options are available across and down the road. - The bathroom is separated from the bedroom by a double glass window. Inside the double glass appear to be some blinds which can be electronically adjusted. However this did not work for us. Not a big deal for us, but we found it surprising that it could not be manually adjusted. All in all we really enjoyed our stay at U232 and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: femxrczr
Reviews.Content: Walked in after two very long flights and the room was ready, hotel check-in staff was pleasant. The room was small, but very comfortable, great sleep, very clean bathroom. A little far from the main tourist areas, but would stay there again. Loved the free wi-fi too.

Reviews.Title: “Good sightseeing base”
Reviews.Author: ps888
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night as apart of a stop over in Barcelona. Its about a 20min walk from the city centre but very near to the Hospital metro station from which is fast to get anywhere. We parked in the public carpark under the hotel that was about EUR 20 for 24 hours after a hotel discount. The hotel is quite modern and well decorated in dark wood. Our room was a standard one but was well decorated a of a good size and had a nice bathroom. Everything was very clean. We did not have breakfast as our rate did not include it and it was quite expensive but there are a number of local cafes and coffee shops so getting breakfast and lunch was no problem. The area felt safe. I would be happy to stay again on my next visit. It was a very peaceful experience compared to the crowded city.

Reviews.Title: “Love for Barcelona started from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: raakri
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at U232. The service was excellent, breakfast buffet plentiful, rooms quite big with very nice bathrooms and the view from our window - magnificent! Also I loved the fact that the staff actually helped us reserve a table in a restaurant - we didn't even really ask, they offered very gladly! Definitely THE place to stay in Barcelona! PS: Very easy to get to everywhere since near Hospital Clinic metro stop so easy to go to the old town, Sagrada Familia etc. We loved every minute!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly and Great option for the money!”
Reviews.Author: levelia
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona and the last leg of our Europe trip. My husband and I didn't have a large budget so we opted to stay outside of the main tourist area in order to get a better rate for our 4 night stay. This hotel is what I would say on the edge of the tourist area but still definitely in walking distance to all of the sightseeing. It is located about a 10 min walk to the main areas and about a 15-20 min walk down to Las Ramblas, etc. We even walked down to the beach, which wasn't bad at all! But we like to travel by foot to take in the culture. :) To get here we took the train and metro and it was very very easy and inexpensive. To leave we opted for the taxi service because our flight was at 6am. Both great options for to and from the airport. The front desk is very helpful and there 24/7. The rooms and lobby are very clean and modernly updated. The halls are very quiet, which is great for long days of being out and about. The hotel is very safe and there were absolutely no signs of theft. Our room itself was HUGE - king bed, couch, desk, big dressing area, huge bathroom. It was great for the last part of our trip! I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are look for a dependable less expensive place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would Recommend”
Reviews.Author: jo_hearts_holidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed in U232 from 24th -26th June and got a really good rate in the basic room through the hotel website. The basic room was perfect, clean & well furnished just like the hotel. All of the staff are very helpful & cant do enough for you. The hotel is not in the centre of the city but so easy to get to and from using the cheap convienient metro. The only reason this didnt get a 5 star from me is that the hotel would benefit from an outdoor space such as a roof garden/pool and the bed was a bit hard for me. I would book the hotel again no problem & wouldnt hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Loved thie U232! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tripthisout
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel in an excellent location! It's in a "quieter" section of Barcelona, i.e., not all touristy, & that's what we prefer. There are many types of restaurants in the neighborhood to choose from.all within walking distance. The hotel is conveniently located down the street from a metro. You can get almost anywhere in Barcelona via metro. The hotel staff are extremely helpful & friendly & that's a big plus when traveling. The rooms were nicely decorated, extremely clean & quiet. They also have a nice lounge/bar area. We highly recommend this hotel if you're in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent value and comfort”
Reviews.Author: 3RedDoxies
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our trip to Barcelona and would highly recommend the U232 for the value. Decor: The decor is modern, but with a jazz/deco twist. Lots of black (though this worked well). Lighting in the hallways was dim and warm-feeling, which I actually liked because it created a sense of relaxation. Room: Rooms were spacious and clean. We had what their web site calls the U232 Room, with a king bed, and balcony overlooking the courtyard. Bed was comfortable. A bit on the firm side, but actually softer than many European hotels (so, maybe soft for Europe!). Our room overlooked the courtyard with a nice little balcony, which was kind of fun as it was faced actual apartments, so it felt like a glimpse into how people actually live there. It was also QUIET, which we prefer. I don't know how the street-side rooms are but the courtyard ones were very quiet. Photos on their web site are pretty accurate as to what the place looks like inside. Misc: -If you need ice, you need to get it from the bar in the lobby. -Room has small min-bar fridge. -There is a safe in the room. -There is no iron/ironing board available. They do have laundry service you can pay for, but nothing you DIY. -There is no concierge service, for example, to plan excursions, but the front desk was helpful with recommendations and directions. -Also, they give a much better city street map than the tourist office uses. -Front desk staff speaks English well. -Did not do the breakfast buffet - there are several cafes and places within a block or two of the hotel to get food. There is also a small grocery store around the corner. -There is a parking deck right next to the hotel - hotel guests get a discount, so if you rent a car, this would be helpful (we did not use it). Location: Location is in the city, but outside of the main tourist areas, so it's quieter. Just 2 blocks from the Metro 'Hospital Clinic' stop, so it's really easy to get anywhere you need. Wifi: Free wi-fi throughout the hotel. Ours did not work at first, but they sent up a maintenance person right away who fixed it, so definitely tell them ASAP if your in-room internet service is down. There is also a small 'business center' with 2 computers and a printer in the lobby area near the bar. Bathroom: The only down-side (and none of these things would make me not recommend this place, but if it is important to someone else, it is worth noting...) is the bathroom. Overall, it is spacious and clean but there were a few issues. The main issue: there is a window that separates the bathroom from the bedroom. There are blinds you *should* be able to close for privacy. Ours did not work and because the blinds were between glass, you could not manually adjust them. We told the front desk who indicated this was a known problem (and it sounded like it is in many rooms) and they said parts were being ordered to fix them. If you need to use the bathroom in the middle of the night, the light will wake the other person. But also, if you are traveling with someone you would feel uncomfortable being naked in front of (a friend, your teenager) then this might be a problem. Be sure to ask if this has been fixed if this is important to you. The bathroom isn't very sound-proof. Not to be indelicate, but if you have to 'go', the person outside the room will hear you. Again, might be awkward depending upon who you are traveling with. Bath products are not great. They only give you shampoo (kind of drying), bath gel (watery) and soap. No conditioner or body lotion, so bring these things if you need. Also, no washcloths or tissues (we asked for tissues - housekeeping left us extra rolls of toilet paper - not sure if that was a translation issue or not, but we did not ask again). Also just odd: you have to step all the way into the shower to turn on the shower faucet, which means you will get wet with cold water when you turn on the shower. The door only slides at the opposite end of the tub. There is also a European-style hand-held nozzle to use. That said, hair dryer was great! I have long hair and most hotel dryers are low wattage and take forever. This was a full-sized, full-strength dryer. Overall, bathroom aside, this hotel is comfortable and clean, easy to get to all the attractions and well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Leonje
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights at the end of May/beginning of June. Check-in and Check-out were fast and easy. Front desk was always manned with English speakers. Our room was great. The bed was soft, comfortable, and large. The AC worked fine. As long as you're familiar with Celsius, you shouldn't have a problem controlling the temperature of the room. Bathroom and shower were clean. One odd thing is that there is a window in the bathroom that looks out onto the bedroom. We are a married couple, so it didn't bother us, but if I were staying with a friend, I probably wouldn't appreciate that feature. Overall, we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, lives up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: katiel33
Reviews.Content: I decided on this hotel on the strength of the reviews and was not disappointed. It has a good location with loads of bars and restaurants nearby. Really close to the Metro as well. The hotel staff were very helpful and the room itself was comfortable and well equipped. One point though - it did overlook the central courtyard, which we were prepared for, but didn't realise just how little light entered the room. It could be quite oppressive, but we were only in there to sleep so it didn't bother us. I will use the hotel again and book an upgrade. We took a cab to the hotel from the airport but it would have been very simple to get the train and metro (and a whole lot cheaper). Didn't use the restaurant at all, but followed the advice of the other reviewers and got breakfast at Dino Pan on the corner. Very very cheap. The hotel has a luggage room and were happy to store our bags all day after we had checked out. Overall its a good choice of hotel but not right in the centre, so be prepared to walk or use the metro to get to the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to recommend this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mstucker
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the U232 in Barcelona June 1-3, 2011 and had a great experience. We arrived very early in the morning, hours before check in, but the friendly and helpful staff stored our luggage for us, gave us the wireless code, and a comfortable place to sit and relax. By the time we'd had a cup of coffee and checked our email, our (spacious) room was ready. If I was forced to find one fault, it would be that something they used in the hotel (an air freshener or cleaner?) was a bit overpowering. It was located in a nice area with easy access to anything you would want. I would gladly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel, loved the city!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverClimber
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 8 nights at this hotel in April 2011. My stay here was fantastic. I loved the staff, loved the ample size of the room and loved that I was far enough away from the downtown that I had to walk 30 minutes to get anywhere (although this might not be for everyone). The staff spoke English very well and seemed to either want to speak English or Catalan as they were very proud of their Catalan heritage. The staff were also very eager to help one out to find a nice restaurant and I took them up on their offer on more than one occasion. There were 2 slight downsides: a) the room pointed at nothing, but hey! I don't stay in a different city for a perfect landscape view b) Breakfast was way too expensive, and so I didn't pay for it. Next time I stay in Barcelona I would come back to this hotel as I really enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great value.”
Reviews.Author: alanhui
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a good location near the metro. Walkable to major shopping area. Lots of restaurants near by. The hotel is clean and has a more contemporary design. Much better value than any other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Room 222”
Reviews.Author: CndnGuider
Reviews.Content: Avoid this room at all costs. We had stayed at the hotel previously and had a lovely room. On return at the end of our tour, we were given this room. The shower leaks which causes a major flood in the bathroom. The flooding has been going on for a while as the door jam is swollen and the door to the shower/toilet area sticks, if you are lucky enough to have the strength to pull it out at all. There is hardly anywhere to put a makeup bag, no towel racks and very little space to place your suitcases. The lock on the door was broken so we ended up putting our suitcase against the door at night so that we would not have any surprise visitors. The location was great as the subway was near. The hotel reception was very good at recommending places to sight see and how to get there. We walked to most places from the hotel or took the metro. Breakfast was so so and it would have been nice to have something other than hard boiled eggs.

Reviews.Title: “Superb vibe”
Reviews.Author: philfromdenver
Reviews.Content: We loved this place. Modern, nice, safe, quiet neighborhood. Staff (especially Toni, thanks Toni) very informative and helpful. Transportation is easy and close (metro , bus, taxi). Sagrada Familia is all it's cracked up to be. Loved the Gothic quarter. Didn't use hotel restaurant but got great neighborhood recommendations on various eateries from staff. Excellent value too! Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Eixample”
Reviews.Author: Bluenoser80
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the U232 for 5 nights while we were on holiday in Spain. Location - The hotel is located on the western perimeter of the Eixample district, very close to the Diagonal (a street that runs diagonally through Barcelona). The location, though not in the main tourist area, served us quite well during. The "Hospital Clinic" metro stop is about 100 meters from the hotel, so when we didn't want to walk somewhere, we were able to get around very easily. It wasn't always easy to find good restaurants in the area, however, so we ate elsewhere in the city on a couple of occasions. Room - Our room was very clean and a reasonable size. We certainly didn't feel that it was too small for our five-night stay. There was also ample room to put away our clothes for the duration of our stay. The washroom was nice despite a small amount of water vapor damage that was visible on the ceiling (I don't know why they don't use bathroom fans in Spain, but that would likely take care of the issue). The shower head produced an absolutely amazing "rainfall" shower. I had some trouble with the AC controls, it seemed that the choice was either on or off. Our room was in the back of the hotel and was very quiet. Service - The service from the hotel staff was good. They always had time to answer our questions or make recommendations. The hotel also provides its guests with free high-speed internet. Overall, we'd recommend the U232. We had booked this hotel well in advance and got a good early-booking rate for our room. Any rate you can get under 130 euros per night (breakfast not included) during the peak tourist season should be considered a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: renosteve95
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. The staff was super friendly. The hotel is within walking distance of almost all of the tourist sights but away form all the hustle and bustle. Right on the metro line so easy to move around if you don't want to walk. One of the only negatives was that the shower was so low flow that we could barely get clean. The room was clean but did not have a view of the street as advertised. But that turned out to be OK with us.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: gotboxr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decorated in sleek modern, and the rooms feature lots of black marble and ultra-modern decor. The conveniences within the room were excellent and the wifi worked beautifully. The room size was more than adequate, and although the view out the window was less than scenic, it did permit opening the window and getting in fresh air. the bathroom was very well-designed except for the shower - one had to get into the shower to turn the water on, and hope that the spray would be of an acceptable temperature. There was also a mysterious dial/gauge on the wall which truned out to be a non-connected music system. I found the breakfast to be excellent, with lots to choose from except for a lack of good fresh fruit. But there are lots and lots of nearby cafes for a quick coffee and pastry in the am. Staff was helpful and friendly, and efficient to boot. The location is an out-of-the-way one, but a short 3 minute walk to the metro made it ultra-convenient. The area was quiet after dark which was a major plus. My only reservation was the lack of nearby restaurants...lot and lots of quickie cafes, but only a few dinner spots and they, of course, didn't open until 8pm. I'd happily recommend this hotel to anyone who doesnt's demand being in the center of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: eclipze006
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night during the end of May. I wish I could have stayed longer! I am extremely picky when it comes to choosing hotels; I want a place that is stylish and modern without breaking the bank. This place fit the bill perfectly!! We paid about 150$US for one night which was very reasonable for the value. The hotel has a semi-masculine feel to it, but in a good way... the colour palette of the hotel is uniform throughout - white, beiges, browns and black. The decor is really outstanding. It feels cozy, but has a 1930-1940s vibe to it. There is jazz music playing throughout the lobby. Internet (and printing services) are free. There are a few beautiful living type rooms throughout the hotel with tvs and comfy chairs. Our room, 611, had a gorgeous view and a huge balcony. Anna at the front desk was super sweet and helpful. Stop looking, and pick this place!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, fantastic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Chilli-Pip
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located very close to the Metro and Red Tour bus line which is a great option for exploring this city. The double room we stayed in was spacious and well laid out including an excellent bathroom. Reception staff were very polite and heplful.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsTravelg
Reviews.Content: Having stayed a couple of times at this Hotel, if offers great value for money, very stylish accommodation, however some of these are internal so no real daylight but fine if you want to party all night and sleep in late. The hotel is a little distance away from the tourist sites, but it is close to the Hospital Clinic metro station, so getting around Barcelona is easy. Some rooms even have 2 bathrooms, great showers, beds might be a touch too hard for some travellers, best rates I have found was booking through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “great stay - will recommend to our friends for Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SnLTravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona U232 hotel for the first leg of our honeymoon. We loved this hotel! Good location (close to metro, away from the touristy area, nice restaurants around, great cafe/bakery less than a block away). Getting there Took the rail line from the El Prat BCN Airport, Transferred to the L5 at Placa Sants station (about 40 min commute). If you land in T1, take the free shuttle to T2 (about 10 mins). Hospital Clinic station was easy, two short blocks away - don't even have to cross the street if you leave from the correct exit. We arrived at the hotel around 9:30 pm on a Monday, felt safe. The reception staff was very helpful, check-in was painless and quick. They spoke flawless English, and even helped us book a restaurant in the neighborhood for us very helpful. The room is exactly as the webpage portrays. Fantastic bathroom, large for a Euro-hotel, comfortable king. We had a courtyard room on floor 1, which was great- the main street -Urgell is very loud in the mornings especially on the weekdays as its a main street buzzing with traffic. Its good to avoid the view and opt for the quiet courtyard. Location was fantastic! We took a peek into the hotel breakfast and decided to go local instead. We skipped breakfast at the hotel - and went to my favorite place in all of Barcelona - Dino Pan (a chain bakery) on the very same block as the hotel down the street. GREAT VALUE. We grabbed breakfast here EVERY day. Lots of good restaurants in the area -Vinya Roel ,La Mamasita, Balthazar (2 to 4 blocks away). Good bars in the area for tapas hopping if you wanted as well. The neighborhood is very local and safe - We don't like the crowded tourist areas and we just want to experience the culture of every day life when we travel. The close metro stop will help you get to the main sites of Barcelona with an easy transfer. For all my friends who visit Barcelona, I will recommend the U232. Great hotel. If we ever return - I will not hesitate to book again and not shop around. Great place!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL EVER...”
Reviews.Author: KARELLE23
Reviews.Content: We just love that Hotel, People were so so so so and so so friendly and warm...We couldn't believe how easy it was to get a taxi, without waiting... The room was cleaned everyday and very well, it was just a pleasure to be there, i can't wait to go back again, surely next year we'll be back. Karelle and Graham

Reviews.Title: “A well placed, friendly and comfortable hotel with excellent support from staff before and during our overnight stay.”
Reviews.Author: KevHurst023
Reviews.Content: Far enough away from the busy centre but conveniently placed by the metro and within easy walking distance of Las Ramblas. All staff were friendly and helpful, particularly Fernanda who was in charge of reception during our visit, and who responded very helpfully to our e mails before our stay. Our room was of a good size and very comfortable. We will happily stay again.. Kevin Hurst

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a company break”
Reviews.Author: caroHolland
Reviews.Content: We stayed in U232 for the annual company break of Numa Group. Rooms are great although airconditioning was not working well in every room. Breakfast and location are good.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Bodi44
Reviews.Content: We originally booked at U232's sister hotel Hotel Jazz but found a great special in the upscale area in Barcelona called Eixample. We had a basic room so no view but the room was well appointed, clean, modern, offered complimentary WiFi and breakfast. The bed was a little weird because there was no headboard. The staff was great and made wonderful restaurant recommendations. This hotel is 1 1/2 block from a subway stop and is surrounded by great restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small modern hotel, friendly, english-capable staff.”
Reviews.Author: adl235
Reviews.Content: We liked this, small, modern hotel very much. The desk staff was great, spoke english well, very helpful with directions and suggestions. Our room was spotless and comfortable,, although it looked out only onto an air shaft (no view, but very quiet). We didn't get the breakfast, but the lobby bar was very nice. Separate room with two free internet terminals and printer was great.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Hotel at a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lwitchel
Reviews.Content: A very positive experience. The hotel offered a very good rate for a fully cancellable booking - under €85/night. We arrived early in the morning, but the hotel let us have our rooms immediately - greatly appreciated after an overnight flight. Desk staff were friendly and helpful, the rooms are stylish and comfortable. (Smallish by American standards, but just fine actually) Wifi Internet is free, and there is a computer center for printing boarding passes and the like. The location is slightly off the beaten path (in Eixample about a 20 minute walk from the Passeig de Gracia) but take advantage of that and view the beautiful Beaux Arts architecture in the neighborhood. It's also nice to have some distance from the Rambla. I did not eat breakfast at the hotel (there are inexpensive cafes right on the corner) and there is no gym. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, clean, contemporary and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: lukepricey
Reviews.Content: There are many great things about this hotel. Firstly, It's location. The hotel is not right in and amongst the action of Barcelona's main centre/old town/tourist locations but it is very close to the 'Hotel Clinic' metro station - basically, across the road. This station is also directly connected to the 'Saints Estacio' station via the blue metro line, this means that you only have to make one change after a train from the airport. The Hospital Clinic station is just a few stops from the Segrada Familia, it also runs diagonal across the city so it connects to many other lines. The Hotel itself is very contemporary, tastefully decorated and lighted, this provides a very tranquil, pleasant atmosphere. The staff are fluent in English, pleasant and helpful, i couldn't ask for more. They made our check in/out process totally easy. When we asked to put our bags in the hold after checking out, they promptly did this for us, straight away, they marked up the bags infront of us and quickly stored them away - unlike in other hotels when they pile them up with the rest and do it later, leaving you nervous! The room was inviting, very nicely decorated and exactly as they looked in the promotional pictures. The room was clean, fresh and air conditioned. The air conditioning worked and was easy to use. The bed and bedding was of high quality and comfortable. The furnishings were of excellent quality, My mother owns the acrylic chair they have in the rooms and they are worth well over £100! The bathroom was clean, stylish and well equipped with quality fittings and appliances, the hairdryer was modern too! Towels and toiletries were good quality and were replaced daily. The room had free wireless internet access, this was a great little perk, just make sure you ask for the WiFi code when you check in. It was nice to use it to research places to eat/see using my tripadvisor app on my iPhone! The room had a nice balcony overlooking residential buildings, we never used it to sit on but it was nice to stand at for some fresh air in the morning! All in all, an excellent stay and i would make a point of going back and recommending this establishment. I have stayed in 5 star hotels in London less equipped than this place. We took a chance with this hotel and it paid off. The ONLY drawback, and i mean ONLY - the TV. The signal of the English channels was poor and unreliable but hey, you don't go to Barcelona to watch telly do you?! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: marlonsams
Reviews.Content: Very nice, stylish and functional hotel. Close to metro and bus turistic stop. Great staff. Breakfast is a bit overpriced but plenty of options within 1-2 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Hotel, ideally located for city visits”
Reviews.Author: weimera63
Reviews.Content: Together with my wife and my 14 year old son, we stayed for 3 nights at the U232. The hotel is well maintained and very clean. Although it is a bit off the city centre, the Metro is just a 5 minutes walk away and it takes you to the centre within minutes only. Although the price for the breakfast is a bit on the high side, there is enough variety and the quality of the food is good. We had a family-room for 3, which was quite spacious, however the downside of it is that windows only overlook a small clean patio with hardly and day-light. Considering that we only stayed at the hotel to sleep and have a shower, this didn't really bother us. The only real negative thing to report, is that the waiter at the bar, offered a lousy service and didn't seem to be very willing to serve the guest as we had to order and pick-up our drinks ourselves from the bar. On our third night, there was a young lady at the bar and service was perfect. All in all, I really recommend this hotel. I would as well use it for business-travel in case I would need to go to Barcelona again for business purposes.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: tuitai
Reviews.Content: Very happy with this hotel. Great location, very close to ATM, Cafe and Metro. The two of us got upgraded to a three-person room with two bathroom. It was really a luxury. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. One drawback is the room is very dark because the window is facing a small courtyard, definitely very quiet and great for sleeping. I've no hesitation to recommend this hotel anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: ParcMercer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and the room is great with two twin beds and two bathrooms, truly a luxury for how much we pay for. One downside is the room has a window facing inside and is dark in the morning that didn't bother us. It is very closed to Metro and great cafe for a quick breakfast. The receptionists are very friendly and knowledgeable. We will come back again and stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Best City Hotel I have ever stayed in, will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ryan1489
Reviews.Content: Part owning and managing a seperate 5* guesthouse in Bath I was both absolutely delighted and concerned by this hotel, for all the RIGHT reasons. I booked in advance this hotel for three nights as a birthday treat for my girlfriend. I booked a suite U232 room (901) and has been in touch on many occassions prior to arrival for advice, assistance in terms of my reservation and also to have restaurants booked on my behalf. On each occassion I was well assisted even though Im sure I must have seemed a nuisance, I just wanted it all to be perfect. They seemed to understand and were nothing but polite and helpful. The room was sensational, large room, but not huge, an INCREDIBLE bathroom, one I certainly plan to recreate in my own home, well equipped and with the added bonus of a wonderful private terrace. The terrace and bathroom was really great. The bed was also very comfortable. The only slight nags I could possibly issue are that the furniture outside does get wet as the terrace is not covered. Then again, if it were covered you';d lose some view which would be a pity. Another highlight was breakfast, for a european city hotel this really was first class, yes it is a buffet but the food is well made and very tasty with a wide selection. We also tried one morning the breakfast in bed at no extra cost and this too arrived on time, at the correct temperature and well prepared. Location wise, I cannot fathom the criticism, if one wants to stay on La Rambla with the street hawks and football fans then fine. But for me U232 is ideally situated, the metro system works like a dream, very regular, lots of space, clean and very cheap. Literally takes door to door under 10 minuts to any of the main attractions: La Rambla, Sagrada Familia, Park Guell, Montjuic or the harbour. Finally, the big bonus, the staff, again, in comparison to other city centre hotels thsi was second to none, the staff were friendly, polite, helpful and informed. Managing a guesthouse this is usually my selling point as the main differential from city hotels, however U232 proved that personal service is achievable in these larger venues. This was my concern, if other hotels were to cotton on to this, guesthouses such as mine would no longer have a market. I hope they wont and that U232 stays a unique shining light. I would like to partcularly thank Cristina, who helped me with my initial reservation and also aided my requests, she was also ably aided by two other colleagues who helped answer questions and make reservations for me. I would also like to thank the gentleman who we often saw at reception during our stay, I believe his name to be Miguel (could never quite make out his name badge in the light) young gentleman receptionist who was so helpful, polite and courtious. Thank all of you and I look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Modern”
Reviews.Author: LindaC22
Reviews.Content: Arrived @ 11 am, and was able to check in straight away. Staff friendly and polite. Our room was on the 10th floor and just as we had imagined it would be, clean, modern and very spacious. Bathrooms nice only down side was that one of the showers did not work and the one that did was slow. One big down side for me was that we were unable to have the use of an iron in the room as the hotel only offer an ironing service. Hotel location only one block away and very easy to use! We had a T10 ticket and this lasted for three days for two of us and the cost was under 9 Euro. I would recommend this hotel as all in all we really enjoyed having it as a base for our city trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and quiet”
Reviews.Author: IkkoMo
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the U232 for 3 nights. The hotel is very clena and nicely decorated if a bit dark but it adds to the atmosphere. The service at the front desk was very good, staff very helpful. The rooms are a good size and on par with the decor inthe lobby, flat screen tv with a bit of a dodgy signal on international channel. Bathroom was great, you could spend hours in the big shower. We stayed in room 307 which is at the back and there was no noise whatsoever, no view either though. The Hotel is very close to the Hospital Clinic metro stop which is great but as this particular line runs west to east you need to change at the next stop to head down to the main city part. No biggy though. The metro is great and a single is €1.45. As in many spanish hotels, breakfast in not included, it's an extra €14 in the U232 hotel which is crazy. We had all our breakfasts in the little student packed cafe called Dino Pane, cafe con leche with 2 croissants is only €2.10! The bar in the hotel is very dear too, stay away from as there are plenty of bar (with a terrace) to choose from in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Barcelona launch pad”
Reviews.Author: Condolla
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at U232 last weekend and loved it, and the price we paid for it. The location was fantastic - it was easy to walk to most of the places we wanted to see or we took a quick cab ride. There is a metro stop close to the hotel too. The rooms were extremely clean and nicely decorated. We found the beds very comfortable and the shower actually had good pressure (unusual for Europe!). Finally, the staff was very helpful. They offered us great restaurant suggestions and took care of our every need.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Anks11
Reviews.Content: U232 is in a residential area of Barcelona. There are good cafes nearby for lunch and breakfast & I don't think breakfast is of good value in U232 (14 euros per person). Hotel rooms were good, bathrooms were very nice. No tea & coffee making facility and there is no provision of kettle, etc. Reception staff was brilliant. Hotel is well connected with public transport therefore you can go out late in the night. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near as good as many reviews suggest”
Reviews.Author: TheAltman
Reviews.Content: Booked this based upon TripAdvisor Reviews, and must say, was quite disappointed. Let's start with the good stuff: staff are very helpful and pleasant; the place is impeccably clean; aircon works perfectly. The not so good stuff: the rooms are tiny (you could not swing a cat in them) and our rooms (206 and 306) had no views whatsoever. The bathrooms are incredibly small. The rooms we had were next to the lifts, and were very noisy. The location is not as good as many make out: it is 20 minutes' walk to the centre, or a tube journey that involes changes. Best to take a taxi when leaving this place. Breakfast was average but on the positive side, served,in a clean room and by very polite staff. Stay here if you can handle shoe box rooms, and if you are on a budget. If not, stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Bit Far Out, But Service and Value Make Up For It”
Reviews.Author: Kasivia
Reviews.Content: My title says it all. It is a cool little hotel with nice rooms and wifi, i'd spring for the u232 rooms. The front desk guys were money and always had the solid dinner recommendations in the neighborhood. As everyone said it is a four minute stroll to the subway stop (Hospital Clinic is its name), but it is on the blue line, so you will have to change trains to get to/from the Ramblas, Beach, El Born, Park Guell or the Train Station that goes out to Monserrat. It is the right line to the airport train and Sagrada Familia though. I'd stay here again unless I could find a comperable price closer. That's my take! You could do a lot worse.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, cozy and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: LiisuDublin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for few nights. Before arriving to Barcelona we visited Malaga and Valencia. We were tired from all this traveling and I did not have any expectations for this hotel. The minute we walked in I was smiling. There was something special about it. Very cozy and clean. Room was very , very cozy and I had a great sleep in there. We did not enjoy Barcelona itself but thanks to this hotel i at least could relax. Really enjoyed staying in the hotel. Staff was excellent. And having a cold beer in the lobby was even special. Like I said previously there is something about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ellen_faith
Reviews.Content: After deciding at the last minute to go to Barcelona on business, I was slightly concerned about the accommodations I'd be able to secure with such a large conference and exposition coming to town. What a joy to have u232 Hotel as a home base. I arrived at about 11:30am on Thursday, and being greeted by the multilingual staff was comforting. They had my reservation (through booking.com) and an available room for me. I booked a single and expected an extremely small but well-appointed room. It turns out the "L"-shaped entry/foyer was about as large as I thought the room would be...but then there was an actual room as well, with a small balcony, two beds, ceiling beams, dark marble bathroom....sigh. I was almost tempted to take a nap but decided to run around and get to know the city. U232 is two blocks from the Metro. As many had mentioned here, the hotel is not in the center of it all, but it is close enough and the Metro runs a very admirable schedule, very efficient. I could go on and on about the Metro, but that is for another forum. More about the hotel...the decor is very masculine and warm, with dark woods, striped and leather couches, bold, simple and large images on the walls. Impeccably clean. . Even the shampoo smelled masculine, which was a nice diversion. My saving grace was the hotel’s business center, which was not much to speak of, only with two computers and one printer, a seating area and a conference table. But because I’d made my reservation so late, I was unable to secure an international BlackBerry and decided to leave my compute behind. The business center really came through for me in this sense. Oh, and there are little candies in a bowl on the reception desk which are lovely, and the beer they have on tap is very refreshing. I loved the bathroom, but wish I had the time to love it more. Great water pressure. Towel warming rack. Weird non-bidet thingy. And what the hell is the wand on the hose? Nobody could figure it out!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, cool staff, and good location”
Reviews.Author: radbeardoc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last Sat and Sunday after I got tired of getting rejected by priceline for Las Ramblas/Barceloneta about 5 times. Although this hotel is not in Las Ramblas, the location is very convenient, less than 5 minute walk from the Hospital Clinic metro stop. A fun visit to Barcelona does not require you live in Las Ramblas (I actually did not really like that area when I walked around there--just too touristy). The metro is very easy, convenient, and cheap (2 day pass was 11.50 euros), runs late on Fri, and all night on Sat. If you are out late at night drinking, the hotel is walking distance from most places in the city. The staff gave me some great recommendations, and a local friend also took me to a great Chilean restaurant (Hugo's). Another day we found by chance, La Taverna del Born. Both were not too touristy (the restaurants lining Las Ramblas tend to be more expensive and touristy, according to my friend, a native Barcelonan). The hotel staff were very friendly, and there is internet (2 computers) and wifi free! you can even print for free--so they don't nickel and dime you. I hate when you pay $100 for a room and they want to charge you $5 for 15 minutes of internet use (it's not so much the money, but the principle). So don't hesitate, and waste 6 hours online trying to find a decent hotel (like I did). I recommend this hotel and would return next time.

Reviews.Title: “Past Reviews Are All True!”
Reviews.Author: onthego030
Reviews.Content: Modern, clean, quiet neighborhood, close to the subway, we could not ask for more. Let me join with everyone else by strongly recommending this hotel to travelers. The staff was especially helpful in giving us advice on visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FIND!”
Reviews.Author: TexasKeepExploring
Reviews.Content: This hotel has excellent location, service and price. Staff is very friendly and helpful. We were very impressed. We had read reviews on Trip Advisor and booked hotel in advance. We were very pleased with our results.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, very friendly in a great location”
Reviews.Author: greggylopez
Reviews.Content: We loved u232. From the very start till we left the staff could not have been more polite and helpful. The welcome drink was our best cocktail in Spain in their very chic little bar. The rooms were so comfortable, the breakfast was tasty and fresh, and the location was brilliant if you don't mind using the metro. We did walk to the wharf on the first day but after that used the nearby subway for easy access to everything Barcelona. We loved our dinner at local pizza restaurant and went to a tourist flamenco performance which was good fun and not too expensive for the show and a simple meal for 25€. Best was wandering the streets and being gobsmacked by the incredible buildings. Of courseLa Segrada Familia was mind blowing and well worth the entry fee.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, pleasant evening staff”
Reviews.Author: Slushypipp
Reviews.Content: We seem to have different priorities than many visitors to Barcelona -- we explicitly wanted to stay in the Eixample, and be near to the Passeig de Gràcia. We were following the Ruta del Modernisme guide book, and were interested primarily in the works of Gaudi, Domenech i Montaner, and Puig i Cadafalch. However, if you're looking to spend time in the Barri Gothic or visit the waterfront, expect a 12 euro cab ride. The metro, however, is right around the corner and easily accessible. We did not have the breakfast, although there are at least 6 bakeries within a block of the hotel, so if it's unappealing to you, many things around the area should suit better. The gentleman working reception when we arrived was a bit reticent and uncongenial, and after quite a bit of travel, this was unfortunate. For instance, one of our keys didn't work in the door, and we didn't discover until two days later that it had been coded for a different room. Once we were able to enter, however, we were unable to turn on any lights. If it's common to have to use one's room key to turn on the lights in hotels, I have somehow yet to have encountered it, and it would have been nice had the gentleman at reception told us about this detail. So, if you stay at this hotel: your room key turns on the lights, and it must remain in the light lock for the entire time you expect the lights to be operational. However, the woman at the desk in the evening was friendly and helpful, and even helped us a bit with both Spanish and Catalan pronunciation. The woman tending the bar is certainly at home in the chic design boutique hotel environment, and mixes excellent drinks. And when my husband fell under the weather with allergies (which are apparently uncommon in Barcelona), she was sympathetic, and helpfully attempted hot-toddies to soothe his throat, though she was unfamiliar with the practice.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, if you like it hot”
Reviews.Author: Iceberg678
Reviews.Content: Recently renovated hotel. Well done. Good reception, atmosphere. Excellent, very friendly and helpful staff. Good breakfast. Overall very positive impression. We had a triple room. Unfortunately the triple rooms face an internal courtyard which is covered. So no fresh air circulation. With all our systems off, we at one moment had an internal room temperature of 29 degrees. So, in the midst of winter, we switched on the Airco. Call me a complainer, but I do not like sleeping with Airco either. So, if you like to sleep in a warm room, do go there.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here any time I visit Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: ramonaruby
Reviews.Content: We love a boutique hotel, whether in the US or abroad. We were so thankful to have found U232, and can say without a doubt that it is where we will stay anytime we return to Barcelona. The prices were great, the hotel very chic, and the staff ridiculously friendly and helpful and spoke great English. To find this place, I used my two trusty travel tools: Kayak to check for the lowest prices and TripAdvisor to compare top rated hotels with real customer reviews. I cross-check using the two tools and narrow down my hotel choices in that way. One of the things we loved the best about this hotel is that it was NOT in the middle of the tourist area near Las Ramblas. Why did we love this? Several reasons: first, the price was better; second, the restaurants near our hotel's prices were better; and third, we got more of an "authentic" experience since the food places we visited were filled with locals and not tourists. Being away from Las Ramblas did not make it difficult for us to see some of the tourist attractions, since the hotel is right near a subway stop, and it was just a few subway stops (or a long walk) away from Las Ramblas and many of the famouse Gaudi buildings. We also love the free internet access so that we could check-in with folks back in the US. Some tips: As I mentioned above, Barcelona has a great public transportation system. We were able to save TONS of money on taxis by using the subway. You can honestly get nearly anywhere you need to go in Barcelona by using the subway (including the airport). We got 10 ride passes for around 8 Euro, which could get the two of us around all day between the hotel, restaurants that were not in walking distance, and tourist attractions (each cab ride is 15-30 Euro to give you some comparison). You can also save up loose change and use that for 1-way rides.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,modern clean and a joy to stay in”
Reviews.Author: Gavster1986
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great value for money, big spacious rooms with a great modern feel and close to the metro for easy travel around barca. We got the train from the airport to barca station and then got a 4 day metro pass for 20 euros and got on line 5 to hospital clinc stop and hotel was just up the street, very convenient. With the 4 day pass you can travel any where round barca on the metro with most of the major sights being really close to metro stops. All in all this hotel was a great place to stay and would recommend this to anyone and would come back again and again Gav and amy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sroch59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night before cruise. The hotel is very modern and the Desk staff very helpful.he rooms have flat screen TVs and are large. . Yhe hotel is wired for WIFI. We ate breakfast at a coffe shop on corner. Very convenient

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Mish2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed our expectations. We found the hotel after reviewing several hotels on trip advisor. We travelled through Europe during the month of December and we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel, the rooms and the service. This was by far the best hotel we stayed at in Europe. The room was very large by European standards and very clean. We were in room 906 and the room had a balcony and a king size bed with lots of space. The staff were so helpful and friendly, especially Manuel. The hotel everything except for a bottle opener. The only downside is that you have to take the Metro to the city centre but the Metro is 2 minutes away from the hotel. There is also a market and many great restaurants within walking distance. We would definitely come back here the next time we visit Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “A hotel worth a visit or two or even more”
Reviews.Author: Scotforever
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Barcelona and we stayed at the U232 after reading the reviews. It almost scored 5/5 for everything, but alas we could hear the lifts in our room, which whilst not sleep disturbing to us could be to others. The room itself was enormous, the bed massive, plenty of storage (something lacking in many other hotels we have stayed in, in Europe. All very clean, spotless with a double walk in shower with 'watering can heads'. Eletcric blind to take the edge off the bright sun and a balcony with great views on the area. Staff were all very helpful, friendly and courteous and polite. We got caught up in the 'snow' at Heathrow issue, so had to stay a couple of extra nights, the rate was excellent and that in itslef shows the hotel is run properly, we could have been charged and probably would have in other cities, but not at the U232. We had breakfast each morning and felt it was worth the 14euro, much cheaper again than many other cities and as long as you have an appetite then well worht the money. The hotel is not in the centre itself, but it is very well located with the metro less than 2 mins away. Plenty of places to eat, shop and a nice safe area to walk around, the Diagonal is close by and if anything its location for access to the airport outweighs the extra 5 mins on the metro. Did i say the metro was well run, clean, safe and excellent value, being a londoner by birth it shames me to see how to sun a public transport system, minimal staff, fast frequent trains and easy to use. So next time you are going to visit Barcelona (again, as once is never enough) or plan your first trip, stay at the U232 and experience service as it should be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location.”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne29
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and were very happy here. Front desk staff (especially Cristina) helpful and friendly. The room and bathroom were clean,clean,clean. Metro stop (Hospital Clinic) nearby. We did not eat at the hotel but walked each morning to have a roll and coffee on one of the side streets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wexable4u
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel on the strength of positive reviews on tripadvisor. The hotel was a wonderful choice. We were greeted by Cristina, who took care of us and provided us with everything we needed. She is friendly, and has a great sense of humor. All the employees we spoke to were courteous, and all had a great command of English. Special kudos to Cristina, and Georgina as well. When I made my reservation, i asked for a quiet room, and a room in the rear of the hotel was provided (room 904.) No BS about "oh, we couldn't hold a rear room for you.) The location is quite nice. It's in a quiet area near the Metro, which whisked us all over town very efficiently. Close to restaurants, bakeries and stores, we found everything that was needed. Our friends were very pleased with their room too, and they loved the balcony, which was larger than the room! Yes, they turn off the A/C at the drop of a hat, and crank up the heat. Our room was warm, but it was 45 degrees outside! We opened the door to our balcony before bed time, and the room cooled off nicely. One more negative...breakfast is not included, and costs 15 euros. With the euro being $1.38 American bucks, this is quite high. We went to a bakery and bought croissants and coffee for $5. There is very little not to like about this hotel, and i rate it 4 1/2 (nothing is perfect!.) Wexable4u, Florida, USA

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, all the necessary services, great closet”
Reviews.Author: Marge246
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week during a conference. It provided everything we needed, had a great location, friendly but not overly intrusive staff, and a nice ambiance. Pro's: -Close to a metro stop and three cheap but great bakery places that serve late night pizza, bakery in the morning - it was possible to get breakfast for 3 euros within steps of the hotel. Metro is very close to Placa Catalunya and Passeig de Gracia stops - great for shopping and Gaudi sightseeing. -Balcony with our room! -Awesome open closet with very flexible cubbies and drawers which was helpful for two women with a week's worth of business clothes and shopping trophies. -Free wifi! Do you hear that, U.S. nice hotels? -Fridge with mini bar -great shower head Cons: -As another guest stated, temperatures were a challenge. The Spanish crank the heat at the slightest provocation. We solved this by turning the heat off all together. -Mattresses were ok but not wonderful. Blanket was also the bedspread (yuck) and obviously isn't cleaned between guests. Overall it was a very nice experience and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small, centrally located Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: dick_lake
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights before and two nights after a Royal Caribbean cruise. Being centrally located it allowed us to walk to many places; public systems within a few blocks. The hotel is relatively small, recently updated with adequately sized rooms (very nice bathroom), efficient personnel. Bar is excellent, Breakfast a bit pricey at 13 Euros but good. A number of small resturants are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious, convenient and well located! Heating problems.”
Reviews.Author: mjchiu2k
Reviews.Content: This hotel would have gotten a 5 if it wasn't for their problems with maintaining a comfortable temperature. It was already winter, so they had the heat on. However, it was turned on to the point where the rooms were way too hot if you left the door closed. They had a balcony door that you could open, but the hotel is on a relatively busy street that can be pretty noisy. The rooms had air conditioners, but even after calling the front desk, I wasn't able to feel a difference once I turned it on. That was my only complaint. Other than that everything was great. The hotel and the rooms are all impeccable in their style and cleanliness. The bathrooms were huge and very luxurious feeling. They even had a heated mirror so that it wouldn't steam up from taking a shower. The room is well designed and they really think of everything to make you comfortable. The front desk was very helpful in answering any questions. They spoke English very well. They were also offer us a room as soon as we arrived (which was at 9am). Pros: *Well located: Metro is a quick block away. You can go anywhere in Barcelona using the metro. Many good restaurants within walking distance.
