There is a convenient store down the block that is open all the time. *Free Internet, Computers, and Printers: This service was great. They had a business center that was open all the time. It had two computers and a printer. This was extremely helpful in that we could print directions to where we wanted to go. They also had wifi in the rooms, although I would say the signal was on the weak side. Con: *Poor temperature control

Reviews.Title: “Best place we stayed in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Teresa055
Reviews.Content: This was the first place we stayed of many places in Europe during this summer. Little did we know this would be the best place. Service was excellent. The front desk staff were always very helpful. The room style was very nice and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and beautiful. The air-con worked really good. Which we took for granted until we experienced the rest of Europe in the summer. The value for this hotel was really good. The only possible negative was it wasn't located where the action/beach were. It would also be nice to have a pool in the summer. Other then that everything was great. It was still close to the metro and the Barcelona bus tour. Great Stay!

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: RossiUdi-Brasil
Reviews.Content: We spent five great nights in Barcelona and the hotel is very well located. The metro station (Hospital Clinic) is only 2 blocks away and less than 15 minutes from Plaça de Catalunya by metro. The hotel is pretty clean (bathroom, sheets, etc) and the front desk staff is very friendly, polite and helpful. It's a "must stay" if you go to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Perfect location. Nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Plusz
Reviews.Content: hotel is located in very nice area. Not crowded, but 1 minute from metro station L5 and about 15 minutes from La Rambla street. Very friendly staff, good service, rooms exactly as on pictures. Reasonable price. Breakfast is impressive. Good choice of dishes in nice decorated place. Highly recommended. Free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent”
Reviews.Author: collegecollege
Reviews.Content: Our stay was lovely, the staff very helpfull, friendly and very polite. Servises very good, food very good, the whole ambiance is so homy. We loved our stay and we thak you all for making it such a great one. Peter and Orna Young

Reviews.Title: “Really quiet area”
Reviews.Author: alreadyhoodges
Reviews.Content: Nice room, kind staff, is not in the city center but the area is nice, quiet and the underground ( hospital clinic) is really near. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: aelovesbeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in room 205. It was facing the back with a terrace. The room was very modern and updated. The bed was comfy and we had access to wifi in our room. We paid under 70 Euro / night for our room - Excellent for the price. We liked the location since it was not in the middle of the city center but close enough. The metro stop is less than 2 blocks away. The airport is about 20 min away by car without traffic. The taxi fare was about 35 Euros. We took the train and metro to the hotel which I thought was not worth to save the money as there is a lot stairs and there wasn't an elevator at every location if you have luggage. The staff was very helpful whenever he had questions or when we had an issue with our safe. beware as not many restaurants in the area of the hotel are open on sundays and holidays. also beware of pick pocketers.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel and customer service”
Reviews.Author: beanstravels
Reviews.Content: We originally booked our stay at SOHO, U232’s sister hotel. A few days prior to arrival, I received an email asking if it would be ok to switch us to U232 due to some maintenance work at SOHO. We quickly checked the hotel’s location and decided that we had no problem making the change—what a great decision! In appreciation for our flexibility, we were upgraded to one of the best rooms in the hotel and the staff went out of their way to accommodate us. Getting to the hotel from the airport was very easy and took no more than 40 minutes. Take the train to Sants train station (3rd stop), switch to the metro and get off at Hospital Clinic stop (take the Urgell street exit). Per previous reviewer’s recommendation, we bought a T10 pass at the airport train station for 7.85 Euro, and used it for 10 separate fares on Barcelona’s public transport. This was perfect for our 3 days in the city. The walk from the hotel to Barri Gotic and Ramblas is very doable, 30-40 minutes, but I’d honestly recommend taking the metro-it’s both efficient and convenient. Breakfast at the hotel was very good and one could not ask for a wider variety of choices. As far as the room, hair dryer & most toiletries (no hair conditioner) were provided but no iron (this seems to be common in Spain). The bed was comfy! The hotel was very clean and the staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. There is no additional charge for WiFi. Based on our experience, I’d highly recommend U232 (or any of the other Nunez Navaro hotels) to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Freebysuperstar
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for just one night to see FC Barcelona with my 6 yr old son. The hotel is a short walk to the metro stop, by short i mean less than a minute !! Staff here (2 ladies on the daytime shift) were absolutely superb and so helpful. The room was nice and there is an excellent toiletries/ grooming kit provided so you need nothing - not even a toothbrush !! The only negative point i can say is that i had a room facing inward so there was little natural light. Beds were soft and comfy - overall a very pleasant stay for less that £65 !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel--loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mitravel206
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel with updated and contemporary decor. Hotel staff helpful. Nice location--very safe and easy to walk to sights around the city. Highly recommend. WiFi connection within our room free and very reliable which is a big plus for any hotel in my opinion!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: phox50
Reviews.Content: We spent two days in Barcelona and wanted a hotel near the hop- hop-off Bus Touristic. The hotel is a short walk from stops for both bus routes and close to the metro, very convenient and very comfortable. It is not in a tourist area and so we got a better price and a nicer room for our money. The hotel helped make our too brief visit a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Groups Should Consider With Care - No Deposit Refund Policy”
Reviews.Author: abwalady
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for both a before and after cruise stay for a group of older adults and paid the sizable 20% non-refundable deposit. I did read the location statement on the company website which states that it is in a quiet residential neighborhood home to some of Gaudí’s most famous works”. After adding a former stroke victim to my group, I decided to do some more research. I did a google street view of the hotel address and found the area did not look residential at all. Further research indicated that to get to Barcelona City Center was more than most older adults in my group could handle. It involved walking 100 meters (more than three football fields) to the subway and a two subway ride (1 transfer). By now I was skeptical about the safety of the walk to the subway and decided to move my large group to a sister-hotel of this company. I knew I was in for complaints from my group about the location of this hotel. Hotel U232 not only would not transfer my deposit to their sister hotel, but when I wrote them and requested a refund, they responded by billing me for 4 euro cents.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent customer service!”
Reviews.Author: TinaBK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were a little hesitant to stay in the U232 since most of the reviews indicated that it's a little far. However, we had a very pleasant stay here and the metro station was 2 minutes walk. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly and they were ready to assist at all time even with restaurant suggestions and places to visit. We initially booked for 4 nights but had to delay out travel from our hone country. Amazingly, they charged us only for 3 nights and provided us with a room with balcony. You can sence the high level of commitment and customer service in every corner. We encourage everyone to stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very modern functional hotel”
Reviews.Author: poligera
Reviews.Content: Had a good time overall. The hotel is a bit far from the centre but metro station is very close by. Modern facilities, nice bed and bathroom. Didn't buy breakfast there as it was quite pricey - had it in town.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek and stylish”
Reviews.Author: cardoza_morgan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at U232 on the first and last night of our visit to Barcelona. In between we stayed in an apartment in La Barceloneta. Both experiences were beyond our expectations. The check-in service at U232 was excellent, the rates were very reasonable, the rooms were comfortable, roomy and quiet, the bathrooms were large and well appointed, the breakfast was the best I've ever had in a hotel (also the most expensive but worth every euro). The hotel has anticipated all the needs of its clients. The front desk staff were very helpful with restaurant references within walking distance. They were particularly helpful to my husband who was trying to get tickets for the Barcelona/Mallorca football game. It turned out to be a great game! We took advantage of the hotel privileges at the nearby olympic size municipal swimming pool. Fabulous! The next time in Barcelona I will spend more time at U232. The nearby metro makes the location perfect for exploring the city.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: PatrickArdeche
Reviews.Content: We slept one night for business. The hotel has a nice trendy moderne atmosphere that is very cosy ( wood, dark colors on the walls). Room very nice with flat screen, great bedding, free internet ( VPN not compatible) Price was 110€ including breakfast ( fresh orange juice) Minibar filled and not too expensive. Location is maybe not the best, but still in a busy area with good restaurants around Would go back - definitively

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable design hotel in a quiet neighbourhood: a perfect choice with excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: LR71
Reviews.Content: The U232 Hotel was the perfect choice for our stay in Barcelona. August is high tourist season in Spain, but it's low business season in the big cities and most of the business hotels offer very low prices, especially on reservations made in advance. That's how we paid a bargain price for such a comfortable and elegant four-star hotel. We chose a "U232 room" that turned out to be very spacious and stylishly designed in predominant black and white square shapes, with a king-size bed and a small balcony facing the interior patio of the block. A comfortable bathroom was separated from the rest of the room by an original wide glass screen shaded by blinds, so that from the bathroom one could peek into the bedroom and vice versa by adjusting the slant of the blinds (which of course could also be shut). The U232 Hotel is located at the south-western end of the Eixample, the district that comprises some of Barcelona's most renowned avenues and squares. Being a quiet residential neighbourhood rather than a tourist area, this part of the Eixample district is a very good compromise between quiet and distance from the centre. A hotel in the Ciutat Vella, the very centre of the city, might apparently be more attractive, but it would also be more expensive and, most of all, probably less quiet, considering how busy and noisy the Barri Gòtic and the Ramblas are at any time of day and night. There is a metro station a few steps from the U232 and you reach the Rambla in just four stops, although with a line change. I don't agree with the reviewers who complain about the presumed inconvenience of the location, when it takes only fifteen or twenty minutes at most to reach the Barri Gòtic. Moreover, not all of Barcelona's attractions are inside the old city: Gaudí's most renowned works, such as the Sagrada Família, the Casa Batlló and La Pedrera, are in the Eixample; the Casa Batlló and La Pedrera, in particular, are reachable from the U232 Hotel in a twenty-minute walk, if you don't feel like taking the metro for just one stop. Overall, the value for money is excellent, but breakfast is not included in the price of the room. It costs some 14 euros per person, quite much compared to the price of the room, for which we paid no more than 68 euros per night. You'd better have your breakfast outside: try the Bracafé at the corner of Carrer del Comte d'Urgell and Carrer de Còrsega. The hotel offers free Internet access, both through wi-fi connection and from two computers available in the hall.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, prestige boutique hotel - go there!”
Reviews.Author: jamesdawes
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights taking into account the Spanish workers strike last month and had a great time there. U232 is a great little boutique hotel with excellent service and the quality of furnishings and detail is extremely good for the price. If you're looking for a more personal service than the larger chains in the city, then this hotel is defintely worth a look. I'd advise to ask in advance to get a room overlooking the comte d'urgell rather than the dark courtyard. Guests ranged from business types to affluent Americans, so peace and quiet is pretty much guaranteed. Location is absolutely fine as its only a 20 min stroll to Las Ramblas - and who'd want to be too close to the equivalent of Leicester Square anyway?! The Eixample district is clearly affluent with many cafes, bars and restaurants nearby so take a good look around. All the staff are very helpful and speak excellent English if your Spanish is a bit ropey. The only thing it lacked was an iPod docking station in the rooms, nothing more. If you want a quality hotel in Barcelona, but don't want to break the bank then book into U232. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “No iron/board available, only expensive ironing service”
Reviews.Author: MelbGirl78
Reviews.Content: I only decided to write this review to point out that if you need to iron your clothes, you can't have an iron or ironing board brought to your room. You need to use their ironing service. Hence my 2 star rating for service. Otherwise, the hotel is very stylish, modern and clean. And the staff speak impressive English and are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: AussieGirl46
Reviews.Content: Good, clean, comfortable hotel away from La Rambla. Only a five minute bus ride into the busy Barcelona city. Close to some really lovely restaurants/ tapas bars etc. Staff were really helpful and friendly. Our room was upgraded so we ended up with a suite which was just what we needed after three weeks travelling by car around Italy and France. Breakfast buffet had a wide selection to suite all the different types of international travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: salsasenora
Reviews.Content: This hotel was included for the last two nights of our Spain tour and we had extended for two additional nights to see more of Barcelona. This is a very nice hotel, with excellent staff and service. We stayed on the second floor so usually just took the stairs. On the landing is a cozy den/library type room with sofas and a table for eight, great for meeting up with friends. Rooms are spacious, modern, and thoughtfully decorated with wood floors and a nice blend of black/beige/white, plus a high-tech molded chair and a desk space. Electrical metal blinds block out noise and light. Bathroom is large with multi-tiered vanity and good shower/tub. Location is the best! Close to metro station that can take you to all Barcelona sights; we even walked to Gaudi's Casa Pedrera and Casa Battlo, then to Las Ramblas, and then to the Picasso Museum, but we took the metro back to the hotel stop. Our room overlooked a large patio for adjoining apartment building and we loved sitting out there (climbing through the window) with a glass of wine before dinner, listening to the heartbeat of the city. There is a nice lobby bar where we celebrated the end of our tour with our traveling companions. The restaurant is nice, but pricey -- when you can just walk a few steps down the street and enjoy a breakfast of delicious croissant or other enticing pastries with cafe con leche at Cafe Dino, or several other reasonably priced and tasty alternatives nearby for any meal. Metro can take you to any restaurant that may be on your list to try.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTraveler
Reviews.Content: The U232 was a great little gem of a hotel! its decor is modern with clean lines. The lobby was very inviting with warm woods. We got to the hotel from the airport using the train and then the metro. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the station. Our room was spacious with a double bed, a daybed, a desk and chair, a flat screen tv, a safe and an armless couch. The bathroom was small but functional. The room was clean and quiet. Our rate did not include breakfast but there was a little place a door or two down from the hotel that sold eat in/take out breakfast and lunch sandwiches. It was packed with local workers and tourists! Very professional and friendly front desk personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sunnyl
Reviews.Content: Very clean room in a small hotel. Great front desk staff always willing to answer questions. Room was small, but adequate. Some rooms are interior rooms with no windows. We had a good rate with breakfast included. Easy transportation nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Best 4 star value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: charlesodonnell
Reviews.Content: I researched many hotels before leaving home to find a nice clean, safe, and reasonable hotel that was realtively close to the cruise terminal. I had no idea where these places were, but after reading many reviews, selected U232 for a two night pre-cruise stay. The hotel was very luxorious, clean, quiet, and in a safe residential area. The staff all spoke english and the hotel was like staying in a high class bouitique hotel. Deserving of its 4 star rating and I would definitely stay there again. The only drawback is that the hotel is about 8-10 blocks walk from the main street ( diagonal ), but taxi's are cheap and easy to grab. It is about ten minutes friom the Cruise terminal.This would be the perfect place for the business or leisure traveler who wants quiet but high style. The hop-on city tour bus stop is also about 8 blocks away. Thank's fellow travelers!

Reviews.Title: “Great family room”
Reviews.Author: PartyofFiveTarrytown
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a room for our family of five, including three pre-teens. The family room was great for us. It is actually 2 rooms - A double room with kingsize bed in front with a little balcony overlooking a school campus, and a triple room in back with only an airshft for light. It worked great for us as we opened the door between the rooms. Each room had a very nice bathroom. The whole hotel is modern and stylish. and it was only 200 eurofor both rooms together. We were originally going to stay on the Ramblas but are glad we didn't since the Ramblas can be quite crowded and hectic. It was nice to walk our in a quiet neighborhood to grab breakfast at one of the pastry shops. Dino Pan was the kids favorite. Breakfast for 5 for less than 10 euro! The Tube is right down the block and it is an excellent, clean and safe system. It is 15 minutes to the Ramblas or anywhere else really. Both the red and blue tourist buses stop a few blocks away on the Diagonal so there is no need to go to the crowded Placa de Catalunya stop to catch it. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great service and closer to centre than you think.”
Reviews.Author: Cipher85
Reviews.Content: Really glad me and my girlfriend found this hotel! We came for a 5day short break. The rates are excellent considering the service, location and hotel itself. All staff were friendly and very helpful, from the front desk to the cleaners. If you need any advice on directions or restaurant recommendations, the front desk will be happy to set-up, organise, make reservations and even order taxi if needed. I don't understand where people get the impression the hotel is not that central. It's a 15-20min walk to catalunya de ramblas and a further 10-15min walk to la ramblas. Being in our mid 20's this walk never bothered either my partner or myself. If you want to be lazy you can get the metro, which is less than a 2min walk with trains coming every 3mins, one stop (diagonal) and changeover to green line then to catalunya placa (all within a max of 10 mins). We never opted for the breakfast so can't comment on the food. There are however many places nearby that do decent breakfasts. There are also many nearby restaurants that do some great food. Personal favourite being 'I Buoni Amici', the front desk staff will also have their recommendations. The room we stayed in was extremely nice. Bed was very comfy, aircon worked a treat and room was very spacious. View from balcony wasn't great, but as mentioned by someone already, not too bothered; the room itself made up for this. The minibar isn't too badly priced, especially considering the room service prices for beer were on par with many of the local restaurants/pubs. Had great nights sleep not hearing a single noise from either of our neighbouring rooms. Bathroom was also very nice, loved the shower. Had a great time in Barcelona and this hotel just helped, great accomodation. Well priced, beautiful foyer decor which runs throughout full hotel. Normally I'm very critical but had no real flaws on our visit here. Andrew & Joanne

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous and faultless stay at U232”
Reviews.Author: FaysterS
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the U232 was just fabulous. We chose to book it thanks to the great reviews on Tripadvisor and we weren't disappointed. I don't understand why some people are complaining about the location. If you want noise and mayhem throughout the night then stay on Las Ramblas - been there, done that, and it was a nightmare! The U232 was close enough to everything and we thought the location was great. It was a 25 minute walk to Placa Catalunya which we did a couple of times, however, it you don't want to walk the Metro stop Hospital Clinic is 1.5 blocks from the hotel. This gets you into the centre in 3 stops (via 2 different Metro lines - changing at Diagonal). We also got the train from the airport, getting off at Sants Estacio onto the blue Metro line and then it's only two Metro stops to the hotel - very easy and way cheaper than a taxi ride! We did only have hand luggage though so weren't dragging heavy suitcases around with us. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel as it wasn't included when we booked. There are loads of cafes nearby though serving all the usual for really good prices. There are also lots of little supermarkets near to the hotel if you need drinks/snacks. The rooms were lovely and modern with a gorgeous bathroom and a fab shower. Flat screen tvs too which was nice. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Also discovered the free internet in the lounge on the last day! We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: trang2010
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at U232 hotel for 3 nights coming back from our San Sebastian trip. The hotel offered very decent rate for the weekend. That was why we picked it. The hotel is very modern and ultra clean. When we checked in, we had a large room but the air conditioning machine did not seem to work well. We immediately got switched to a smaller room but with working air conditioning. Sebastian from the front desk was extremely friendly and helpful. He did all the necessary steps very quickly to switch our room and also gave us excellent recommendation to a local restaurant, in the neighborhood, where the food was super good. Since we had breakfast included in our room, the breakfast was alright. In the overall the hotel itself is very nice. There are more TV channels with movies than another hotel where we stayed. The only downside of the hotel is its location that is a little far away from the city center where most tourist activities take place (Plaza Catalunya & La Rambla). There is no direct metro line from the city center to the hotel. There are 2 bus lines which are pretty convenient. However their Sunday schedules are not too frequent. We had to take a taxi, instead, to catch our tour bus which departed from Plaza Catalunya. Luckily there is a line of taxis just a block away from the hotel, in front of a hospital. If it is your first time to Barcelona, the location may not be too convenient. Otherwise if you know your away around, need a weekend stay and do not want to pay a lot, then U232 is a very good choice. The afternoon, evening and graveyard shifts' personels are very friendly and helpful. However the day shift's personels are grouchy. The hotel has 2 computers for guests to use. Restaurant Tip : A restaurant, 3 blocks from the hotel, has excellent tapas. Its grilled sea food dishes are excellent. Our favorite was grilled razor clams. Ask the front desk for direction and name

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable but nothing great”
Reviews.Author: PickyPea
Reviews.Content: The U232 was modern, clean, and comfortable, although the rooms were small by American standards. The free Wi-Fi was spotty, and the shower temperature was tempermental. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. Look for special rates that include the breakfast! It's close to the Metro, but nothing else! If you want to go to Placa Catalunya, it is quite a trip. Recommend taking the (cheap!) taxis if you are in a group. We didn't find many places to eat, shop, or sightsee within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - followed advice from trip adviser and was not disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: mrsredmoid
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after looking at trip adviser and expedia - and it had such fab reviews that i (nervously) booked up as a surprise for my husbands 40th birthday. The other comments said that the hotel was not in the centre of Barcelona - and it isnt - but Barcelona is easy to get around either by walking or metro or buses. We caught the loop bus from the airport and this goes close enough to the hotel that you can walk the rest of the way. We could easily walk to Las Ramblas and in the other direction you can get to the modernista buildings and head off towards the sagrada familia. I avoid all forms of public transport normally - but the metro in Barcelona is quick clean and easy to use - it seems to cost about 2 euros - irrespective of how short or long the journey. The hotel were very friendly and gave great recommendations for a local tapas bar and a great seafood restaurant on the beach - which they even rang and booked for us. The hotel was nicely decorated and the rooms contained all you need, not massive rooms, but big enough and reasonable sized bathroom. The shower ran off the taps which wasnt great especially when you run the tap at the sink when someone is showering - but as i prefer baths - i didnt care anyway! I would definitely recommend Barcelona as a place to go - we spent 4 days there - but could easily go back for much longer. I would also highly recommend this hotel. One thing i would say if you are planning a trip to Barcelona - is that lots of shops and restaurants/bars are closed for the majority of August (this seems to be a Europe wide thing). It doesn't apply to the tourist attractions - so didnt affect our visit - however most of the recommendations, from our lonely planet guide, were rendered useless as they were closed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, modern, friendly, convenient”
Reviews.Author: kansasforever
Reviews.Content: What a delightful surprise! Although there is no gym or pool in this 4* hotel, we were able to use the nearby facilities (which are fantastic) for only 4 Euros. We found the staff to be extremely friendly and helpful and loved this hotel's trendy, albeit dark, interior design. Would stay again anytime in Barcelona... Great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: lucyq
Reviews.Content: Do not hesitate. This is a great hotel. Very nice, helpful staff, perfect location, and good value. The rooms are beautiful and the breakfast copious.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel steps away from the subway...”
Reviews.Author: ariel311
Reviews.Content: U232 is really near the subway... It is a great boutique hotel, clean and the staff are all very friendly... When asked for directions, the staff are very helpful.. Only slight issue is that they do not auto-replenish the shampoo & bath gel daily and we had to ask for new ones when they run out... But besides that, everything is great...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: RamboNWAlberta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 days with two other couples before taking cruise. Was very pleased with this hotel, it was better than expected for the price. Each of our rooms were different, all totally adequate, very clean and modern. Excellent air conditioning system and none of us heard a noise at night.Our room had two bathrooms which was completely unexpected, one with tub, 2nd with shower. Both completely done in tile and dark marble, really modern and chic. The front desk staff were all excellent and very helpful regarding sites, restaurants and general enquiries. Our room included breakfast buffet, we all enjoyed it daily, lots of selection and good quality of foods. Don't know if it would be worth the 14 euro if it wasn't included but it is definately a good addition when included. The front desk staff put us on to one nearby restaurant that we tried. It was called Maitea and is just two blocks away on Casanova Street, an easy 5 minute walk. We took the recomendation and tried the place about 9:00 PM one night. What a great place!!!! We all had a great time in the atmosphere. The owner, Nickolas was a great guy and very helpful. He spoke great English and we had a great meal with wines there. They specialize in Montaditos. These are small pices of breads with different toppings, some hot, some cold. All are unique and many were truly amazing.They keep coming with different plates and recipes of these and one can sample whatever you like. Very reasonably priced and a great local atmosphere may it a highlite for us as an eatery. The hotel staff have cards with directions if you're interested, ENJOY....... We all would definately return to this hotel and will recommend it to our friends who plan to travel to this great city..............

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with great value”
Reviews.Author: JackRyan46
Reviews.Content: Well located next to a metro station (Hospital Clinic). About 8 € to get back from downtown with a cab. The room was clean and well set up. Enough room for luggage and a useful desk. Nice bathroom too. Very powerful air conditioning capable of cooling the place very quickly! The hotel doesn't have its own parking. However, the hotel has an agreement with the public parking next door. Show your ticket to the reception to get a discount. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Irani
Reviews.Content: you have a separate room for your loggage and clothes. good location for shopping.dont waste time for shoping in the city center. close to the hotel there is a big shopping mall and so you can find many other shop in same street. car parking is not free and there is not any elevator from parking to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “be aware of bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: aurora030
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 6 night at the beginning of august, one day i did find a bed bug crawling in between the 2 single beds... i didnt know what it was at the time, when i came back home i woke up with at least 100 bites all over my body... i went to the hopsital and the doctor told me that i have been beaten by bed bugs.... i had to stay at the hospital for some injection... and i am totally traumatised..... so obviously i will never go back to this hotel. I have just called the hotel and they just told me "thanks for acalling" thats it.... i am sorry but this is not enough..... i am very upset and disapointed....

Reviews.Title: “Pricey, but good location and nice property”
Reviews.Author: Mrfamilyvacation
Reviews.Content: Location of U232 is a short walk (1 1/2 blocks) to Metro. Use Metro to travel in and around Barcelona. It is inexpensive, goes everywhere you need and easy to learn. Hotel is very nice, safe and clean even though pricey compared to other properties we used. Food is plentiful and located within short walk of hotel - even a couple of nice grocery stores to get snacks and waters for picky teens . We never ate in the hotel and used Rick Steve's book on Spain for suggestions of places to visit and to eat. Lots of tapas bars with wide selections, Pans & Co is excellent for quick sandwiches and ice cream. Staff is friendly and speak English well. No smoking policy is a must for my family and a wonderful break from the smokey places around town. Good wifi in lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: moneypenny78
Reviews.Content: The location was further away from the sights, but a quick walk to the metro station. It was in a safe neighbourhood with a grocery store nearby and a few restaurants. The room was gorgeous; slick furnishings and very spacious with a huge balcony. The staff was courteous and helpful. The free wifi signal was a little weird, it only worked in our bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: 2_Hip
Reviews.Content: This hotel may be a little out of the way but it is still close to everything. Our room was amazing, especially for the price. It had a wonderful bar which was appreciated after a hot and busy day sightseeing. Would definitely recommend thi shotle.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel0city
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, nice design, friendly service and ok location. We stayed four nights and had absolutely no complaints. We skipped breakfast because there were many bars down the street offering (simple) breakfast at much lower rates. The hotel is located near a subway station from which it's quite easy to travel to the city centre and other parts of town. The rates were very reasonable compared to what the hotel has to offer (via Expedia).

Reviews.Title: “Totally Recommend -- Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karalyn84
Reviews.Content: When traveling to Barcelona, we were expecting a pint sized hotel room because thats what you typically experience throughout Europe. When we arrived at U232 we are pleasantly surprised and the size, decor and cleanliness of the room. Had a large King Bed, large bathroom with all the amenities, Ikea-esque decor, flat panel television and tons of storage for baggage. To top it off they have a free business center with computers and printers. The staff was also extremely helpful, they spoke english (which is pretty hard to find in Barcelona) so they made numerous phone calls for us (ordered us pizza, called the post office for shipping, etc). It was close enough to the shopping line and Las Ramblas to walk and had a great little cafe kitty-corner from it for coffee or pastries. We loved this place and would definitely stay again if we went back to Barcelona!!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant”
Reviews.Author: aslant
Reviews.Content: u232 is an elegant hotel that, at the time i booked it, offered an extraordinary deal for a boutique hotel of it's caliber. check in staff a delight, i was gladly offered a tourist map and overview of barcelona's highlights, room was comfortable and oh so stylish. location is not thrilling but easily central enough.i had a courtyard facing room and it was dead silent, in fact the entire hotel was a bit creepy quiet while i was there but i enjoyed the quiet. my only issue is that the marble floor in the bathroom was quite coated with mineral reside, and you could see some little footprints in it. i was unfazed, but i have a feeling this occurs in most rooms due to barcelona's gross water and the nature of black marble, so it may not be the hotel for you if you are squeamish about feet and bathrooms. otherwise, i would not hesitate to recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Lives Up to Its Ranking”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel U232 for three nights in July. I had been a little concerned about the hotel being located away from many of the tourist sites but the hotel’s close proximity to the Hospital Clinic Metro stop really makes it a non-issue. We checked in very late in the evening as our train from Pamplona did not arrive until close to 10pm. The gentleman at reception gave us a few restaurant recommendations for restos close to the hotel (there are many). The one thing I appreciated the most from check-in was being told how to get in contact with the front desk (dial 55). At both of our hotels in Madrid and Pamplona, no instructions were given for dialing the front desk and it was difficult trying to figure it out. The room décor was everything it appeared to be online. The bathroom had a little wear and tear but there was ample room for toiletries around the sink. Unfortunately, we were not able to access the free wifi from our room (#405). There is a business center downstairs with two computers and one printer, which would come in handy if you wanted to print out your boarding passes. I would not hesitate to recommend Hotel U232 to friends and I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a perfect place to stay during my Barcelona leisure trip!”
Reviews.Author: shedras
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel U232 for one week during the month of July 2010. It was a perfect. Admittedly, I was skeptical and expected a small hotel room that felt much like a closet. Instead, the room was spacious and delightfully comfortable. I booked a single room with a king bed, along with breakfast using a discounted rate on Trip Advisor. the breakfast was fine - much more that one can get at a pastry shop or cafe. If you're fine with pastry and coffee each day, then you might save money by forgoing the hotel breakfast. However, if you seek meat, eggs, yogurt, cereal, etc., then the hotel breakfast is worth the additional expense. Finally, the hotel sits outside of the tourist area. That was fine with me. I wanted a quiet space to retire after long walks in touristy areas like Las Ramblas, the beaches, and museums. It's close to the metro and along the red/blue lines of the official Barcelona tour bus. I didn't feel far away. There are lots of little shops in the area for clothing and food, and local cafes. One more thing - the staff was awesome! They were smiling and kind, spoke several languages, and offered great advice about how to best navigate the city. When I visit Barcelona again, I will happily stay at this, or another Nunez hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: MikeP54
Reviews.Content: The U232 is a lovely, clean and convenient hotel. My wife and I would certainly stay there again. The staff was friendly and helpful. Georgina was especially awesome. She always greeted us with a smile and her English was fantastic. The location was adequate. The hotel lies 1.5 blocks friom the metro. My wife and I thought we would walk every where and would have little need of the metro. we were wrong. Still walked a ton but the metro is an absolute necessity. it is cean, fast and on time. The T-10 card is a must. The room was smallish but it served our needs as we really only slept there. The bathroom/shower was fine. Really no complaints at all. Cafe el fornet is just across the street. We ate breakfast there every day, usually <10 euros. We did not eat or drink anything at the hotel so can't comment on that. there are several small grocery stores and a large Dept store well within walking distance. the dept store (on Av Diagonal) has a large grocery store. Tip: Had wallet stolen while getting on the metro at 3 PM returning from Parc Guell (Lesseps). Three A-holes surrounded me as I was getting on the metro (one in front blocking my way, one on my side and one behind). It happened very quickly (seconds). I recognized what happened immediately(as this scenario was described elsewhere) but they timed it perfectly an jumped off the metro just as the door were closing. I had my wallet in a bottoned pocket (cargo shorts) but that did not help. USE A HIDDEN MONEY BELT AND TAKE ONLY THE CASH THAT YOU NEED. Be careful, this happened at 3 in the afternoon not at night. otherwise, we felt safe and never had a problem. Have fun. Would go back to Barcelona and U232 in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, the best hotel in our whole trip!”
Reviews.Author: karla014
Reviews.Content: Since the moment we arrived, we felt welome. Georgina at the front desk was friendly and kind. The hotel itself feels more like a house than a hotel, the rooms are very good size, very confortable beds, bathrooms are very nice, good shower. It's not in the middle of the turisty part, but you have a subway stop right in fron,t and by the way, the subway system in Barcelona must be by far the most modern and clean of all, so its really a pleasure to use it. About the location, its in a nice neighborhood, very safe, with restaurants, cafes and a small supermarket just around the corner. So you almost have it all! There is a "den" with computers with free internet (wich is not very common to find). We didn't have breakfast there, but the people at the front desk reccomended us a very good restaurant near from the hotel named: " Tobador" and we "discovered" an EXCELENT indian restaurant named: "Sindur" that is on Corsega 211. If you like indian food you should go.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: martibachmann
Reviews.Content: U232 offered better service than most 5* hotels we stayed. Everything was just right for us. - Friendly, always helpful staff that speaks English - Very accommodating when we switched rooms because of the street noise. (Barcelona - - was very noisy because of the soccer world cup celebrations.) - Breakfast was very nice, with something for everybody - The entrance and the rooms are beautifully decorated and very clean - Free PCs with fast and reliable internet connection, which we didn't have in any other hotel in Spain. - Parking is available right next door I don’t think that Barcelona has another hotel that offers that much value for its price. We payed 90 Euro with a great breakfast and welcoming drinks. The location didn’t seem that great in the beginning, but we realized that by taking the bus instead of the subway (2 bus lines are just 2 minutes away and those buses covered all our needs) it was easy and cheap to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel, my Barcelona favourite!”
Reviews.Author: Merimaria
Reviews.Content: U232 is located on a busy street, oppisite a technical school about 2km from Plaza de Catalunya. From the airport the hotel is easy to reach by metro; take a metro train from the airport to Sants Estació, change there to the blue line, L5 towards Horta and get off at the station Hospital Clinic, from there it´s just 1,5 blocks walk to the hotel. One way metro ticket from the airport was in June, 2010 3 euros, so it´s worth to buy 10-trips-ticket (7,20e) if you attend to use metro more than couple of times. At the hotel I just loved our room! Though we had the most cheapest room in first floor with no proper view, the room was absolutely beautiful, like the whole hotel! U232 is really nicely decorated and carefully detailed, a real boutique hotel indeed! In our room we had very comfortable king size bed, huge flat screen tv, mini bar of course, safe deposit box, lots of storage space for cloths and stuff, balcony and very efficient air conditioning. I think it was the nicest room I´ve ever been with that amount of money we paid for our stay. Definitely great value for the money! I think I read from some reviews about the "smell" in the hotel. They must put some scent into the air conditioning, cause there was this certain smell all over the hotel and in the guest rooms. It didn´t bother me at all, I think it was a nice smell and I liked it, but maybe some guests with really sensitive nose or allergy might react on that differently. The staff at the reception was ok. They were normally friendly to us, nothing special, but they still seemed quite stressed out. They helped us properly with our problems with the key cards (pay attention where to keep your card, cause these ones are extremely sensitive to magnets, for example in wallets or handbags) and questions about the city, but I kind of felt like I am bothering them with my questions, which is of course wrong cause they are there for the guests and their questions! Though I have to give my thanks to them for letting us keep our room 2 hours longer on the check-out day, even they were fully booked! Something about the neighbourhood; there´s supermarker Dia% just round the corner on Carrer de Paris and couple of fast food restaurants in the nearest blocks (for example Pans in the corners of Comte d´Urgell and Paris), a post box you can find also from the corner of Comte d´Urgell and Paris. There are some restaurants and cafés also but head to Barri Gotic for example for the evenings, this area is pretty quiet. If you arrive by car, there´s parking hall in the same block and entrance just next to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but....”
Reviews.Author: Lily07
Reviews.Content: I agree with those who posted overall positive reviews for this hotel. But we chose the top floor room (901), which has lots of space and a terrace as large as the room. The down side to the terrace (and the hotel) is that it's on a busy street, and even on the 9th floor, we still could hear the street noise. It wasn't a problem for sleeping, because the closed windows kept out most of the sound, but it didn't make using the terrace appealing. However, our bed was large and comfortable. The marble bathroom a delight. And the decor a pleasure to look at. But I had trouble modulating the air conditioning. The blower was right over the bed, so it was either freezing and cold air was hitting my face all night. If I just used the fan and no ac, then it got too warm. Consequently, sleeping was difficult. Also, the 14E breakfast is definitely overcharged. The cereal selection is museli and corn flakes. Limited cut up fresh fruit available. They offer mainly canned peaches, etc. But it was more convenient eating there than trying to find a cafe that wasn't filled with cigarette smoke. That's another big plus for this hotel: non-smoking throughout. So a mixed review. Would I stay there again? No because of the ac and problems sleeping, but I think it's a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent opportunity to see real Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: spiritinthesky
Reviews.Content: Thanks to this hotel and it's location we were able to spend time away from the crowded tourist traps and experience real Barcelona: warm and cosy restaurants, locals watching football at their neighbourhood bars etc. However, the hotel is not actually that far away from the sights, Barcelona's excellent and cheap metro system will take you anywhere in the city and the Hospital Clinic station is located only 5 minutes walk from the hotel. The hotel is decorated with unique, modern style inside out the hotel. The reception staff was friendly and we got some excellent restaurant tips as well as instructions how to reach different sites. The free wireless network is available everywhere in the hotel, but the idle time is set very short and you may need to reconnect quite often. Perhaps the only minus for this hotel experience was the breakfast. Even though the basic selection was adequote, the quality of food was not consistent. Warm dishes at the buffet were not warm enough and the local tomato sauce for bread should be available all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique - yes!”
Reviews.Author: TommyG79
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel - very clean. Well located - easy to get on the subway system. Might not be the roomiest, but it is well laid out inside the room. Uses the "green" system where you remove your key when you leave and the lights, TV & air are turned off automatically. Had 3 English language channels on the cable in the room including a movie channel. The Business Center was really nice with 2 computers that was open for use 24 hrs/day.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Style”
Reviews.Author: LabradorPenny
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique style hotel in Barcelona , close to the Metro which gets you downtown in 10 to 15 minutes. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly. The rooms are beautifully decorated in a modern chic style , including flat screen T.V , MiniBar and Air Conditioning. Our teenagers had a twin room which had 2 beds and a seperate sofa and still ample room for luggage , they also found the free wifi a bonus. Our own room had a huge king size bed and a luxurious bathroom which included one of the best showers we have ever seen.The bar area is also in a chic style , with good service , the only downside to our stay was probably the inflated price of the drinks in the bar, which probably accounted for the lack of people using it which resulted in a lack of atmosphere ; the management would be well advised to drop drink prices and encourage more customers and create a Buzz !

Reviews.Title: “Charming although the lobby was suffocating”
Reviews.Author: Werckmeister
Reviews.Content: Before I proceed, I must mention the horrible, suffocating perfume that's used in the lobby. Every time I enter the hotel I'm assaulted by this overwhelming scent. Luckily the rooms didn't suffer from the same odor problem because otherwise I would have changed hotels ASAP. Otherwise, everything was fine. The rooms were well-appointed, but the highlight was the wonderful view and the balcony, which was perfect for my smoking friend. Everything was well-decorated, and I liked the way the bathroom was designed, even if it's not the biggest around. But the beds were not the most comfortable around, and both myself and my friend had neck cramps after the 2nd night. Location-wise it's not too bad - pretty near the subway but a slight bit out of the ways from the bustle. Staff were fine although not outstanding. Overall a decent stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayoflightcanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, this hotel is one of the best, very modern, staff are helpful and polite all speak English, Emanuel at reception is very helpful. Hotel is nicely decorated, breakfast was okay nothing special and they don’t change the menu , I had to extend my stay for 1 more night, only thing bothered me is ate breakfast they keep asking your room# every single morning. Had to extend my stay for 1 more night, the last day at breakfast they wanted to charge me for the meal but I thought I paid for it part of my stay, then at checkout they void the charge 12 Euros The other good thing is free internet, the only thing is the hotel is far away from all the attractions, you need 50 minutes walk to Plaza Espanya and 40 minutes walk to Plaza De Catalunya, I only used the subway once going to Sagrada Familia, Barcelona subway is very easy to navigate. There is a good restaurant close to the hotel and a cupcake store and there is a nice bakery shop...they made some special orange skin shaving coated with dark chocolate, the bakery called Pastisseria Lerma

Reviews.Title: “Small but lovely!”
Reviews.Author: synaptoneurosome
Reviews.Content: U232 doesn't look like much from the outside, but the unassuming exterior belies an absolutely polished, well-kept interior. We had a room with a small balcony onto the main street (Comte Urgell), but the glass door was remarkably soundproof. That combined with the blackout curtains made for very restful sleep. The room was very, very small, but tastefully appointed and didn't actually feel very cramped. The only thing that was a little strange was the shower. All black marble, which is very nice, but there's no light inside the shower, and there is this funny little window that opens into nothingness (an alternate universe? the twilight zone? some kind of ventilation shaft?). It would be nice if there was a bit more light in the shower, but other than that, a very nice (but tiny) bathroom. This hotel could be improved by offering a free breakfast. We decided to not pay the ~14 euro each day for the breakfast buffet, which looked decent, but not remarkable. Other hotels of this standard that we've stayed out throughout europe offer rooms for a similar price, but include breakfast. This seems like an easy thing U232 could do to improve its attractiveness to all travelers. Finally, it's in a great neighbourhood- slightly out of the main downtown bustle, but with LOTS of amazing restaurant options nearby (though look those up in a guidebook - the ones the front desk suggested were rather underwhelming - the ones suggested in the Time Out guide were especially great).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: bnb-toronto
Reviews.Content: The only draw back about this hotel is the location. You cant really walk anywhere good (La Ramblas etc) however, there are many cabs available on Urgell and it only costs 5 Euro to cab to La Ramblas. Frankly, even including the extra cab fare, the hotel is still a great deal. Overall this hotel is very clean, comfortable modern and offers great value. Cost: about 130 euros per night, for the room, plus about 10 euros for cab fare to town and back, For a nice 4 star hotel like this, I think this is a real bargain. Rooms: Very clean, modern and nice. The rooms are somewhat small but they are space efficient. The beds are new, comfortable and very clean. The showers were also very good. Hot and great water pressure. The windows open to allow in fresh air and curtains could keep out the sun to ensure a dark peaceful night's sleep. I would recommend rooms at the front of the hotel as the view from the back is of some run down apartment buildings. Restaurant: Only serves breakfast but it is quite good. It is a cold buffet with meats, cheeses, sausage, hardboiled eggs, pastries, juice, coffee, cereal, yogurt etc etc. Breakfast costs about 13 euros and is a good deal for what you get. I was very pleased with it. There is no lunch or dinner. They do accommodate room service but it is limited. I did not try room service. Location: Is somewhat poor but not too far away from the centre of town. There are some very good restaurants nearby and ample cabs. We never waited more than 3 minutes for a cab to show up. Hospitality: was very good. I read some reviews criticizing the staff. Whoever wrote this must be a curmudgeon. The staff were consistently friendly and helpful. We had reservations made, wake up calls arranged, restaurant recommendations, translations to taxi cabs etc etc all for the asking by U232's friendly staff. Everyone greeted my wife and I with a smile. They even offered to keep our bags for a few days while we flew to another country and back. If you are an angry, egotistical, demanding grouch, perhaps you might elicit another reaction, but I found the staff to be happy eager and helpful. The only reason this hotel is affordable is the moderate location. The view is not great and it is not near the Ramblas. However the amenities and staff are all top rate. Every dollar you spend here is on a great hotel, not a great location. Hence the great value. If this hotel were in the Ramblas it would cost $500 per night. I loved this hotel and would stay there again. Thank you U232 for a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is a cracker!”
Reviews.Author: Imadilly
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this hotel enough - admittedly our room was on the tenth floor on the Urgell side - what a lovely spacious room and balcony we had. The staff where fantastic and gave us a lot of advice on where to go and how to get there. It is one block from the best transport system we have every used.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dude1962
Reviews.Content: Hotel. We stayed in a "Top Room" which is large room with a great terrace balcony. The decor is very modern and of a "boutique hotel" quality. Yes, i would recomend the hotel to others and also say that it being away from the city centre is of benefit as you are not subject to the noise of people or the nightlife. Location. The city centre is however very easy to get to as its only a few metro stops away (15 minutes travelling time). Travel on the Metro is very very easy and inexpensive. One of the better metro systems that i've used. It's location is also shown on the hotels own website along with a map and location, and even a GPS and Trip Planner. Food. The hotels breakfast is good but many consider it expensive. The price i think is average for a city hotel. There are plenty of local cafe's that serve croissants and coffee that are much cheaper, which is what we did apart from the first morning. Staff. Very helpful and friendly. They are knowledgeable, polite and will do their best to help.

Reviews.Title: “A mistake!”
Reviews.Author: chonga7780
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and at first were quite thrilled that we found a gem in Barcelona, but it didn't take long for us to realise it was a mistake. Location Do not believe some of the other reviews that rave on about how great the location is - it's a disappointment. If you're looking for a meai, you'll need to walk about 20ish minutes to an area with few restaurants. The walk isn't so pleasant when there's nothing along the way to look at, and the streets leading into that area are quiet & dark. Furthermore, we were told by staff that that area was in fact the city centre of Barcelona, it was far from it - we didn't see / experience any excitement or buzz, or bump into many other tourists. We found out the next day that the life of the city was actually several subway stations away from the hotel. So if it's location you're after, then you may want to avoid this place. Staff Bases on the above comments, we were obviously disappointed with the staffs' inability to accurately tell us where the city centre was. Additionally wrong directions to this supposed city centre. Also, the staff (specifically the evening shift ones) weren't as friendly as we had hoped - lacked patience in assisting with basic tourist questions. Each time we approached them, we felt we were bothering & inconveniencing them because we wanted their guidance & advice on attraction sites. When we asked them the name of a castle that sits on a high hilltop we saw on the way back to the hotel, the staff rudely & abruptly told us it was impossible for him to tell us as there were millions of castle in Barcelona. We accept that that question may have been somewhat vague & silly , but there was no need for a response in that tone & manner. We are definitely not 5-star travellers, but if we go back to Barcelona again, we'd rather pay more money for location & decent service.

Reviews.Title: “over priced and dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: mouseface
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel in Barcelona, based on the Tripadvisor reviews we thought it would be fantastic and i have to admit we were very dissappointed. The staff we found were quite cold and non welcoming. In terms of the hotel, yes it is a business hotel and therefore lacked in terms of facilities if your trip is for leisure, there is no area to relax in the sun or terrace area, even the balconies didn't have chairs. Beware also breakfast is €27 for two people and a whiskey and coke at the bar €12, so this hotel is very over priced. Down the street we found a little cafe where a beer was €1.90 to put things in context. Oh and the bar shuts at 11pm - even for residents The hotel is a good 25 minute walk into Las Ramblas although the metro is fantastic if you don't mind getting two trains, however if you want to be in the centre of things, this hotel is far. On the positive side the beds were very comfortable and the hotel is quiet. wish we had more good things to say as we usually book on the advice from tripadvisor, but not this time

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel in a Nice Part of Town”
Reviews.Author: usctim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the U232 Hotel for 4 nights in May 2010. Staff was very friendly and answered many questions and offered advice. Hotel and room were both very classy and comfortable. Great shower! Great location away from the touristy La Rambla but a short walk to the Modernisme stuff in Gracia and 2 blocks from the Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel and well placed but avoid interior rooms”
Reviews.Author: christodoulos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and well placed in the center of the city but the triple rooms have no view, are very cleistofobic and the price is very high for such a case.When we booked the room (by web bookiing) there was no indication that triple rooms are only interior ones.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, but not a great location...”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTraveler09
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful NN hotel which provides great value for the price. We were able to stay in one of the rooms on the top floor which was amazing. There is a large king size bed with a HUGE washroom complete with a jetted tub and two rain showers. The room also has a large patio with a table for dining and lounging. The only downside to this hotel is the location. Although it is still quite central, it is a little bit out of the way. This is easily overlooked though if you can get one of those top rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, good hotel in good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: nhentschel
Reviews.Content: We reserved two rooms because we were traveling with our college aged children. The wifi connection was great so our kids were fully entertained. We reserved one of the hotel's "top" rooms which had a shower which didn't work properly. The hotel could not get it fixed over the Easter weekend and moved us to a beautiful room with a good view and plenty of room. The staff was helpful, and the hotel has an attractive bar area for grabbing a drink before or after dinner. Very good restaurants in the area, including 2 by a restaurant owner with a last name of "Olive." The staff will be able to direct you. It was so crowded in city center that being a metro ride away was a pleasure. Would return to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quieter than home, clean”
Reviews.Author: azogal
Reviews.Content: We got off to a great start when we arrived at 9 am from our trans-Atlantic flight and our room was ready so we could nap. The rooms are modern with lots of modern lighting, heating/cooling, and plumbing. The bed was nice and firm and the shower was great with a rainwater head and a hand-held. Our room, room 906, was on the back courtyard and was as quiet as a tomb. Even though the bathroom was dark marble, it had lots of lighting. The rooms included hair dryer, mini bar, safe, and free wifi which was fast and easy to connect to. There are also 2 computers with a printer off the lobby to print boarding passes (free). The only negatives are the towels are a bit rough and it would have been nice to have tea/coffee maker in the room. Location is a bit far though a hotel on La Rambla would be like staying in Times Square. The area around the hotel includes many small restaurants, sandwich shops, bakeries, where the service was much friendlier and the food better than near tourist places. There are also several ATMs near the hotel, a post box at the end of the block, and a market around the corner. As others have mentioned, it was only 3 blocks to the Bus Turistic stops for the Blue and Red routes. We got a 2-day pass which was very useful. Our best meal was in Gracia at L'Arrosseria Xativa where we were the only tourists. Word of warning: guard your things carefully on the Metro. As we were getting on the Metro at the bottom of La Rambla to return to the hotel, a group of 3 or 4 surrounded us and grabbed the bar so we couldn't move. Fortunately, we were holding onto our things and they didn't get anything. Apparently, this is a big problem in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “SMART UPDATED CHIQUE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jambo007
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellent ,near subway..easy to get around,good breakfast,room good size and comfortable...shower fantastic!! drinks expensive...but its Barcelona !!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff, great city”
Reviews.Author: Supersue_9
Reviews.Content: This is a very clean and modern hotel. It is as the majority of people have said and we were not disappointed with it at all. The location of the hotel suited us just fine as we wanted to be just outside of the main area. To walk to La Rambla only takes about 1/2 hour and you see a few Gaudi buildings on the way.We booked it after having read all the good reviews and felt that we could not go too far wrong and we didn't. The room was quite adequate for what we wanted but our room was on the main road so it could be noisy at times but after having had such a busy day didn't notice it once we had collapsed into bed! The reception staff were most helpful and we went on the open top bus ride which, if you buy at reception, you get a discount. We did not use any of the facilities that the hotel had to offer as it was just a base for us. We went across the road and on the corner was a El Fornet where we could choose from a vast aray of pastries and savouries. I would not recommend having breakfast in the hotel as it is very expensive and there are many eateries nearby. Travel from the airport to the hotel is very easy using the metro and also a T10 card is extremely good value on the metro with very frequent trains. If time allows, the best place to visit, in our opinion, for views of Barcelona and the surrounding area is Tibidabo. It is great fun getting there as you have to use the tram and funicular railway to get there. Take the lift, costing 2 euros, right to the very top of the church. Not too many people visit there so it is fairly quiet and it is a little gem of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Friendly, helpful staff in a Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Gingerwizard5
Reviews.Content: We grabbed a three day break in Barcelona just before Easter. The hotel was a pleasant surprise - very helpful staff and the rooms were clean and comfortable- would def stay here again. Dont be put off by the distance out of the centre - thats a plus - either grab a cab(Euros8~10 to the center), or take the Metro for aro Euro1.40 for a single trip (its a short walk of about 200m). Good Friday was really busy at all the attractions (as all the shops were closed) good idea to take the tour bus to get your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “Delicate and nice interior”
Reviews.Author: KristineOslo
Reviews.Content: Drawbacks: - The location is a bit far fetched; for example, It takes approximately 30-45 minutes to walk from the hotel to Plaza de Catalonia - The noise from the street Urgell. The first night we had a twin room at the second floor with windows out against the noisy street Urgell. However, we were able to change to a quiet double room the following four nights. - Our room was a bit small, however the bathroom was okay Advantages: - Nice interior - Friendly staff - A lot of accessories in the bathroom - Free Internet

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, very cosy. Convenient.”
Reviews.Author: nleow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a recent holiday. The hotel staff were helpful and efficient. The hotel lobby is warm and cosy. Our room had a balcony and was of a good size. The decor was of good quality and the room and bathroom were very clean. The location of the hotel is approximately 30 minutes walk to La Rambla, however, there is a metro stop only 2 minutes away. There are numerous shops and businesses in the area. The area is quiet at night, so you will need to travel to more lively areas to find a nice bar or restaurant. Free wifi is available also. Overall, a great stay and excellent value. I would stay again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLindy333
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice, friendly and efficient. The rooms were nicely furnished and clean. If you stay in one of the street side rooms, though, it can be noisy. Their lobby and bar are very well furnished and have comfortable places to sit. The only minus that we had was that we were told that the breakfast came with our room charge. When we got there, they made us pay for breakfast and we did not have a copy of the e-mail. They had a very good breakfast, mostly cold foods like cereals, cold cuts, fresh fruit, with a hot typical English breakfast. They have a luggage storage room which we used. We were four middle aged women.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, not as good as Europark”
Reviews.Author: TooDutch
Reviews.Content: We wanted to stay in two different hotels during our stay in Barcelona. However we didnt realize we booked two hotels of the same chain. The hotels are very similair in looks and service. The hotel is nice, clean, lovely music in the lobby. The staff doesnt speak english very well but after a couple of minutes you should be able to have a roomservice order placed. The minibar is a little overpriced compared to Europark, where you paid less for more. The TV has only spanish or french channels, so watching TV is a little difficult. However, we had a great stay here, and Id recommend it to you, but Europark hotel was cheaper and in fact definitely nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel But Beware Family Rooms”
Reviews.Author: DCMIT1
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 nights at the U232 and agree with the majority of views but got caught out when when we booked a family room for myself, my wife and our daughter. Basically, the room we were in (809) had an ajoining door to another room to accommodate a larger family via 2 connected rooms; problem was that the teenage kids next door weren't ours and where there are normally two doors connecting rooms there was only one and it was paper-thin. We were therefore woken each night and morning to the kid next door coughing himself silly. We raised with reception who offered a change in room however we didn't want the hassle of packing and unpacking again. Nice hotel but I find it really weird that there is not more sound-proofing between rooms - fortunately, we only had to put up with coughing kids but it coud have been far more embarassing! Ensure you avoid family rooms with a connecting door unless you intend to use both rooms as privacy will be a real issue.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet & Restful Gem Of A Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sumfel3
Reviews.Content: Our 12-day Spanish vaction started in Barcelona with U232 as our base for 4 nights. We opted for a room on the top level and got Room 909. We highly recommend it. The spacious and luxurious room comes with a sprawling bed, divan, roomy terrece, flat screen TV and assorted material comforts that will prove to be very much welcome after an exhausting day of sightseeing. The bathroom deserves special mention. Let's just say it was large enough for me and my wife to both get ready for the day without getting in each other's way. The hotel is a 5-minute walk from the Metro station, which connects you to the city's other attractions. Located across the road from a university, the area appears safe with a smattering of cafes catering to after-hours student crowd. Oh and the breakfast was great and hearty. We didn't include it in our booking but had lazy brunches on most days before heading out (in fact, we were first in and last out!).

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice clean hotel, good location, helpful and nice staff,comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLindy_53
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great value. It was well located, a few minutes walk to the diagonal. The hotel rooms were clean, not too small, beds were comfortable, nice bathroom. The hotel was lobby was modern in design. The staff was so friendly and helpful. The staff added to the entire great experience we had staying at the hotel. Parking is conveniently located next to the hotel, and the hotel offers a discount on the parking fees. Many nice options for all dining experiences within easy walking distance. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Aesthetically great, service so-so”
Reviews.Author: Sofuia
Reviews.Content: I wanted to treat my partner to a romantic weekend and chose this hotel after having read the reviews. I booked an "art weekend" from the hotel's website. It was good value for money, I ended up paying about Euro 100 per night for the double room. This weekend special included one pass for two people to seven of the major museums in the city (Picasso, Miro, MNAC etc.), a welcome cocktail from the bar and breakfast for two nights out of three. The hotel is indeed very nice aesthetically. The reception and bar area were clean and inviting. The rooms were quite spacious for a standard room. It had simple furniture but with a nice touch... everything was in wood, which I always appreciate. Flat screen TV (though didn't have many channels in English or French). Bathroom was also in style, with black marble and a big glass shower. Wifi in the lobby area and two computers that were at disposal. I thought that was a bonus, since I really didn't want to carry my laptop with me for a weekend where all I needed it for was web check-in. Breakfast was served in an area on the first floor, it had quite a wide selection and I loved the little doughnuts they had. You got a choice of hot and cold savory as well as toast, yogurt, pastries, cereal etc. I give it 4 out of 5. Now to the not-so-nice stuff: We arrived on Friday night and found that amenities in the room included: razor and shaving cream, toothbrush, shoe sponge, bath sponge, tissues...everything except shower gel and shampoo...there was nothing to wash yourself with but the tiny bar of hand soap! Just to be clear: they forgot to provide us with both shower gel and shampoo for two nights out of three. We ended up going to a supermarket to buy shower gel. Also the room needed to be heated all night because the bed came with one very thin cover. In February the temperature drops quite a bit a night. I like to save on energy if I can and have a green attitude when travelling too (not just in my own home) so I really do not see why we had to heat up a room all day and night as opposed to just having an old-fashioned duvet! On our first night, after the flight & tired, we didn't notice there was no blanket under the bed cover so we hadn't switched on the air con. Result: I was freezing and had a very bad night's sleep. Not a good way to start the weekend. Because we checked in at midnight, the receptionist gave us two vouchers for our "special U232 cocktail". So next evening before going for a meal we sat down to taste this special cocktail. The bar lady said (in Spanish) that this was a glass of cava with creme de cassis, a sort of Kyr royal though not real champagne...wait a minute, I said, why are we not having the "U232 cocktail" (which was on the bar menu). She replied that the voucher said "A" special U232 welcome cocktail, so it did not mean that or any of the cocktails on the list. Well you can imagine how impressed I was about receiving English lessons from a person that not once even tried to speak English with me, even when I was visibly struggling with my Spanish. ANYHOW beggars can't be choosers I suppose, but really did not appreciate the style of staff at times. Last but not least, on the Sunday night we booked a taxi for 5am the following morning and asked for a wake up call at 4am. Therefore, the staff were informed that, yes, we were leaving extremely early. At the same time we ordered room service (it was just past 9pm). By 10pm my boyfriend was getting hungry and a bit annoyed. He called up to ask what was going on and the receptionist said that it would be another 20 minutes. We had ordered a plate of ham, a salad and a ham and cheese sandwich, so we were quite bewildered. Another 30 minutes go by and I'm thinking that we should have been in bed already. FInally at 10.55 our meal arrived. I was furious and so was my boyfriend. We slept very little and were thoroughly annoyed with the whole thing. Thankfully they had the decency not to charge us with the service, I discovered this when I checked out. At least they implicitly admitted their mistake. However, if you are not in a position to provide room service, then don't have a menu for one. We could have gone to one of the corner cafe places, and had an equivalent meal in 30 minutes. All in all, I do not recommend this hotel to people who don't speak Spanish, who are looking for a true 4 star hotel or who are looking for a hotel that's close to where it all happens. However, if you are on a budget, what you get is decent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a leisurely stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: mickcu
Reviews.Content: Ditto to all the positive reviews. Stylish and roomy room. We got one with a varanda facing the back which led us to sleep in after late dinners. Breakfast was good. The reception people nice and helpful. While the hotel is NOT in the old/city center (Barri Gotic), it is IN L'Eixample - one of my favorite part of the cities. A beautiful friendly (very large) neighborhood which makes you feel like you could be someone living (and not just touring) Barcelona. And the walking we did allowed us to endulge in more food and wine! Try Paco Hedalgo two blocks away (make a reservation) and Goillard in Gracia. Delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stylish hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Karlito81
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this room for 1 week in late 2009. Very impressive rooms with excellent design. Extremely well-priced! The location is not bang in the centre but actually only a 5 min walk from the closest metro and only 20 min walk from Place de Catalunya.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite on this trip to Northern Spain”
Reviews.Author: flightoffantasy
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - clean, modern, nice size rooms, close to metro (which you really should use - so easy and quick, waited no longer than 3 minutes on Christmas day!!), great restaurants within walking distance - ask the staff, and a great little cafe to have breakfast caddycorner up the street. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “great room, great location, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: canucksfans
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the U232 after a Mediterranean cruise and, like many, had worried about booking online "sight unseen." But as soon as we arrived, our worries disappeared.
