The staff were very helpful with recommendations and reservations for meals, information about transportation, etc.and the rooms were comfortable, modern and the bathroom was spotless and had a towel warmer! We were very very happy with this hotel and at such a reasonable price. We also took advantage of the Bus Turistic discount and would recommend taking it (both red and blue routes) on your first day to get a "lay of the land" and then use the public transit to get to places you wanted to go back to. Both bus types(tourist and city transit) had stops within easy walking distance of the hotel. We would definitely return to this hotel on our next trip to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel.Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Pantheo36
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last month dor 3 days as I was inBarcelona for a business trip.My room was nice bit dark as it was on th backside therefore it was very quite though.I used some room service reasonaly priced and fast delivery.Reception was the ladies were very kind the guy could was ok. Location is great very close to the metro because of that to all the sites in Barcelona. Would stay again here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: JJ_Wisconsin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the U232 Hotel for two nights while visiting Barcelona for leisure, and enjoyed it very much. We got a good price on Booking.com (great source for international hotels, BTW) where it ended up being a little over one hundred dollars per night, with taxes and everything. My husband and I arrived around 10:00 in the morning and were greeted by two friendly individuals at the front desk. They both spoke English, and they informed us that though check in was not until 2:00, they did have a room available for us and that we could get in early. (It was really nice to be able to refresh & recharge a bit after an overnight flight!) The hotel itself is very nice, very classy. The public areas were clean and well-maintained, and the room was very comfortable. We had a double bed (technically two twins attached with a filler piece), a desk, flat-screen TV on the wall opposite the bed, minibar, and good-sized bathroom with tub and shower. Our room faced the courtyard (not street) side, so we did not have any outside noise to contend with. On the second night of our stay, a large tour group checked in, so that night we heard evidence of other people in the hotel--desk chairs scraping on the floor, shower running, etc. So if you were to get a noisy neighbor, the walls may seem thin; for us, though, there were not any real noise issues. One feature I really liked was the fact that there were numerous lights throughout the room, and that pretty much all the lights could be controlled from multiple points. It was especially nice to be able to control the overhead and reading lights from the bed. Also, you need to have a room key placed in a slot near the door for the lights to work; this is a great energy-saving feature, as it prevents you from leaving the lights on full-time in the room when you’re not there. I have only seen such a system in European hotels, and wish more U.S. hotels would follow suit. If you care to watch TV, they carry a number of channels; CNN and National Geographic were the only channels that were always in English, but other channels did occasionally have movies that were in English (I ended up watching Road to Perdition at 2 a.m. when struck by jet lag the first night, and The Last Castle on the second night.) We were on the sixth floor and were able to access the hotel’s free wireless Internet. There is also a business area with two computers, one of which you can print from. I have to say one of the best things about this hotel is its location. While it is not in the same neighborhood as tourist stuff, it is very near a Metro station, and we found the Metro system to be EXTREMELY convenient, reliable, understandable, and easy to use. Honestly, we have had more difficulty navigating subway systems here in the U.S., where we speak the language! I can’t say enough about Barcelona public transportation. We were able to get to everything we wanted to see via Metro (or, in the case of Parc Guell, Metro plus one bus ride). Other reviewers have stated that it is not difficult to walk to many attractions from the hotel, and I believe them, but we took the Metro everywhere because I’m 6 months pregnant and my feet just couldn’t take any extra walking. You can purchase a 10-ride card (T-10) for 7.70 Euros, and it can be used by multiple people (my husband and I shared one card at a time, with me running it through first, then him right after me). Also, this card is not just for the Metro! The first one we bought got us into the city from the airport on a RENFE train, around the metro, and on a bus. And if you transfer to another line within an hour and fifteen minutes of your first ride, it only counts as one use each. You can buy the passes at automated machines in each station, and they take cash, debit, or credit card (but be aware that if you want to use a credit card, it may ask you for a PIN, which we didn’t know for our credit cards). As far as food goes, we did not try anything the hotel had to offer, but there are restaurants and cafes very near the hotel. There is a gas station nearby, and a little convenience store just down the block which is good for picking up drinks & snacks. The cafe called Dino Pan was a lifesaver for me--pastries each morning, and sandwiches for keeping my energy up during the day. We also bought food at a grocery store on the Ramblas (in the basement of the El Corte Ingles department store) and brought that back to the room. We did not try anything at the hotel bar, but I’m assuming that it would be pricey, like most hotel bars. There is also a little bar just down the street which we walked by many times and it looked fine (not dark or dirty or scary). I would definitely stay here again, and would recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family who might want to visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: SelinaE
Reviews.Content: We have selected this hotel based on the reviews in Tripadvisor. We only had one night in Barcelona before boarding our cruise. It was a great hotel with excellent value, we paid Euro 69 for the night however I have to qualify that I booked the hotel more than 3 months in advance through their website. It was a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: thebooths
Reviews.Content: I booked the U232 hotel based on the reveiws on Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. The hotel is a little out of the centre of Barcelona but the metro is so good you can very easily get around to the main attractions. U232 is close to the Diagonal which is one of Barcelona's main shopping avenues full of designer lables. It is also close to one of the newest shopping centres in Barcelona, L'Illa which again is full of designer labels. We walked a lot in Barcelona and did not find it too difficult from the U232. We had a Top Room which is on the 10th floor with a great view out over the city. Our room was fantastic. Immaculately clean, sheets and towels changed every day which you don't get in all hotels these days, it even had a kettle with tea and coffee. The bathroom has double basins and a double shower with a very long bath in what I would call a Wet Room. The shower was the best I have every experienced in any hotel. The staff at the U232 were excellent and spoke very good English. Nothing was ever too much trouble. We arrived before check-in time but our room was ready and check-in took a couple of minutes. We decided to eat breakfast in the hotel after trying it on the first morning. It meant that we could have a pretty healthy breakfast with some vegetables and eggs. It is not cheap at 13euro each plus tax but we decided that this would be our little luxury. The quality of the breakfast is excellent and the coffee is very good. They serve the coffee in a jug that keeps it very hot and you also get a jug of warm milk. You can also get an espress if you wish, even decaf. The hotel does not have a restaurant but there are plenty of places to eat in the surrounding streets. I would not hesitate to stay at the U232 again and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a high quality hotel that was very good value. I booked directly with the hotel well in advance and got a rate of 102Euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Otic
Reviews.Content: U232 deserve this review. Friendly staff, well maintained hotel. The size is just fine, not too large. The rooms are tsateful and well equipped. Excellent, free internet. Breakfast is €13 +tax but is fine compared to other spanish hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Could not be happier with our choice of hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Rudy79
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. We were very worried that they would not hold our room since we were arriving at about 1:00 am. We flew Ryan Air into Girona, about 120 Kilometers awat. Upon arrival, the wife and I took a bus for 21 euros each, round trip into Barcelona. The bus trip took a little over an hour. Once at the Barcelona Bus Terminal, we could have taken the metro but decided on a taxi due to the late hour, (8 euros) Upon arrival at the hotel, we had no problem with our late arrival. In fact, we were pleasantly surprised. We walked into a very nice looking hotel, older, but very well maintained. The hotel clerk was very friendly and helpful in giving us directions to a nearby gas station / store to purchase and bring back some drinks and a few snacks for quick bite. We dropped off our bags in our very spacious room on the 8th floor with two complete bathrooms, a mini-suite in my book. Don't know if this was a mistake because we booked a standard room. Making the price for this room a great deal. We went for sightseeing so the hotel location was not important but we were very happy with its location. The Hospital-Clinic metro stop, L5 - Blue, was only 2 blocks away. The metro system in Barcelona was clean and very easy to use. We bought the 4 day pass for about 19 euros and included unlimited buss and tram use. On our first day, we decided on the one day hop on- hop off bus tours and at least saw all the major sights. The hotel staff mentioned a voucher for this tour, and they sold us a voucher which saved us 2 euros per person. The pick up location for this tour was only about 4 blocks away. Again, I have to mention the staff was the greatest. They also recommend great locations to visit and even mentioned a few places to eat. We are very easy to please and we would recommend this facility to any of my friends. Also don't be fooled, December weather in Barcelona is cold. Which leads to our only complaint, if you could call it one; we could not turn off the heat nor turn on the A/C. The hotel's central heating was on and could not be indivually controlled at each room. We were able to open up the windows to cool off the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ron3643
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the U232 prior to a Mediterranean Cruise. We spent two nights in the hotel. It was extremely clean and the staff was very helpful. We were greated by Manuel and he made must feel very welcome. The staff that we came in contact with spoke very good English. The room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. We felt that it was good value for your money. If you are a traveller from North America, I would recommend that you pack a couple of facecloths because they are not available in many European hotels - that is the case in this hotel. We did not find any really good restaurants in the immediate area but just around the corner there is a grocery store where you can pick up a lot of snack foods at a reasonable price. We returned to the hotel for one night prior to our return flight to Canada and had another nice room. It faced the main street so it was not quite as quiet as our first room that faced a courtyard. both rooms were a nice size and bright. Ferran was very helpful in assisting us to confirm our flights home when we were not able to access the sites on the computer. All in all, we were very pleased with the personnel and the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Triklops
Reviews.Content: We just paid 208 € for three nights (2 persons) without breatfast, that was a great bargain. Next metro (hospital) is around the corner. It iis just a nice 15 minutes walk to the city center. Staff is VERY polite and helpful. Our room (standard) was very clean and had a nice bath and an aesthetic furniture. The room was not too big, but big enough. There is free w-lan. There is really nothing to complain about, would book this hotel everytime again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but no coffee facilities”
Reviews.Author: Hardley_Hare
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, with good accommodation and friendly and helpful staff. It is quite a long way from the centre of Barcelona but we could always find a restaurant nearby and the metro is very easy to use to get around. It's worth buying the 3 day ticket for 15 Euros. And the Bus Turistic was a good way to see the city when you first arrive. We did both the red and blue routes. Ask at Reception about it and they'll sell you a discount pack. One big bugbear was that were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Although a coffee was available from room service for 2 Euros. It would have been nice to have a coffee to wake up before going down to breakfast. There was an excellent selection of pastries available for breakfast but the cooked breakfast only consisted of bacon, sausages (sometimes), scrambled egg or some kind of egg/potato cake and some mushrooms with peppers. The bar was expensive, as expected. Our bill for around 8 drinks was between 40 and 50 Euros. I would stay at this hotel again but would probably choose to stay somewhere a bit more central so we didn't always have to use the metro to get to the centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “U232 GOOD FOR US3”
Reviews.Author: drew74
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona and as you would expect were a little wary of location. We weren't too sure of the best location,and some of the reviews had stated it was a little out of the way. In our opinion the location was spot on!! It was just a few stops in different directions to all the major attractions by tube.If you have used the tube in London then this is just as simple. A couple of stops and you can be at the Nou Camp,Gaudi park,Gaudi apartments,Sagrada Familia,La Rambla,and the fountains by the royal palace.We bought a 3 day pass for all transport,tube,train and bus for just 15 euros each,bargain.Another must is a good city guide with locations of attractions with a tube map and you're away! Now to the hotel. It was spotless and very stylish in design.We thought it was lovely and the staff are all very helpful and always polite and happy.The bar was nice but very expensive, so pass unless you're feeling flush.9.50 Euros for a J.D and coke!! The room was also very nice and the air con was a bonus.The bathroom was a good size with a bath and shower which was again very nicely done, and with great amounts of hot water and power.Our room was a little on the dark side as we faced a small kind of courtyard.Being on the 3rd floor and the building being 10 floors, not a lot of natural light came in the windows.It was October so it didn't really bother us too much, but the summer would be a little more of an issue.The only couple of small gripes for us was the lack of an iron(we'd forgotten ours and the laundry prices were very high at around 6 euros an item,) and the fact CNN was the only english speaking channel on the tv. When you have kids who go to bed early it would be nice to have a little more choice for something to watch.They are only small gripes so it wouldn't put us off going again! On our last day we had the hotel breakfast and it was ok.There are better alternatives if you go out.There are a couple of nice little cafes and bars that do a better and less expensive breakfast then the hotel and are only around the corner.Again 14 euros for breakfast is a little steep. All in all we loved the hotel and would go back again and recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Soothing”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2cruise45
Reviews.Content: After LONG flights from Seattle ~ we were immediately soothed by the friendly and helpful staff allowing us to store our luggage in a secure room so that we could get out for a walk-about to shake off our jet lag. We found every amenity to be 'spot-on' and the location just perfect for us. We enjoyed the buzzing activity from our balcony but our friends said their room facing the back was very quiet compared to ours. I wouldn't hesitate to stay with them again and recommend them to friends wanting an intimate, friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great ...”
Reviews.Author: carton44
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel close to metro (150 m from Hospital-Clinic station). Taxi from Plaça Catalunya just 6€ in the middle of the night ... Very good WIFI connection in the room. Super breakfast buffet ... Excellent Mojito at the bar ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: texasallan
Reviews.Content: The hotel and room was very clean, modern and hotel staff very pleasant abd helpful except for the older desk clerk. Liked the location, easy to get to the metro, only problem was on return to hotel using metro exit always turned wrong way out of exit to get back to the hotel. (our fault) The hotel has free wifi and two computers downstairs which is good.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, very clean but way too noisy and limited room service”
Reviews.Author: rookers
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here if you want a peaceful visit. Situated next to a hospital and is the main ambulance route with very loud sirens day and night. Purposely chose a hotel not in the centre so it would be quiet so very disappointed and did not sleep well. Also room service finishes at 11pm as does the bar. Nice decor and very clean but can't believe it's rated no.6!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Barcelona - Fab hotel, very clean, great value, would be perfect if more central.”
Reviews.Author: TripSurvivorDotCom
Reviews.Content: My husband & I chose this hotel as it was good value (£71 per night) and looked really nice and clean. It was lovely - just like in the photos. First we were put in a horrible dark room on floor 9 with a brick wall outside the window but were moved into a much nicer room on room 8 where we stayed for 3 nights. It was very quiet as it was overlooking the back of the hotel - not a pretty view mind, as it looked over other people's washing and flats. Overlooking the front probably would have been better as it is on the street but has double-glazing. We didn't spend much time in the room so it didn't matter. The staff were helpful and friendly, particularly Jennifer. There is supposed to be some kind of spa downstairs but it was closed when we were there. When I got back I read a review on TripAdvisor that a couple had been given free breakfast because the spa was closed, so remember to ask if you go there. We were able to leave our cases in reception all afternoon as we were on the late flight out, and had absolutely no trouble getting back to the airport by train - stress-free. The hotel is very near the underground station 'hospital clinic', but we found that it was quicker to walk to the top of La Ramblas and make our way down than get on the train. We got the train back sometimes though as it was all uphill. The underground system is very easy to navigate and they have glass lifts from the pavement - how good is that? We bought 10 tickets each for 7 euros at the airport and didn't use them all. We did not eat at the hotel (I think they did breakfast at 13 euros each) as there are plenty of places to eat close by where you can buy rolls, pizza and all sorts. There's a nice deli across the road on the corner. Try the Chinese along the road back towards the station - fab food but they can't speak English or Spanish so it was completely empty!! The woman owner is like a Chinese Basil Fawlty and we eventually managed place our order in French to one of her staff. The atmosphere in Barcelona was brilliant; I absolutely loved it and must have walked miles and miles but it didn't feel that way as there is so much to look at. We even got to watch the gay pride procession. The tourist bus is brilliant - 3 routes and well worth the money. You can get money-off vouchers for the bus in a pack from the hotel. There's a great market in La Ramblas - La Boqueterie - where you can buy fresh fruit and yummy food. And there's always McDonalds and Burger King. We tried hard to find real Spanish food, but despite trying we mostly got rubbishy tourist food that I'm sure Spanish people would not eat. Watch out for eating and drinking alfresco in La Ramblas - we met my in-laws and a couple of drinks each and 2 plates of tapas cost nearly 120 euros. I nearly fell off my chair!! On our last day we found a wonderful little eating place down by the port - as you face the water by Christopher Columbus it's in the side road on the left. Carry on past the corner place where tourists (like us) sit outside and pay £5+ for 2 cokes. It is run by women who cook lovely stuff and at reasonable prices too. Sorry, can't remember the name but wished we'd found it on the first day. I would go back to Barcelona; it is a fabulous, vibrant city - full of life. I don't think it's somewhere I would choose to take children - it's a grown-up place with amazing architecture, particularly Gaudi. If we were there for longer, I'l like to have visited Dali's museum at Figueres, but this is nearer to Girona airport. I didn't know where to look when we walked back down the beach paddling in the waves towards Barceloneta - lots of naked people spread out sunbathing without a care in the world!! I'd spend a bit extra to stay right on La Ramblas or in the gothic quarter but can thoroughly recommend Hotel U232 to anyone. Thank you for reading my review.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and luxeure Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisvahi
Reviews.Content: First Impression: verry Nice. We travelled to Barcelona for Vacation. For us as Students a verry nice designed Hotel. The staff was verry helpfull. They try to arrange everything or you of you want. We did not use any meals. Supermarket is arround the Corner. Nice Central location. Metro 1 bloc away, Sagrada 20min walk. Free use of 2 computers in lobby with connection to internet and possibility to Print

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: azim31
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in September. This hotel is less expensive than most since its in a quiter part of the city. Although its only a 10-20 min walk to most sites. The staff is helpful and the rooms are clean. The bathroom was excellent and appears to have been recently renovated. There is free WIFI. We didn't pay extra for the breakfast but there are plenty of places to eat in the area. Overall we would recommend saving your money by staying at the U232 rather than pay extra just to be a liitle closer to the city center (Barcelona is an easy city to walk around).

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: SeasonTraveler2007
Reviews.Content: The Hotel U232 is one of the best kept secrets in Barcelona. We stayed there our last two nights of our vacation, and all i can say is what a joy. The hotel is elegant. The staff is incredible. And the location is convenient. If you can stay at the U232, do it. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Totally amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: DirkusCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Hotel U232 just rocks! I was recommended to stay at U233 by none other than fellow Tripadvisor travelers (of course - who else do you actually trust with great travel suggestions?). After having read the rave reviews, I made my reservation through Wonderlandhotels - which in itself was an absolute pleasure to deal with - one of their representatives, Ali was fantastic, and could not have been more helpful. U232 is so centrally situated and within convenient walking distances from all major attractions. The Hotel itself is spotless, and very swish. Great interior design - and everything worked! The rooms were a pleasure - and the housekeeper staff were excellent and thoroughly impressed me. The little touches added to one's comfort and just made the experience that much more pleasurable. I must make special mention of the wonderful front desk assistance we received. No request was too much trouble. In particular, I must single out Mr Sebastian Elorza who really was fantastic in giving us general touristy kind of trips, and in particular, his recommendations as to which restaurants to visit. Two of them, namely el Pintor and Paco Meralgo hit the nail right on the head - and were really great gastronomic experiences . To Sebastian, all staff, and management, a HUGE thumbs up - you guys are doing a fabulous job. Many thanks, Dirk, 17 on Loader Guest House, Cape Town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Touring”
Reviews.Author: DanBelden
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel bills itself primarily as a "Business Person's" hotel, it is a fine place for the tourist to stay too. Other reviews have mentioned the convenience of the Metro Stop 2 blocks away for getting around the city to see it sights, it also works well as a source for getting to the airport. It took about one hour to get from the hotel to the airport ticket counter. The cost was less than 2 Euros each. Their are elevators at both ends of the stops, and the one in between at the train station, that allow you to get to the Metro Platform/Train Platform without having to lug your luggage up and down stairs. The hotel personnel were extremely helpful in explaining the process/connections you need to make in using the combination Metro/Train to get to the airport. Obviously, you can do it in reverse too. Just communicate with the hotel staff before leaving on your trip and I am sure they can give you adequate directions in an email.. Although we starting using the Metro the last 2 days of our stay, initially we just wanted to walk above ground and see the city and all the vitality it has to offer. For our first walk out of the hotel the desk clerk on duty suggested we traverse over to Passe de Gracia to have our first look at Gaudi's Casa Batllo and other famous architectural structures along that grand street, which will then lead you to the top of Las Rambla. With a stop at the Starbucks shortly after entering the Passe de Gracia Boulevard and gawking at the sights, it took us about an hour to get to the top of Las Rambla. You can walk a more diagonal and direct route in about 20-30 minutes through the neighborhood and get to Las Rambla too. Either way you decide to walk, there are many good eateries and cafes to stop at and rest. Initially, We suggest you walk as much as possible to places, for it is the best way to see the city. The neighborhoods around the Hotel offer many interesting areas to explore. After a few days and you're tired of walking, take the Metro to get around!! During our second day we took the Tourist Bus around the city, doing all 3 routes - Red, Blue & Green.- in one day (takes about 5-6 hours). The Hotel Staff will provide information. The stop for the primary routes (Red & Blue- each has their own, different location to board at the intersection described below) is 3 blocks from the Hotel at the tri-corner streets of Urgell (Hotel Street), Avinguda de Josep Tarradellas and Avinguda Diagonal. And, a Starbucks is right there if you have to wait long, which is seldom the case!! Also, there is a nice, rather elegant, and not too expensive restaurant around the corner from Starbucks, called "Ginos:" that is open at 7:30 P.M. for evening meals. At the above location you can catch whichever Bus Route has seats available on the open top deck first, then come back to the same stop in about 2 hours and catch the other route. To catch the Green Route along the shoreline, you'll need to get off and on the Blue Bus Route at certain points. The Hotel Staff is very helpful. They consist of young and older people, so whatever your age is I'm sure you'll find someone on the staff who can impart the age appropriate tourist information you seek! As other reviews have stated, the rooms and hotel facilities are a good bargain for the price. You could stay at regular or boutique hotel nearer the old part of the city for about the same, or higher price, and probably have less room/bathroom space, less newness/cleanliness, less sound proofing of the room and more street noise to deal with late at night. Also, the street life around this hotel may be less threatening late at night. Besides, you would never see the part of the city where this hotel is located and the interesting neighborhoods between the hotel and the old city as you walk back and forth!! If you book a hotel near Las Rambla you may never explore the other parts of the city. I've attached several photos to give you a sense of what the hotel looks like. It is very similar to the professional photos the hotel displays on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Modern well priced hotel - but location is just OK”
Reviews.Author: specialk23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights. I am a regukar visitor to Barcelona. I normaly stay on the Ramblas but decided to stay here because of a great on line deal and tripadvisor reviews. Really cannot fault hotel itself. Room was good size and very modern. No street noise. Fittings and furnishings exceeded my expectation for the price I paid - defintely solid 4 star level. However I have 2 issues with hotel: 1. porter service - we arrived with a lot of luggage. There is not porter service. Had to lug it up to my room myself in a few trips. 2. Location - if you want to spend most of your time in the catlunya square area this hotel is a bit far. On foot it is a good 25min walk. Further than it looked on the map. However - if you are comfortable using taxis/underground this is a good choice for a well priced nice hotel in a a quieter more suburban settiing than las ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet haven in a bustling city”
Reviews.Author: HBombNewquay
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the U232, it was such a quiet and a perfect place to return to after a long day in the heat of Barcelona in August. The place had lovely feel about it and the decor was class, there is a lovely lobby area with free internet access and the rooms are well appointed with huge beds. The location is fine although away from the main tourist traps, the metro is a couple of minutes away and with one connection to the airport, is ideal to get around quick and easily. We walked most nights down to the old town without a problem and there are a range of cheap cafes and restaurants nearby. Would recommend the hotel to everyone. You must eat at Set Portes on pg Isabel as it is authentic spanish eatery with top quality food at a reasonable price, the paellas are out of this world, enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: ORlaos
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel after reading reviews on here and I wasn't disappointed. We upgraded to a U232 room and had a huge bed which was great. Room spotlessly clean and hotel itself very modern. It was one of the quietest hotels I've ever stayed in. Woulndt hear a pin drop. Staff spoke great English and were extremely helpful. Location of hotel was prefect, as others have said just 1 block from metro. Although you will have to make one change to get most places. We walked into place de cataluyna one eveing in 30 minutes and found lovely restaurants along way. Also hotel is just 4 blocks from toursit bus stops. Around the hotel there were some lovely cafe's and restaurants and a supermarket. Would definetely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideal for a stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: DomfromLondon
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was very hot when we arrived, so the aircon was invaluable. Rooms are very sound proofed, so you would not have a clue you were on a busy road. Nearest metro Hospital Clinic - very easy. Excellent breakfast buffet, helpful staff. Great value for money by comparison with previous experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay in BCN”
Reviews.Author: OrenB
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 nights in BCN, all of which we have spent in U232. The hotel filled all our expectations! The rooms are big enough and the shower/bath room was sufficient. The room was clean and nicely decorated. Air condition is available and allow a good control (auto turn on and off and temp. control). We had a nice 32" Philips LCD TV, refrigerator and hair dryer. Our breakfast was included in the price and was nice - selection of sausages, yellow cheese, eggs, tomatoes, selection of breads, cereals, several fresh juices, jams, several types of cakes and fresh fruits (however I would not recommend it if it was not included in your reservation. The hotel is located about 200m from the subway (about 3 min walk) and from there you can reach anywhere in the city. Please take notice - Barcelona has many attractions to offer, but they are spread all around the city... This means that the most important thing in a hotels' location is access to the subway... The staff spoke good English and provided all the information we needed. I would definitely come back to this hotel and warmly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: assmazz
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very calm, with pleasant jazz background music in the common spaces, excellent accessibility Internet, public transport means to walk, rooms and lobby very fashion and clean, You can reach all points of interest of the City with Metro located at 50 meters from the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Class act in a wonderful location!”
Reviews.Author: vsirvis
Reviews.Content: Absolutely stay here if you are visiting Barcelona!!! The entire hotel staff is so incredibly professional, friendly, and helpful! We dined at fabulous locations, within walking distance of the hotel, they were some of the best experiences we had ;-) The neighborhood is extremely clean & classy with a nice mix of residences, shopping, & restaurants. Our room was extremely clean and comforatable, bathroom wsa very cool. Very, quiet, peaceful hotel with a wonderful scent throughout. Excellent large, loungy area to utilize computers, printing, copies, or just read a book. Subway located half block away was also incredibly convenient. You can go wrong here, top notch comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, not too far from the center!”
Reviews.Author: mhottinga
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed in this hotel 5 nights and we really had a pleasant time! The hotel itself looks really nice and comfortable. The room was really nice decorated, but maybe a little bit too dark for my taste. The bathroom has a little rain shower and provide you with all the amenities you need. The staff was friendly and helpfull. The bar is nice, but really expensive. The location was good too. In walking distance are a lot of restaurants, bars and clubs. The subway - which will bring you to the centre, the harbor etc. - is a 2 minute walk from the hotel. A cab ride to the airport will cost you about € 40,-.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- consider location”
Reviews.Author: pnomad
Reviews.Content: This really is an excellent hotel. Well run, with efficient staff. Quiet rooms in back, nice breakfast room. However, the location is quite far from Gothic Quarter and major sites, and the tour bus does not stop near here. There is metro line 1.5 blocks away, but it does not go anywhere you would want to go, and you have to transfer, with long walks between lines. It is about 6 long blocks to other more convenient metro- and if it is hot in summer, you will not have pleasant walk. For solo travellers, consider a better location, especially for returning at night. The neighborhood itself is pleasant and has many restaurants, but you will not have convenient access to touring.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: x3040879
Reviews.Content: We have just spent one night at the U232 and wished we could have stayed longer! On arrival we were upgraded to a top floor room which was amazing. Very spacious and everything you needed was catered for. The room was well equipped, beautifully decorated and had a large private terrace overlooking barcelona. The whole hotel was spotless and incredibly stylish. All of the staff were willing to help and were very friendly and polite. The hotel offers free internet which is also a bonus. It is well located, only 2 minutes from a metro stop and it is possible to walk to the centre. Breakfast was good and there was plenty to choose from and all food was very fresh. The hotel does not have a restaurant for evening meals, although there is a room service menu which is very reasonably priced. There are a number of restaurants within walking distance, and a lack of hotel restaurant presented no problem. We will definitely return to this hotel for a longer stay and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Superb Location.”
Reviews.Author: u2fanMalta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this excellent Hotel for two nights to attend the first U2 360 Concert at Camp Nou. The location was just superb. 15minute taxi to Camp Nou. 2 minute walk for the underground station to expore the city of Barcelona. There is a caferteria just as you go out of the Hotel on the right and a supermarket around the block on the left. I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff is nice. The hotel is clean and the location as mentioned above is simply superb.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel/Thin Walls/A Little out of the Way”
Reviews.Author: babygame
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with Trafalgar's Wonder of Spain tour. Very nice hotel, but the walls were paper thin (we could hear the conversation in the adjacent room). Small convenience store nearby, but generally too far from main areas of Barcelona. Very comfy beds. Very helpful staff at desk. We skipped the optional tour to Monserrat and walked down Urgell to an enclosed clothing mart (with many different vendors), where we found some good buys. Borrowed hotel umbrella when it rained. Too far from beaches, the Rambla, etc. We looked the 1st floor conference area and had some small cocktail parties there. WE WERE EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED AS THE HOTEL LITERATURE SAID THERE WAS A SPA/SOLARIUM ON THE TOP FLOOR. WE WENT UP THERE AND FOUND ONLY CONSTRUCTION DEBRIS!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service + Great Room = U232 Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: zeitgeist77
Reviews.Content: Everything you want from a hotel stay. The room cannot be faulted, with a spacious terrace, super comfy bed and the best hotel bathroom (two rain-showers and bath) and stylish decor. Our favorite part was the excellent service. No sucking up or insincere 'hospitality' just good old honest professionalism and friendly personalities. Absolutely worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “The highlight of our stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: G2Miami
Reviews.Content: After a long trip through Europe, we were glad to stay in the U232 the last nights of our vacations, from earlier reviews & pictures I knew it was going to be good, never imagined it was going to be THAT GOOD! Not to repeat previous reviews, I will just say that the hotel exceeded my expectations in every single aspect! If you get a fair price, do not hesitate and book it before it's gone. My only negative comment is I wifi coverage was not good in the rooms, sometmes we had to go downstairs to the lobby to get a good fast connection.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: drew610
Reviews.Content: The hotel feels very classy when you walk in through the cool automatic doors, and the lobby is great with cool music playing and the hotel has, for some reason, a great smell in the lobby. The downstairs staff was cold, but that's kinda par for the course these days. The business center has free internet, which is great, but the staff showed no concern when the printer wasn't working. The rooms are excellent, fairly big, nice balconies, great bathrooms, and a cool flatscreen on the walls. The hotel is in a little bit of a dull area, but it is two minutes from a metro stop and a perfectly pleasant 25-30 minutes walk to major stuff. At $125USD a night on Orbitz it was a great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chic9chica
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The music in the lobby is very soothing and it smells delicious when you walk in. The service is great. The rooms are a tad small but well worth the money. Flat screen tv and comfortable beds and pillows. There is a sandwich and coffee shop right next door. The metro is two blocks away which makes it easy to get everywhere. Free WIFI in every room. Would stay here again with no hesitation as Barcelona is a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended-will be back!”
Reviews.Author: FlossNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the U232 for 4 nights after seeing it recommended on Trip Advisor. Our room was on the top floor, for which we paid a little extra, but it was absolutely worth it. The room was elegant, spotless, quiet and had a balcony with a great view of the Barcelona skyline. There is little to visit in the immediate vicinity, but the Metro is two blocks away so the location is no problem. No real criticisms, other than the room service was a little hard to get hold of one morning and they did not replace the coffee sachets after the first night, but it's not like there aren't a million coffee places near by for emergency recaffeination! Also recommended is an incredible tapas bar (Quete Pincho) on the Avunguda de Sarria, 5 minutes walk away. Overall one of the best hotels we've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Efficient Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DublinOpinion
Reviews.Content: We stayed in U232 for a weekend break. Great comfortable bed, good quality room. Staff were fine. Its a business hotel (4 star is a little high) and is about 25 min walk from Place Catalunya. I would recommend highly once the rate is ok. We paid €85 so no issues.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury, luxury, luxury...U232”
Reviews.Author: DeniseLaurenIreland
Reviews.Content: Hotel U232 is truly the ultimate in luxury. I’d sum it up as old world class presented in a most pleasing minimalist style. Upon walking into the lobby area, one immediately knows, U232 is a hotel that pays great attention to detail. After a most taxing flight, I can’t tell you how nice it was to sink down into one of the oversized leather couches which adorn the bar, all the while sipping away on one of the hotel’s signature cocktails-what bliss! Of course one cannot mention the entrance to the hotel without paying tribute to the fantastic reception staff. From day one of our trip they went out of their way to attend to our every whim, even checking up bars we were interested in online for us. Knowing we had such helpful staff available helped us enjoy, all the more, our limited time in the city. Another feature not to miss in u232 is thier lounge area on the first floor.Here, amidst the opulant leather couches and old style mahogony furniture, one can lounge out in front of the flat screen tv. We loved to relax here after a long day sight-seeing and it was also a great way to meet and converse with other guests. Clearly after having seen the reception and lounge area we had high expections for the bedroom. Thankfully it surpassed them all! The classic old style minimalist interior we first enjoyed on the ground floor continued on into the bedrooms. Our room featured a very impressive super-king bed, aflat screen tv with English channels, a well-equipped mini-bar and of course complimentary wifi! The ensuite with it’s shower enclosure (bigger than a double shower!) and black marble throughout was perfect for our stay. Also tribute must be made to the cleaning staff who ensured our bedroom remained immaculate during the course of our stay. Having read reviews of the hotel prior to our stay, we were slightly worried about the location of U232. However, these fears proved entirely unfounded. The hotel is situated only a stone’s throw away from the “Hospital Clinic” metro stop. Thus in a matter of minutes you can go anywhere simply by jumping on the train. We also walked to Las Ramblas, where many principal attractions are located in a mere 25 minutes. We actually loved being slightly out of the madness which is the center of Las Ramblas. We also found many bars and eateries around the hotel which we really enjoyed and which were more authentically Spanish than thier Las Ramblas counterparts, not to mention considerably cheaper. Try “El Sol” bar which is located on the same block as the hotel for very cheap tapas, local beer and wine. It is ope until 3 am and is full of locals. Also the “Tapas Restaurent” located right at the “Hospital Clinic” metro stop (The Comte d’ Urgell entrance) does the nicest Paella we tasted over the course of our trip. As you can tell I would whole-heartedly recommend for anyone to stay in U232. it deserves it’s 4 star rating and more and was a fundamental reason we so enjoyed our time in Barcelona. Thank you so sincerely to all the staff who treated us so kindly. Hopefully we’ll see you again in the future on another trip!

Reviews.Title: “Really, a great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RomanHans1
Reviews.Content: There are two types of hotels: the charming little establishment with a charismatic owner, and the efficient hotel that offers everything you want and stays out of your way. The U232 is clearly the latter. This is simply a terrific hotel. The hotel is attractive, the location is good, the staff is helpful, the rooms are nice, quiet and well-decorated. My only complaint with the room is that the windows were basically useless (and covered with shades) so it was a bit claustrophobic. This is a nice little find and for the price (I paid 64 euros at the hotel website) it's a terrific deal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: MO0648
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonably priced, clean and out of the way hotel for a 5 day stay in Barcelona. We decided on the U232 (the address number of the street) and were not disappointed. Check-in was painless, the staff were very gracious and the room they gave us was exactly as ordered. Clean, neat, 2 single beds (frequently European Kings beds are just 2 singles pushed together so we don't fight the system). The room had a/c, minibar (we didn't use it) and was the perfect example of the "business mans hotel". Some rooms (by virtue of location) don't have easy access to wireless internet but the main lobby is a hot spot and they also have free internet in the business center on the main floor. The staff were very helpful and couldn't do enough for us. The hotel is not in the center of all the activity (Las Ramblas) which is a good thing but it is only 1 block away from the subway that will take you where ever you want to go. I would use this hotel on every visit to Barcelona from here on in. Highly recommended. For photos of Barcelona please go to www.globalodyssey.ifp3.com and look under the gallery for Europe - Spain - Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Good location near metro”
Reviews.Author: jaygo
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel around 12.00pm and were able to check in straight away. We we on the rear of the building a poor view but is more quite. As the entrance is on a busy road. The room and bathroom were clean and tidy great for a weekend get away. As always the minibar was overprice but there is a minimarket just down the road near the metro. We thought we might get stuck in Barca due to the weather in the UK. We were able to check the internet for free in the business centre, which was great!! If you book make sure to get a deal with breakfast included, quite expensive otherwise. Overall a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: RachelSouthampton
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. Staff very helpful. We arrived after midnight and wanted a drink the bar was closed but the receptionist gave us a map and showed us where to go. They also booked a dinner and show for us. The rooms were very very clean and the decor was great, good hairdryer, powerful shower, mirror and lighting good. What more do you need!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, unflexible staff”
Reviews.Author: whatever2_8
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, great location but the staff was a bit unflexible as we had to check out at 12.00h not even 3 minutes later (the hotel hall was empty so no big group waiting for rooms to be cleaned). I wasn't asking for an hour extra but a few minutes to finish packing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic U232”
Reviews.Author: mcarnegie
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the hotel after just being robbed in Barcelona. Was about 2 minutes away by car when I got a flat tyre at a traffic light. When changing the tyre, somone stole my wife's handbag and made off as a pillion passenger on a scooter (someone who was pretending to help). Later found that this is a common scam, an organised group slashes your tyre and waits for you to stop. Then someone else diverts your attention (the guy on the scooter) while someone else steals your bags etc. Anyway, on to the U232 Hotel.... On checkin, the guy was sympathetic and immediately said he would upgrade my room. Got a fantastic room on the 9th floor with a huge balcony with dining table and sofa. Bathroom had a huge marble bath around 6 feet long with patio doors which opened directly to the balcony. Bedroom was absolute luxury and after the ordeal when we arrived, we felt like staying in the hotel room all night but decided to venture out regardless. At reception, we were given vouchers for a free coctail at the bar. The hotel itself was very luxurious, very well presented. The public toilet was spotless with fresh linen for drying your hands. Also had an internet room with free access on 2 PC's. We didn't eat in the hotel but did notice prices were reasonable for a city location. Basically, the hotel staff and the hoitel ambience made up for what could have been a disasterous trip to Barcelona. p.s. I did get my wifes bag back after I chased after the culprit and pulled him off the bike...

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: kerrywoman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our wedding anniversary wkend. We were upgraded to a massive queen size bed, our room had a balcony looking out into a courtyard, and huge french doors. The window through to the bathroom that so many people have mentioned was quite unique!! we decided it was like a one way mirror you see in cop shows in an interrogation room. There is a venetian blind on it so it can be closed completely for privacy, or opened for questioning!!! The hotel is very comfortable, with lovely seating areas. The staff are superb, loads better than the staff all around the city, who we found a bit reluctant and surly. The hotel staff couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast, at 13 euro, is good but pricey. There's a small bakery, Dino Pan, two doors down. You can get gorgeous coffee and croissants there for about 2 euro, or there are other cafes within five mins walk as well. The hotel is in a lovely area, just ten mins walk through the Modernista district (Eixample) with the lovely architecture will take you to some great shopping areas. Or the metro stop Hospital Clinic is two blocks away (incidentally, the only bad food we had all wkend was in a restaurant at this metro stop called TAPASBAR, a glass fronted place - avoid at all costs). This hotel made a great base for our stay. Taxis are cheap, public transport is easy to access, and it's a quiet, relaxing home base. Can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “All Around Great!”
Reviews.Author: cleanfreakmadrid
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with everything, from the friendliness of the staff to the cleanliness and comfort of the room. I have only good things to say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, fantastic room!”
Reviews.Author: ExpatCatt
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with my husband for two nights and were so glad we chose the U232. We went for the "top room" which cost half as much as a standard room in many hotels off La Rambla. Location turned out to be good, actually, if you don't mind hopping on the Metro--only a block from the Hospital-Clinic Metro stop, which is just a few stops from the train station and also the Segrada Familia. The room (908) was absolutely fantastic. We loved the huge private balcony on a corner, with 180 degree views over the city. The bathroom was very spacious with a shower I would love to have in my house--two shower extensions, plus a rain shower. The hotel was stylish and very clean, with helpful staff, a business center with free internet access and a printer. Oh--and breakfast was really good as well...great coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Renbar
Reviews.Content: Fantastic amenities and service at this place - easy access to the computers in the business lounge, we used the bar a few times and the service was great, the front desk staff were super helpful and helped out with maps and suggestions. The lobby is great for meeting people - a well-serviced bar and comfortable seats to wait for a friend. The rooms were excellent - very clean and comfortable - included a safe and robes, and even slippers, and the bathroom was nice and big and clean with plenty of space for a couple trying to get ready at the same time for a day's walking or a night out on the town! It was more luxurious than we expected and worth every penny. I left an item of clothing by accident in the room and didn't notice for a few days after I got home. I emailed the hotel, worried that i had seen the last of my favourite (and not cheap) piece of clothing and they followed up promptly, without drama, and they sent it to me safe and sound without issue, even though I was in a different country by then. They went the extra mile when they didn't have to and it pretty much summed up our experience when we stayed there. We found it easy to get around even though the hotel is not super central - the underground is only a few moments walk from the hotel and we used it every day to get to the sites we were visiting. So in effect, the location was really convenient as we would've had to pay a lot more for this standard of hotel if we wanted to stay in the centre of Barcelona. This was a real treat for tired travellers and well worth the stay. There's a great little tapas place not far from the hotel - gorgeous food but we recommend booking ahead if you want a table guaranteed. It's across from one of the train/undergound exits and had a few outdoor tables and small plants outside.. can't remember the name though unfortunately!

Reviews.Title: “First rate accommodation”
Reviews.Author: liverbirdcrj
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in this hotel. It was a smart place to stay for my Dads 65th birthday. It was great value for a 3 star hotel...the rooms were very nicely furnished, the staff were courteous, the breakfast was good if you like a huge buffet and whilst it wasn't the most centrally located hotel, the nearby metro station meant it was easy to get around if you were prepared to use public transport. For an alternate breakfast, try out the bakery next to the garage (across the street). I would go back here on business but would try one of the sister hotels on my next tourist visit as i was impressed by the quality of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HappyHolsHerts
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the U232 and it was wonderful, nothing to fault at all. The hotel is exactly as the website photos show. The lobby area is lovely and relaxing, especially with the ambient music playing. The decor is very clean cut and contemporary and the hotel was only refurbished last year so still has that new smell about it! The staff are very helpful and friendly. The rooms are spacious, spotless and you're guaranteed a good nights sleep in the huge comfy beds. Great location and close to the metro station. Check out an amazing tapas bar in walking distance called Cerveseria Catalonia for the best tapas in town. We had 3 glasses of red wine, 5 beers and all the tapas we could fit into 2.5 hours which cost around 50 euros, a bargain for the quality of the food. An excellent hotel, I would definitley go back.

Reviews.Title: “Situation OK, inflexible staff for a four-star, our room was a bunker”
Reviews.Author: DivedivaSwitzerland
Reviews.Content: We were three women and stayed one night. The hotel is spotless and tastefully decorated. It's exactly as you can see on the website, so generally quite dark. The standard rooms are just big enough to walk through and only one person at a time can enter the bathroom. We booked (and paid!) for a 3-person bedroom but all that actually exists is a two bed room with a soft couch, thus not a proper third bed. We were told the three bed rooms only faced the back of the builiding, which was about a meter away from the adjacent builiding, therefore letting absolutely no light in. Almost made claustrophobics of us; we ended up nicknaming our room the Bunker. There was no discussing for a change of type room without charge, and after about 10 minutes of exchanges, no solution was offered nor any compensation. Still, having booked 5 months ahead, we got a rate of EUR 158, so a four star at that price is still a good deal. I would return but not for a triple room, so just make sure you don't get a rear-facing room!

Reviews.Title: “Really excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Blomsterpistol
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the U232 for 4 nights and we loved everything about it. The only thing we missed were English tv-channels, everything else is excellent. Our room was big and beautyifully furnished, and the staff was always very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is not included in the price but it was worth every penny of the 13 euros. The hotel is about 20 minutes from the Rambla on foot and there are loads of nice bars and restaurants in the area. We are definetely coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: eileenEngland
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful three night stay in this hotel and would certainly return. There were four of us, three adults and one teenager. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were lovely and plenty of choice. We had a late return flight home, but the hotel staff were very helpful and stored our suitcases away safe for us for the day after we had checked out, free of charge. There was toilet and washroom facilities for us to use before our flight home. They ordered us a taxi to the airport whilst we had a drink in the bar. The rooms were brilliant, we had two double, one at the front of the hotel overlooking comte d'urgell and one at the rear with a lovely balcony. Not as good a view at the back, but we were happy. Beds were large and very comfortable. Air conditioning was brilliant and we needed it because the temperature at night was 26 degrees. Bathrooms were very good one had a bath and shower and the other a shower which were lovely. All four of us remarked how nice the hotel was and we would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Very confortable and a good value”
Reviews.Author: ACampos
Reviews.Content: The U232 is very well located, close to Avigunda Diagonal, one of the most important avenues in Barcelona. I have stayed many times there for business and personal trips. The rooms are very confortable, good beds (even if they are not the best) and very clean bathrooms. My only negative comment is the quality of the food in the room service, I asked for a club sandwich and it was not very good, compared with the club sandwich that you can get in any international chain hotel. I can not say anything regarding breakfast or dinner since I have not eaten there. Overall very good experience !! I will recommend the U232 for its quality and very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: RAB-LA
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay in Europe, but I was prepared with how small the hotel rooms would be as well as the potential issues with the bathroom (half glass shower door). The front desk staff were extremely amicable and helpful, especially when inquiring about toursites and the best ways to get there. Though we had some issues functioning the shower (though there was a full shower door, using the shower full blast caused the bathroom to flood - using the portable shower head fixed the issue), the staff responded to this repair right away. The complimentary internet service and relaxing library were unexpected, yet very appreciated amenities. The room was very modern looking and clean, though I would have appreciated some English channels on the TV. I would definitely stay at this location again, though note that it is located just north of the Eixample district, which is a little ways away from the "downtown" of Barcelona (near Las Ramblas).

Reviews.Title: “Jolly good choice”
Reviews.Author: Cautious_explorer
Reviews.Content: An excellent choice for a few days in Barcelona. What's with the picture on the tripadvisor webpage, though ? I don't know what it is, but this red thing is not the hotel. U232 is smart without being silly, efficient without being slick, friendly without being creepy, and good to retreat to when you need a break from the sightseeing. Gratifyingly huge bath; chilling air-con. Did not take breakfast there, but the bakery two blocks down the street was marvellous. Only hiccup is the ongoing work on the metro interchange between L3 and L5 at Diagonal station, which makes the journey to and from the town centre a little longer and more awkward than it will be when the work is done.

Reviews.Title: “surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: travelbugitaly
Reviews.Content: a girlfriend and i stayed 3 nights at the U232. we loved it. we got to our room and to our surprise, there were two bathrooms. that made our trip. we spent very little time in the room, but when we came back late at night, we retreated into our bathrooms, and then into our single beds. we thought this a very novel idea. there should be more of it! of course there is always a trade off, but as we were only sleeping in the room, we didn't mind that the window had no view, only into a inner space/courtyard. the air conditioning on the last night was warmish, but other nights it coped well. no complaints. the staff were friendly and very helpful. we didn't much like the 50 euro charge to extend to a late check out, so forwent that. the breakfasts were sensational - you could have almost anything, hot, cold, fruit, cereals, pastries, cheeses, meats, eggs. even peppermint tea. towels were good, sheets clean, decor very trendy and comfortable. this was exceptionally good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Cheerful”
Reviews.Author: Stooginho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during peak season, and at under 200 quid for 4 nights the price is fantastic for central Barcelona. Anywhere nearer to La Ramblas at that time of year costs an arm and a leg! It's a short walk to the tube station, a couple of stops and you are at La Ramblas. Tubes run til quite late, but after that taxis back to the hotel are reasonable. The room was nice - nice bed, good size bathroom and mini bar restocked every day (drinks not included) . Would definately stay here again next time.
